column2: Role & responsibilities     A Talent Management Professional is responsible for developing and implementing talent management strategies, policies, and programs that align with a companys business goals and support its talent acquisition, retention, and development objectives. This includes managing performance, employee engagement, leadership development, succession planning, and diversity and inclusion initiatives. Heres a rundown of the job duties these professionals are often responsible for. Develop and Implement Talent Management Strategies Talent management specialists are responsible for developing and implementing strategies, policies, and programs that align with business objectives and support talent acquisition, retention, and development. Manage Employee Performance These professionals must oversee the employee performance management process, which includes setting goals, performing evaluations, providing individual feedback, and coaching them as needed. Invest in Talent Development Talent managers develop and deliver training and development programs to enhance the skills and capabilities of the workforce, including leadership development programs to identify and develop high-potential employees for future leadership roles. Succession Planning Professionals in a talent management role are responsible for developing and implementing succession planning strategies to ensure a pipeline of qualified internal candidates for critical roles. Prioritize Diversity and Inclusion Professionals in talent management must develop and implement diversity and inclusion initiatives to create a more inclusive and equitable workplace. Analyze Data Talent management professionals analyze talent data to identify trends, gaps, and opportunities for improvement. Partner with HR and Business Leaders These professionals should regularly partner with HR business partners and leaders to drive talent initiatives supporting their business strategy. Maintain Positive Candidate Experiences Talent managers should collaborate with the recruiting team to ensure a positive candidate experience that attracts and retains top talent. Required Skills Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in talent management or a related field. Must have good exposure in Global role managing a small and medium sized team Strong leadership abilities with the ability to inspire and motivate others to achieve results. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Strategic thinker with the ability to design and implement talent management initiatives that align with organizational goals. Demonstrated experience in talent acquisition, development, and retention strategies. Solid understanding of HR practices and employment laws. Proficient in using HRIS systems and talent management software. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to collect and analyze data to inform talent management decisions. Exceptional organizational and project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines. Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and changing environment and drive change within the organization. Commitment to continuous learning and professional development in the field of talent management.   Perks and benefits   Work Location - Anywhere in India must be flexible to travel as per the business requirement Should be flexible with work schedule

column1: LR Academy Learning and Development Coordinator
column2: As a Talent and Learning Coordinator at Lloyds Register, the primary responsibility is to facilitate the coordination, implementation, and evaluation of training programs and initiatives within the organisation. You will work closely with another Coordinator, as well as the Talent and Learning Operations Lead, the Talent and Leadership Lead, the business TLBPs (Talent and Learning Business Partners), and the wider Talent and Learning COE (Centre of Excellence) team leads to ensure seamless execution of training activities that align with organisational goals.                          ?           Key Responsibilities:                       Training Programme Coordination:    Coordinate the planning, scheduling, and logistics of training programs, workshops, and events, ensuring smooth execution and adherence to timelines.               Training Coordination Support:    Provide logistical support for internal and external training events, including venue booking, equipment setup, catering arrangements, and participant communications.               Training Administration:    Manage training records, attendance, and evaluations using learning management systems (LMS) or other tracking tools, maintaining accurate and up-to-date training documentation.               Training Evaluation and Reporting:    Collect and analyse training feedback and evaluation data to assess the effectiveness of training programs and make recommendations for continuous improvement.               Trusted Advisor:    Serve as a trusted advisor to the business, providing guidance and support in implementing effective training solutions that address skill gaps and support business objectives.               Stakeholder Relationships:    Build and nurture relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including internal clients and external partners. Respond to queries in learning programme inboxes in a professional and timely manner.                Financial Tracking:    Manage purchase orders, process invoices and support Operations Lead with tracking spend of training activities to allow effective reporting on talent and Learning Spend.                Collaboration:    Collaborate with Talent and Learning Leads and key business stakeholders around the core operational elements of the Talent and Learning activities               Continuous Learning:    Stay updated on emerging trends, best practices, and innovations in training and development methodologies, incorporating new ideas and technologies to enhance training delivery and effectiveness.               Process Efficiency:    Identify areas for improvement in talent and learning systems, processes, and procedures to ensure they are effective and efficient to meet business requirements.                     Key Health & Safety Responsibilities:                       Risk Management:    Review and regularly update the health and safety risk register to eliminate or minimise employee exposure to risks. Apply appropriate controls, communicate the results of risk assessments, and ensure health and safety considerations in all talent and learning activities.               Compliance:    Ensure compliance with health and safety rules, instructions, systems, and legal requirements for yourself and your team. Provide suitable training and ensure adequate resources are available to work safely.                     Technical / Professional Requirements:                     Experience of managing senior stakeholders and have a proven track record in core HR competencies and exposure to the associated risks.              Comprehensive knowledge of HR processes and Talent and Learning best practise.             Proven experience of training coordination or event managements.             The ability to work collaboratively, consult effectively and independently with senior levels of the organisation.,             The ability to work in a high performing motivating supportive and collaborative team environment.             Excellent verbal and written communication skills to address diverse organisational stakeholders.              Experience or exposure to Project management skills             Detail orientated with ability to work independently on own initiative and prioritise workload.             Proficiency in the English language commensurate with the work.                   In this role, you will play a crucial part in developing and nurturing talent within Lloyds Register, ensuring alignment with the organisations strategic goals and fostering a culture of learning and growth. Your expertise will contribute to the continued success and competitive positioning of Lloyds Register.
column11: Training coordination, LMS, Lead Operations, Diversity and Inclusion, Scheduling, Risk management, Continuous improvement, Catering, Operations, Logistics

column2: Role & responsibilities     Determine training needs and requirements for our diverse teams (Project Teams, support functions, and leadership teams) by working closely and collaborating with stakeholders, subject matter experts, leadership team and performing thorough learnings needs analyses. Assess and strategize L&D needs of the organization working closely with stakeholders. Identify training needs and perform skill gap analysis across projects. Execution and operating training programs / batches at a large scale Monitor and improve the performance of the Training Experience Work with COEs to identify key learning objectives and course outline. Identify enterprise-wide learning needs, come up with innovative learning solutions. Manage development programs end to end, establishing processes to streamline and methods to evaluate success metrics including strategy, co-ordination, facilitation, and communication. Leverage data insights to drive, modify and create future learning offerings. End to end management of LMS platform, Manage training lifecycle from development to implementation. Supporting in preparing and maintaining various Training reports, Monthly MIS, and Training Dashboards Stay abreast of current market or technology trends. Contribute to the introduction of new methods and processes for improving training delivery and development. Preferred candidate profile     Post-Graduation in Human Resources or equivalent 8 to 12 years of experience in HR with at least 5 years in L&D Natural curiosity/affinity for tools and technology, ability to flourish in a changing environment. Ability to curate technical training programs is must. Demonstrated leadership, communication, change management, and project management skills. Experience in global and regional working teams Vendor partner collaboration and continuous assessment of internal capability. Ability to influence and partner across different levels of the organization to achieve results. Perks and benefits

S/he will be responsible for attracting, engaging and retaining a team of competent employees, creating a high-performance and positive work culture The role includes independent management of 2 full-time high-potential resources to deliver on the following: Manpower planning and module management Lead Attrition control and retention enhancement measures Creation and roll-out of effective employee engagement programs, in line with the central HR Strategy  Be the torchbearer for culture & values in the channel Lead Talent Management initiatives for the channel  Provide specialist coaching, support & influence that enables key Business deliverables. Drive moderation of ratings for the assigned patch and assist the business heads in making promotion decisions Support business in decision making (Fitment) & allocation of compensation quantum for the assigned patch. column2: Responsibilities   Develop and maintain the organization's Management Information System (MIS) to ensure      accurate and timely availability of data for decision-making processes. Evaluate, select, and implement appropriate hardware and software solutions to support the organization's MIS objectives. Develop and enforce data management policies and procedures to ensure data integrity,      security, and compliance with regulatory requirements. Collaborate with various departments to understand their data management needs and provide guidance and support in establishing efficient data collection, storage, and retrieval processes. Monitor and analyze the performance of the MIS to identify areas for improvement, implement upgrades, and troubleshoot any issues to minimize downtime. Conduct regular data audits to identify and resolve data quality issues, ensuring the      accuracy and reliability of data used for reporting and analysis. Train and support end-users in utilizing the MIS effectively, guiding data entry, extraction, and interpretation. Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in MIS technology to identify      opportunities for innovation and improvement within the organization. Collaborate with IT teams and vendors to manage system integrations and data interfaces      with other business applications. Prepare and present reports and analyses derived from MIS data to support strategic      decision-making processes.   Requirements Strong technical knowledge and experience in managing complex Management Information      Systems. Proficient in database management and data analysis tools. Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills to identify and resolve system issues. Ability to develop and implement data management policies and procedures. Strong project management skills to lead and coordinate system upgrades and      implementations. Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively interact with stakeholders      at various levels. Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities to interpret complex data and provide      insights. Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to understand their business      needs and translate them into technology solutions. Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and integrity. Strong leadership and interpersonal skills to effectively manage a team and foster a      positive working environment.   Qualifications Bachelors degree in management information systems, Computer Science, or a related field. A master's degree is preferred. Minimum of 5 years of experience in managing Management Information Systems, preferably      in a supervisory role. Strong knowledge of database management systems, such as SQL and Oracle. Experience with data analysis tools and software, such as Microsoft Excel, Power BI, or      Tableau. Proven experience in system upgrades, integrations, and project management. Familiarity with data security and privacy regulations, such as GDPR or HIPAA. Professional certifications related to MIS or project management are desirable. Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities. Strong leadership and management skills to effectively lead a team.
column11: Database Management System, Advanced Excel, Decision Making, Power Bi, Problem Solving, Tableau, Management Skills, Management Information System, Leadership Skills, SQL

column2: HR BUSINESS PARTNER & ENGAGEMENT   About the Gurus Founded in 2014, Chargeback Gurus helps businesses protect and recover revenue by providing innovative chargeback management solutions and AI insights powered by our proprietary FPRONE platform.   By understanding our clients needs and fully aligning with their goals, we help them reduce chargebacks and increase win rates to maximize revenue recovery. Our technology solutions use powerful data science and predictive AI analytics, combined with deep industry expertise to deliver hundreds of millions of dollars in recovered revenue to our clients.   CBG has a strong presence in Chennai, the fintech capital of India and within the US fintech industry. CBG has been operating in India for eight years, during which the company has consistently grown in terms of revenue and manpower. CBGs Chennai office serves as the company's Operations and Product R&D hub, with a strong 400+ member team driving their innovation and growth. The India team's game-changing AI-ML-based innovations are instrumental in the global success of CBG.    CBG has won numerous awards and accolades, including multiple Stevie Awards, and being named in Silicon Review 50 Fastest Growing Companies, GRCs Top 10 Fraud Management Solution and Digital Bankers Global Innovation Award. CBG mitigation strategies have helped thousands of merchants increase customer retention, improve brand satisfaction and drive repeat purchases. As a premier employer in the US and Chennai India, come join the CBG family. For more information, visit www.chargebackgurus.com.    We are currently looking to hire an energetic, highly motivated, can-do attitude individual to join our team.  Duties and Responsibilities: HR Business Partner with experience building and leading ??ntire hire to retire??processes. Must establish and maintain a people centric culture and possess maturity to interact and influence a strong executive team and key stakeholders. Serves as a business partner/advisor to the business stakeholders regarding organizational and key management directives.  Maintains strong partnerships with internal and external stakeholders to achieve Company goals and objectives. Ensures compliance with laws and regulations relevant to HR practices, policies, and programs.  Maintains in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks, and ensuring regulatory compliance. Ensures recruiting and retention strategies meet the human capital needs of the company; develops terms for new hires, promotions, and transfers. This would require collaborating with the Talent Acquisition Lead. Maintains a robust talent management process; provides guidance and input on business unit restructures, workforce planning and succession planning. Maintains a robust performance management process that fosters a culture of high performance, coaching and candid feedback; provides day-to-day performance management guidance to line management (e.g., coaching, counselling, career development, disciplinary actions). Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough, and objective investigations. Champions diversity efforts across the Company. Drives talent & employee engagement initiatives as per business requirements.  Identify the process gaps or best practices to be incorporated in business partnering and operations side.  Work closely with HR Leadership to understand the business priorities and act accordingly.  Comply with laid down SLAs, TATs, etc., to offer seamless employee experience.  Work as a sounding board and guiding hand in all matters of HR, organization development and policy amendment.    Job Requirements: Strong business acumen (FinTech experience preferred). Demonstrated change management and project management capabilities. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  Proven stakeholder management and ability to develop strong working relationships across the Company.  Influence and Negotiation, ability to read a situation and act in a direct, forceful yet diplomatic manner to develop trust and openness of business stakeholders to consider alternatives.   Familiarity with data collection methods, both quantitative and qualitative; ability to set up and track relevant HR metrics and KPIs and use them to drive business results. Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines. Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software. Minimum of 8 years of experience as a HR Business Parter. Deep knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines, including compensation practices, organizational diagnosis, diversity, performance management, and federal and state respective employment laws. MBA in Human Resources (HR) required.

column2: We are looking for a talented and dynamic Training and Induction Specialist to join our Organization. This is a fulltime/direct hire position. If this is something that interests you, apply Today. Role & responsibilities     1.  Training Program Development: Collaborate with department managers and subject matter experts to identify training needs. Design, develop, and update training materials, including presentations, manuals, and e-learning modules. Create engaging and interactive training content that aligns with adult learning principles. Incorporate feedback and evaluation data to continuously improve training programs. 2.  Induction Programs: Plan and execute effective orientation programs for new hires. Ensure new employees have a smooth on boarding experience. Introduce company culture, policies, and values during orientation. 3.  Training Delivery: Conduct training sessions using various methods such as in-person, virtual, and self-paced e-learning. Monitor and assess the effectiveness of training delivery methods. Adapt training techniques to accommodate diverse learning styles. 4.  Evaluation and Assessment: Develop assessment tools and metrics to measure training effectiveness. Gather and analyze feedback from participants to make necessary improvements. Evaluate the impact of training on employee performance and organizational goals. 5.  Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in training and development. Recommend and implement improvements to training programs based on industry changes. Participate in professional development to enhance personal skills and knowledge. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Education, or a related field (Master's degree preferred). Proven experience in designing and delivering effective training and Induction programs. Strong communication and presentation skills. Excellent organizational and project management skills. Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams. Certification in training and development is a plus. Strong experience in creating  Power Point Presentations .

column2: Step into a transformative role at Reckitt and unleash your potential as a TA Sourcer. You are the matchmaker, the connector, the one who discovers top talent and sparks meaningful careers. Your responsibilities           - Craft and execute innovative strategies to identify the best candidates, engaging with both active and passive talent.   - Collaborate with business leaders to understand and meet Reckitts talent needs, creating robust pipelines for current and future roles.   - Screen candidates with precision to align top-notch talent with Reckitts values and goals.   - Stay ahead of the curve on industry and regional sourcing trends, using this knowledge to inform your sourcing methods.   - Foster our employer brand, turning potential candidates into eager applicants and new hires.   - Guide and provide expert advice on local sourcing strategies, helping to shape our approach to talent acquisition.                   ?       The experience were looking for               - Proven experience or understanding of sourcing and talent screening processes.   - Strong project management capabilities and savvy in organising multiple tasks.   - Confident in communication and building relationships with colleagues and candidates at all levels.   - Adept at leveraging social media and professional networks for candidate engagement.   - Track record of cultivating diverse candidate pools, ensuring inclusivity in the talent acquisition process.   - Analytical aptitude to use data in improving sourcing activities and meeting KPIs.   - Committed to fostering a candidate experience that reflects Reckitts collaborative and caring culture.                     ? column2: On-ground Execution: Provide on-ground support in the design, development, and end to end implementation of agroforestry and watershed management projects.                  Technical Expertise: Provide technical guidance and support to farmers and communities on agroforestry practices, including tree selection, planting techniques, and integration with crops.                 Watershed Management: Contribute to watershed development projects by conducting surveys, preparing technical and financial plans, and implementing soil and water conservation measures.                 Project Management: Assist in the planning, implementation, and monitoring of agroforestry and watershed development projects to ensure successful outcomes.                 Capacity Building: Conduct training workshops and demonstrations for farmers and communities on agroforestry and watershed management practices to enhance their knowledge and skills.                 Monitoring and Evaluation: Collect data, monitor project progress, and prepare reports to assess the impact of our initiatives and inform future interventions.                 Collaboration: Work effectively with government agencies, NGOs, and other stakeholders to promote agroforestry and watershed management initiatives and foster collaboration for greater impact.           Mandatory Qualification and Experience:           Bachelors degree in Agriculture, Environmental Science or related field; Masters degree preferred.                 Minimum 5 years of progressive experience in designing, managing, and implementing agricultural development programs, with a strong focus on sustainable or regenerative agriculture.                 Deep understanding of regenerative agriculture principles and practices, with proven experience applying them in the Indian context.                 Demonstrated expertise in research, data analysis, and program evaluation, with a track record of producing high-quality reports and recommendations.                 Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills, with the ability to build and maintain effective relationships with diverse stakeholders.                 Strong leadership qualities, with the ability to inspire, motivate, and mentor team members towards achieving shared goals.                 Fluency in English and Hindi required; proficiency in local languages of target regions preferred.

column2: GDS? a member of the global integrated service delivery center network by EY, Managed Services (MS) is a significant part of our business, comprising more than $7b in revenue with major clients across the globe. We help clients with people based, asset based & integrated solutions, leveraging our deep sector and domain expertise to deliver enhanced value to our clients. In MS we are also ambitious, seeking to more than double our success in the future. The opportunity The purpose of this position is to provide the engagement governance and operational delivery discipline and expertise required to deliver 1) a managed service engagement that spans multiple service lines or 2) multiple managed services on one client.? The role is required to provide seamless, consistent client experience irrespective of underlying service line delivery. Its objective is to integrate all service lines / multiple solutions into one common service to the client and has overall responsibility for effective service delivery (apart from cost) on behalf of the Cross service integration executive / lead partner.? We may also wish to deploy a single Cross solution Service Integration Lead onto multiple accounts where their responsibility focuses solely on driving operational Managed Services excellence through contracts. The Global MS Cross Solution - Service Integration Lead will oversee all aspects of an engagement (understood as the end-to-end delivery, including technology, process and people) and works with the various engagement leaders to improve performance and deliver results and outcomes which are in line with the respective cost baselines as sold??and EYs related MS contractual obligations. This role will also play an integral part in providing the operational delivery discipline and seamless, consistent client experience irrespective of underlying service line delivery. This role will focus on delivering services across the following topics Delivery Consistency across Solutions Competence development and ramp up for the specific offering Risk assessments when applicable to the offering and on specific engagements Transformation/change management across offerings and engagements Technology/analytics enablement across offerings and engagements On boarding/Transition and Data Operations of related engagements Quality Assurance & Remediation Training Your key responsibilities This position owns the end-to-end delivery of the defined Managed Services offering to enable growth plan/s.? Brand and eminence ??extend our reputation in the marketplace Grow related capabilities through people development, new hires, and service line alignment and develop the appropriate third-party relationships with the various stakeholders in the supply chain of the specific offering Assessing and owning any Cross-Service Line delivery improvement plans Connecting all the SDCs (Service Delivery Centers).? Site leaders for specific offering will be coordinated by this role and Account Delivery Leaders will have a dotted line into it as well Taking the lead on managing senior client escalations that span multiple solutions, responsible for resolving significant delivery issues raised Assisting the resolution of the more complex service incidents by helping drive and direct how to resolve the incidents. Demonstrated ability in creating high-quality, visually appealing presentations, with proficiency in presentation software such as PowerPoint.  Solid organizational and project management skills, with a proven track record of effectively managing deadlines and coordinating complex projects.  Exceptional written and verbal communication abilities, capable of clearly articulating complex information in an engaging manner.  Proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and familiar with project management software.  Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and integrity. This position is ideal for someone who is passionate about supporting the execution of HR projects, excels in a support role, and possesses the analytical skills necessary to contribute to the strategic aspects of HR initiatives.

column2: The Talent Acquisition Operations Lead plays a critical role in supporting the talent acquisition function within an organization. This position focuses on managing and optimizing the operational aspects of the talent acquisition process to ensure efficiency, effectiveness, and a positive candidate experience. The specialist collaborates closely with recruiters, HR teams, and hiring managers to streamline processes, implement best practices, and leverage technology to enhance the overall talent acquisition function.               ?         Key Responsibilities:                 Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for process optimization and implement strategies to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the talent acquisition process. Continuously review and refine recruitment workflows, tools, and technologies to streamline operations.         Applicant Tracking System (ATS) Management: Oversee the administration and maintenance of the ATS, ensuring accurate data entry, system updates, and compliance with data privacy regulations. Train and support recruiters and hiring managers in utilizing the ATS effectively.         Reporting and Analytics: Develop and maintain recruitment metrics and analytics reports to assess the effectiveness of talent acquisition strategies, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to stakeholders. Utilize data-driven approaches to optimize recruitment processes.         Vendor Management: Coordinate relationships with external vendors, such as job boards, recruitment agencies, background check providers, and other talent acquisition service providers.         Compliance and Policy Adherence: Stay up to date with labor laws, regulations, and best practices related to talent acquisition. Ensure compliance with all relevant laws and company policies throughout the recruitment process, including candidate screening, interviews, and job offers.         Candidate Experience: Collaborate with the talent acquisition team to enhance the candidate experience at all stages of the recruitment process. Implement strategies to ensure prompt communication, provide helpful resources, and gather feedback to continually improve the candidate journey.         Training and Support: Develop and deliver training materials, workshops, and resources to educate recruiters, hiring managers, and other stakeholders on talent acquisition processes, best practices, and tools. Provide ongoing support and guidance to ensure adoption and adherence to established processes.         Project Management: Lead or participate in talent acquisition projects, such as employer branding initiatives, recruitment marketing campaigns, process automation, and diversity and inclusion efforts. Manage project timelines, deliverables, and cross-functional collaboration.                  Qualifications and Skills:               Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).             Proven experience in talent acquisition, recruitment operations, or a similar role.             Strong understanding of end-to-end recruitment processes, tools, and technologies.             Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and proficiency in utilizing HR software and reporting tools.             Analytical mindset with the ability to collect, analyze, and interpret recruitment data and metrics.             Excellent project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.             Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders.             Attention to detail, organization, and problem-solving abilities.             Knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and compliance best practices.             Experience with process improvement methodologies and a commitment to continuous improvement.             Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, dynamic environment and handle ambiguity.
column11: BPO, Talent acquisition, Process improvement, Analytical, Social media, Outsourcing, Operations, Analytics, Data entry

column2: Job Title: Manager - Learning & Development (L&D)    Role & responsibilities     Job Overview:  We are seeking a proactive and dynamic Manager of Learning & Development to lead our Development and Advancement (DnA) initiatives. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing leadership, managerial, communication, and soft skills development programs to enhance skills and foster a culture of learning and continuous improvement across our organization. This role will collaborate closely with leaders and stakeholders to assess training needs, develop curriculum, and measure the success of training programs. Key Responsibilities: Development Trainings:  Partner with senior managers and directors to create and launch a Leadership Development Program focused on enhancing leadership skills. Conduct needs assessments, set training objectives, and identify suitable vendors. Develop curriculum, present to the Executive Leadership Team (ELT), and incorporate feedback. Roll out program phases, measuring success, ROI, and certification rates. Impart quarterly Management Development sessions to foster leadership skills and promote consistency in management practices. Conduct comprehensive needs assessments, involve stakeholders, and tailor curriculum modules to address identified needs. Assess session effectiveness and make necessary improvements for enhanced outcomes. Impart training sessions to support team leads in becoming effective people managers and improving overall performance. Establish precise learning objectives, develop a well-organized curriculum, and incorporate input from stakeholders. Assess success and classify assessment rates for additional analysis and potential integration of refresher training. Communication and Soft Skills Training: Create and execute communication and soft skills training initiatives to elevate interpersonal abilities, teamwork, and collaborative efforts. Evaluate training requirements, design appropriate curriculum and modules, and actively involve stakeholders for input. Deploy training programs consistently throughout the year and gauge their effectiveness through thorough measurement. Technical and Functional Competency Development: Conduct Technical Training Needs Analysis to identify relevant certifications. Source courses from reputable e-learning platforms and ensure accessibility in G classrooms. Regularly communicate to enhance engagement and monitor certification completion rates. Self-Paced E-Learning Modules: Create, upload, and oversee engagement for self-paced learning e-modules focusing on behavioural and communication skills within G-Classrooms. Promote availability, track engagement and certifications through assessments, and foster engagement through leaderboards and quizzes. Develop technical E-modules for both Centres of Excellence. Collaborate with subject matter experts (SMEs) to procure content from business units and create e-modules. Global Intranet:  Develop and maintain Global company intranet site, ensuring timely updates and tracking engagement. Additional Responsibilities:  Conduct comprehensive reviews with stakeholders to ensure content quality and accuracy, promote availability on G-Classrooms, and monitor engagement and completion rates. Consolidate training and communications into a single Learning Management System (LMS) portal, validate LMS vendors, and oversee implementation. Conduct engaging Business induction program as part of Employee Onboarding Design and publish an Annual Learning and Development (L&D) Calendar based on organizational and role-specific training needs. Evaluate costs and return on investment of planned training programs to ensure adherence to defined budgets. Perform regular quality assessments to identify and address compliance issues or deficiencies. Prepare Quarterly and annual Learning and Development (L&D) Dashboards and reports for management presentation. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in human resources, Organizational Development, Education, or related field. Masters degree preferred. 10+ years of experience in learning and development, training, or related field. Strong understanding of instructional design principles, adult learning theory, and leadership development strategies. Experience in curriculum development, program implementation, and evaluation. Proficiency with learning management systems (LMS) and e-learning platforms. Excellent communication, collaboration, and project management skills. Ability to analyze data, measure training effectiveness, and make data-driven decisions. Certification in training and development (e.g., CPLP, CPTM) is a plus. Benefits: Competitive salary Comprehensive health and wellness benefits package Retirement savings plan with employer matching Opportunities for professional development and career advancement Dynamic and inclusive work environment Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits

column2: As a Talent Acquisition Business Partner at Sanofi Hub, Hyderabad, your expertise in talent acquisition management, hiring strategies, service delivery and your ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders will be critical to meet the Hub talent needs and drive business success.           You will work closely with the Talent Acquisition Lead, India HUB in shaping the Recruitment Strategy for the assigned positions aligned with the Business and Talent Strategy.         Managing the entire recruitment process for all open positions within the defined scope, which includes sourcing, screening, assessing, and selecting candidates.         Proactively share the Talent and Market intelligence reports to stakeholders and    then develop an effective hiring strategy accordingly.           Own and lead the Talent Acquisition agenda for the assigned positions and ensure continuous improvement of quality of hires, time to hire with a strong focus on Hiring Managers and Candidate Experience.         Work closely with local business HR & TA Partners, stakeholders, talent management, communication, and procurement to ensure alignment, continuous improvement and understanding of recruitment operations. You will be a member of the Sanofi global TA Network and manage team.         Closely monitor key SLAs/KPIs of TA service delivery and ROI on technology and attraction strategies.         Establish trusted advisor relationships with functional heads and key collaborators to ensure talent acquisition remains a key focus area in strategic planning.         You will manage end-to-end recruitment processes, utilizing diverse sourcing channels to attract qualified candidates.             Support in creating Employee Value Proposition (EVP) relevant to the hub, in collaboration with Lead Talent Acquisition and hub employer branding team.             You will work closely with Country Talent Management team to ensure that we have a holistic view of the best available internal and external talent.             You will bring in a data driven approach and showcase ROI through impactful metrics.         Drive a strong Talent Assessment process    to ensure delivery of best talent   .         Work closely with P&O, hiring managers, and colleagues to enhance the hiring manager and candidate experience.         Maintain data compliance across TA systems and tools (Workday, Job boards, social media etc).         Provide period hiring status reports to business stakeholders.             About you     As a company, we have identified our Sanofi Hubs as a key investment area. In this role, you can come in and Manage Talent Acquisition for entire recruitment process for all open positions within the defined scope of Hyderabad Hub.         Significant expertise in India Talent Acquisition role (5+ Yrs.), with strong focus on local employment market dynamics, experience of same in GBS (Global Business Services) organizations will be an added advantage.         Subject matter expert and innovator in talent acquisition and recruitment process outsourcing/insourcing         Experience in designing, implementing, and running TA projects across businesses and geographies.         Good knowledge and understanding of recruiting methods, assessment and selection, recruitment marketing / Employer Brand activation and Talent Intelligence         Good Project Management skills and ability to drive results, demonstrating a strong business acumen with an understanding of how strategic talent acquisition impacts the business.         Proficiency in spearheading Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DE&I) initiatives within the recruitment agenda.         Experience in vendors relationship management.         Solution oriented attitude with the right balance of innovation and pragmatic creativity          High collaboration, engagement, and customer focus in a matrix environment         You have a strong executive presence and act as a talent advisor.         You are fluent in English.         You have a bachelor s degree.           Why should you consider this role?           You will be a part of the Talent Acquisition, Hubs Team and play an important role as we evolve our Talent Strategy. We have ambitious plans and supportive leadership, an exciting time to be part of Talent!         You will be part of a truly diverse cross-cultural team and have impact on a global scale.         You will get an opportunity to develop or strengthen your Talent, HR expertise that could benefit you to a wider role in HR (should that be your preferred career path)         Be part of the larger Sanofi Business Operations Ambition to serve our core purpose of Sanofi i.e.    We chase the Miracles of Science to improve People s Lives.

column2: We are looking for an experienced Learning, OD, and Talent Management professional to execute global talent development strategies, while adapting and implementing for regional needs. This role is highly matrixed in nature and will see you supporting 3 broad areas: Learning & OD (70%), Employee Engagement and Inclusion and Diversity (30%). Consequently, the role-holder will directly report to the Asia TM leader and will work closely with the Global L&D, TM, and I&D leaders.    This position will be responsible for providing talent and learning advisory and managing the execution of learning initiatives, talent management interventions, leadership development, talent planning, succession, career management, employee surveys, actions, outcomes and fostering inclusion and improving diversity by partnering closely with HRBPs and other stakeholders.                 Key Responsibilities     Acculturation of new employees across levels - through new hire orientation, onboarding and assimilation programs, leadership connect and other avenues.   Leads and executes Lam s in-country people development strategy, encompassing all-employee skills development, career management, and educational partnerships.   Partner with HRBPs and other stakeholders to identify and assess people development needs and design and implement solutions to meet specific requirements.   Foster a culture of continuous learning that attracts and retains top talent while providing a distinct competitive advantage.                 Other Job Responsibilities             Proactively diagnose organizational challenges and tailor local solutions for specific needs.    Create, manage, and champion employee engagement programs, culture surveys, employee feedback from leadership connect sessions and other avenues to foster Lam culture & core values.   Act as a consultant and source of knowledge to the business/HRBP in the various organizational development domains and change management processes.   Build, coach and facilitate effective teams through the effective use of tools, team building activities, strategy workshops, leadership, and team off-sites to create an engaged and high-performing team.   Serves as a key learning liaison and expert for the site by performing research, making recommendations, and documenting and sharing knowledge. column2: Where you fit  in The Experience Lead focuses on enabling realization of Shell's Learning Strategy, across both the employee and extended workforce. The Lead brings insight from external benchmarks and best practices and applies Lean/Continues improvement principles for maximum business value, efficiency, and end user experience. Together with the Product Owners, continuously seeks to optimize the usage of systems with a focus on the end user experience at a sustainable cost. What's the role Leads design of HR processes across the Learning and KM ecosystem. In partnership with IDT and the Learning and KM Leadership Tearn, defines the mid-term and long-term ecosystem and digital landscape for Learning and KM. Thinking partner with Process Owner (VP Learning) and relevant Heads (Head of KM and Head of Learning Strategy, LX and Ops) to form mid- to long-term vision of the process and digital capabilities needed to deliver Shell's Learning and KM Strategy. Works in close partnership with Experience Lead Talent and Resourcing and HR Programme Manager Learning Experience Platform (LXP) to realize the full end-to-end vision for the implementation of Skills across Shell. In partnership with the Process Owner, and drawing on the know-how of relevant HR SMEs, proactively identify Cl opportunities and articulate benefits/value. Leads a team of direct reports and indirect "natural team" members across Digital HR, HR IDT and Learning and KM CoE to translate that vision into pragmatic and impactful processes and system solutions. Provides strong line leadership to Product Owner andProcessAnalysts Collaborates with the Learning Process Owner, Head of KM and Head of Learning Strategy, LX and Ops in reviewing performance and setting the forward improvement agenda; ensures clear prioritization based on business value/benefit. Collects feedback from end users to understand their needs and actively test designed solutions with end user forums. Collaborates with HR Service Design & Integration Manager to optimize service delivery in process designs; collaborates with other Experience Leads for end-to-end integration. Partners with the Chief Product Owner and IDT Managers in HR IDT on clearly outlining business requirements for IT solution design. Keeps Journey design, Product Development and System Support for own area aligned in one overall model from design to delivery of solutions within agreed frameworks, standards, and ways of working. Seeks and analyses design input across a broad range of stakeholders from HR operations employees, end users to HR VP' s Brings external best practices and benchmarking data into solution design. Designs or approves process flows and standard operating procedure documentation for HR Operations staff. Delivers robust KPls/performance measures, data definitions & structures, controls, and Service Delivery Model implications in process designs. Reviews and approves/ declines variations to processes. Supports Product Owners in defining a Product Roadmap and provides additional information/business insights to prioritize backlog in conflict situations. Agrees with Product Owner the acceptance criteria and provide 'definition of done' for user stories/epics, to assure the functionality developed is answering the business needs. Delivers test scripts and sign off on test results for all system changes in own Experience area working closely with the DevOps team. Owns data definitions for data that is mastered in her/his user journey and defines data controls including segregation of duties. Defines reporting requirements for their journey and make sure those are aligned with other journeys. Guides Process Analysts in global change cycle activities; supports Process Analysts in providing complete Tier 3 advice and/ or guidance on change request process. Acts as advisor/ escalation point on journey processes. Acts as entry point for all projects/ activities that need support from the members of own team, ensuring robust business cases for all work coming in, no business case no project. Allocates and arranges resources (also outside of own team) to staff projects/ activities where it will create most value in the delivery of people and business value. Acts as functional lead for the activity, or in case of a project, work as the HR Project manager with an assigned HRIT Project Manager, ensuring activities are tracking to planned deadlines. Stays fully aligned to initiatives and activities on other User Journeys that might impact own user journeys and make sure they are all aligned to the goals of the total team. Identifies interdependencies between own Experience team and other Experience teams and flag connected issues and risks between deliverables of the different activities and take action to manage these. Jointly focuses with all Experience Leads on delivering a fully aligned and connected end user experience. For the mid-term, the priority focus is on sustaining and selectively improving the overall Learning digital ecosystem, based on business value, whilst the Learning Experience Platform (LXP) platform is piloted and deployed. This demands close working with the Programme Manager LXP, prioritization and synchronization of change initiatives across the Business As Usual (BAU) and LXP Programme teams - ensuring that impact to the end-to-end user experience is minimized and that full value can be realized from the LXP Programme, whilst progressing the overall Strategic Roadmap for Learning and KM. Throughout this transition, essential compliance-related processes (including Competence and Compliance Assurance- CCA) and external reporting requirements must be sustained and, over time, simplified in dialogue with global Ethics & Compliance. At the same time, there is a need to partner closely with Head of KM reframe the ambition for Knowledge Management for the Enterprise - leveraging newly emerging market standard Generative Al solutions to uplift the value realization for Shell. This is an area of experimentation and discovery, requiring close partnership with the KM CoE, Shell's Al CoE and a range of Business Sponsors. Working across a broad range of stakeholders and able to influence at the VP level and, as needed, at EVP level - establishing effective working relationships across the Learning Leadership Tearn. Establishing and sustaining impactful relationships with third party providers including Workday (learning management solution), EdCast (LXP provider), NIIT (Shell's Learning Ops partner and provider of current CCA solution) - influencing product roadmap where relevant and ensuring insight on upcoming product releases, longer-term product strategy and emerging shifts in the external Learning digital solution vendor environment. Driving effective prioritization of the Cl Agenda to ensure focus on highest value add improvements. Ensuring effective partnership with, and delivery from, the IDT Function Working, communicating, and influencing in a global, virtual organization as well as supporting colleagues in various locations and time zones. Demonstrating consistently a can-do attitude and living the principles of employee centric design, Cl behaviors and agile project management. The Learning Experience team has e2e accountability from Process Design, Data Management to Product Management. Support the team in building the capability and culture of User-experience centred thinking connected to a digital strategy: defining how to evaluate experience, journey maps/design choices from both an employee and line manager perspective What we need from  you The role requires: a highly experienced HR professional with 15+ yrs. experience, 5+ yrs. experience in a leadership position within HR or other similar complex environments. The incumbent should have Learning domain knowledge, ideally including direct involvement in Learning digital solution Programme management and delivery. Strong knowledge of a wide range of HR processes and systems - and where Learning and KM sit in the overall Employee Experience - as well as understanding of the HR IDT organization and ways of working. Tearn leadership capability and the ability to coach and develop more junior team members across the full natural team. Knowledge of Agile project management methodology, Scrum ceremonies and DevOps Ways of Working. Very strong stakeholder management and influencing skills, including coaching of senior stakeholders. Demonstrated ability to look at the long-term, strategic picture and able to balance risk with value. Ability to bring in external perspectives. Experience with user journeys and design thinking. Well-developed communication skills including the ability to communicate at all levels within the organization and to establish and maintain good working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders. Strong collaboration mindset, supporting cross functional (HR & IT) DevOps teams. Strong facilitation skills Demonstrated effectiveness in driving change, influencing outcome and gaining senior management support.

column2: We are looking for Network Security Engineers to protect our clients network from internal and external threats.      Your role will be to assist in the planning, design, troubleshooting and management of networks including the software and hardware upgrades across the entire assets.      This will involve both routine upgrades in line with vendor release cycles and emergency patching in response to threat intelligence alerts.          Key Responsibilities          Prepare upgrades to the most recent/stable software and/or firmware versions on both virtual and physical network devices across a range of vendors, including but not limited to Cisco, Juniper, Check Point and Fortinet.      Analyse device configurations to understand the potential impact of new software versions and plan the appropriate remedial action.      Minimise active network vulnerabilities by managing patching in line with vendor release cycles.      Ensure all Change activity is carried out as in Change Control process and client communications are issued in an informative and timely and thorough fashion.      Respond to critical network vulnerabilities, working with other teams to deploy the appropriate level of resource to ensure our clients are protected.      Execute client device upgrades during agreed maintenance windows both during and outside of business hours.      Essentially this is 8 hours job on normal business hours Monday to Friday. On special conditions, this role may require Monday to Sunday out of hours and on call working where necessary.          Person Specification          Any degree in Computer Science or similar discipline / proven equivalent working experience      Current CCNA, JNCIA or CCSA qualification or be able to demonstrate a similar level of knowledge          Desirable to have Comp          TIA Security+ certification or equivalent working experience      Must have 2+ years of working experience, but not limited to broad range of technologies including routers in datacentre IT support environment.      Experience of working in relevant client facing environments or communication.      An enthusiastic, driven, committed and flexible approach to work      Solutions driven, confident and friendly approach in dealing with clients      Natural initiative and pro-activeness to their method of working      Scheduling, organizational and process management skills      Be open to new ideas and have a positive outlook      Demonstrate value of and delivery of high quality client care with their approach to communication      Excellent standard of written and spoken English      Must be a team player but also able to work on own initiative      High degree of accuracy and attention to detail      Ability to work well to deadlines and under pressure      Good problem solving skills      Keen interest in, and passionate about IT      Experience with the following vendors: Cisco, Juniper, Check Point, Fortinet      Understanding of Monitoring Tools and Patching Automation      Basic understanding of working with Service Level Agreements

column2: Manager / Senior Manager   - Human Resources   Job Title:  Manager / Senior Manager Function: HR Business Partner Name of Job Holder:   Location: Hyderabad  Reports to position: Sr. Associate Director  HR / Associate Director - HR Band: A3   Job Purpose  The HRPB shall support business leaders in the implementation of engagement initiatives, manpower planning and people operations activities to ensure the ongoing success of the organization by having an engaged and motivated workforce. The purpose of the role primarily revolves around ensuring on time execution of various key HR Transformational and Transactional items.   Job Outline  As part of the Human Resources Team at the Indian School of Business, the job holder will work closely to drive the HR priorities and champion the HR initiatives in the facility pertaining to employee hiring, onboarding, productivity and efficiency, and engagement.   Organization Culture and Reinforcement of Values - Institutionalize Organizational Values in employees and processes. Employee Relations & Communications - Employee relation forums that provide an opportunity for employees to connect and bond with management and peers. Enable openness and two-way communication between employees and management through communication forums such as 1-0-1 Meetings, skip level meetings, focused group discussions, ESAT surveys. Talent development and retention including Employee Engagement, Training, Change management, Reward and recognition management. The incumbent is expected to plan & create an engagement calendar and execute various employee engagement activities as per the calendar. Ensure a smooth employee lifecycle, which includes but not limited to Onboarding, Grievance handling, PMS, RnR, Employee satisfaction survey, Exit Interview. Functional Responsibility  The HRBP will handle Organizational Level responsibilities in addition to the Key HR activities to ensure standardization and execution across the locations. This shall include Payroll, C&B, L&D, Event Management, PMS, Audits, etc.  Evaluate and recommend improvements to benefit programs. Develop and manage annual budgets for the department and perform periodic cost and productivity analysis. Prepare HRMIS for the Departments which give clarity and become strategic partners to the stakeholders. Work on Data driven analysis.  Lead various automation and digitalization projects for the department.  Update all changes to employee records in HR files as well as on online tools. Handling external HR vendors Maintaining strict confidentiality while dealing with employee data at all levels. Benchmarking the present HR Practices with the Industry Practices   In addition to managing the above key deliverables, the job holder is expected to assist in various HR projects which may be undertaken at either of the campuses and ensure full support in completion of these time bound projects.   Managing day to day HR operational activities form an integral part of the role and hence, the incumbent is expected to develop thorough understanding of the various HR processes and policies and be able to manage employee queries accordingly.  The job holder is further required to manage Key stakeholders as part of day-to-day functioning and be able to manage escalations, if any, at a local level.   Further, the individual would be required to work closely with Senior AD-HR in designing a road map focused on making ISB a world class institution as an employer and a great place to work and planning various employee level training & key OD initiatives such as 360-degree feedbacks/creation of a Talent Management framework and creation of leadership pipelines/developmental roadmaps for HiPOs.   S.NoKey Responsibilities% Time Spent 1Manpower Planning and Talent Acquisition20%2HR Operations & Query Management20%3Employee Engagement & Staff welfare activities20%4Designing and execution of School level HR initiatives such as Performance Appraisals/360 degree/GPTW/E-Sat surveys & other OD interventions15%5Retaining New Joinees and Employees  Controlling attrition5%6Functional Responsibility (Payroll, C&B, L&D, Event Management, PMS, Audits)20% Total Time Spent on All Responsibilities100%  Job SpecificationKnowledge / EducationSpecific SkillsDesirable Experience MBA in HR Result Oriented Approach with ability to Prioritize. Strong Analytical Skills with excellent command over MS excel. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Stakeholder Management and Interpersonal Skills Good digital & technical acumen. Should have experience in handling HRIS systems. Problem solving skills. Good negotiation skills with a solution-oriented approach Strong Ethics and Discretion Knowledge of SAP_HR Module 6  8 years  Job Interface/RelationshipsInternalExternal All department HODs All Employees Auditors Vendors  Consultants / Trainers    1

column2: 3+ years of talent acquisition experience e.g., recruiting, sourcing, HR experience, or industry experience related to role.          Knowledge and experience hiring technical and Sales skills and utilizing ATS.          Interest and experience using LinkedIn and other tools to be ambassadors and to broadcast the Noventiq Story.          Advanced research/sourcing skills (use of Boolean, social media, and alternative search techniques).          Ability to have meaningful conversations with passive talent and persuasive enough to spark interest.          Naturally driven to deliver results with little supervision, and effectively manage and prioritize multiple projects and candidates.          Ability to drive clarity in ambiguity, define requirements, advise/consult and negotiate when required.          Ability to network within the industry to identify top performers and enjoying hosting both on-site and virtual meetings and events.          Experience with campus recruitment is an added advantage.          Experience in providing analytical and well documented recruiting reports to the Reporting Manager.          Stay active with current job boards, social networks, and platforms to find talent, and plan, create job descriptions.          Experience in Diversity hiring is an added advantage.          Excellent oral and written communication skills, Building Relationships.          Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.          Proficient with MS Office (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint).              About You:                  Stakeholder/Vendor Management          Understands factors relevant to the business and hiring managers needs (e.g., time to hire, location, budget) and uses this knowledge to develop and implement end-to-end hiring plan aligned to the needs of the business group.          Consults a business area on talent needs and opportunities and pushes for the acceptance of differentiated and alternative types of talent (e.g., compete, diverse, nontraditional) that may not be typically considered.          Data Analysis / Hiring Plans/Branding          Research and gather market intelligence. Map our competitors, deliver data driven insight.          Educates and mentors other team members to provide best practice.          Responsible for partner with business leaders and internal recruiters in defining and maintaining core and pivotal pipelines.          Work with regional and global colleagues in creating efficiencies and capacity (including but not limited to automation).          Planning creative solutions to increase candidate awareness for Noventiq (e.g., marketing, media preparation, creative contents).          Candidate Attraction          Elicits interest in active and potential candidates by telling the business story and contributes to the development of new stories. Generates awareness through community outreach events and strategic networking.          Shares best practices on sourcing, recruiting, and/or closing techniques and stories with their own team. Tracks candidate activity and shares with internal stakeholders.                          Candidate Experience          Gathers requirements and develops hiring plans that meet candidate needs throughout the hiring lifecycle. Owns elements of the candidate experience and prepares candidates for next phases of the process. Enhances the candidate experience at all phases of the relationship by proactively identifying factors that may adversely impact the candidate and sharing with the business to mitigate.          Talent Sourcing          Uses an understanding of talent markets and complex candidate profiles, as well as growing relationships with new talent pools and communities with future potential, to identify and engage candidates for immediate and future talent needs.          Develops strategies to generate differentiated talent in emerging roles or highly competitive talent pools to meet long-term business needs (e.g., industry, technical recruiting).          Candidate Assessment Screening          Leverages tools and assessment frameworks to assess candidates for Knowledge Skills, Competencies and Culture attributes. May contribute to the creation of assessment materials by identifying relevant competencies and job criteria.          Executes initial screening and assessing of candidates. Verifies talent pool by assessing relevant factors such as ability to hire, relocation considerations, immigration, and compensation.          Operational Compliance Excellence          Uses subject matter expertise on applying internal and external staffing policies, standards, and/or regulations throughout the entire staffing lifecycle to educate vendors, stakeholders, and other staffers on policy, system, and process issues. Identifies opportunities to optimize policies, systems, and processes.          Maintains current documentation on candidates qualifications and status in the appropriate staffing or tracking system, within compliance guidelines Captures relevant data in recruiting platform and leverages data to inform meaningful insights.          Candidate Onboarding          Organize and manage Employee pre-onboarding, onboarding, Induction, buddy program, assign training in LMS                          What we offer:                  Flexible Work Hours.              Insurance - Group Medical Coverage, Group Personal Accident, Group Term Life Insurance, Parental insurance.              Maternity and Paternity Leaves.              Company Sponsored Certification Program.              LinkedIn Learning.              Learning/Development Courses, Cross Skill, Mentorship, and Leadership Programs.              Quarterly Performance Feedback Sessions.              Savings, Investments, and Retirement Benefits like Sodexo food coupon, LTA, NPS etc.              Rewards and Recognition Program, Employee Referral Program, Wellness Program, and CSR initiatives.              Company Onsite / Fun Events.

column2: We are looking for an HR Intern to join our team and support our clients in their recruitment needs.      As an HR Intern, you will have the opportunity to work on our under-development product and gain hands-on experience in managing jobs, screening resumes, scheduling interviews, and handling various HR tasks.        Your responsibilities will include:        Using our hiring automation software to handle end-to-end hiring processes.      Sourcing and screening CVs based on client requirements.      Conducting telephonic and face-to-face interviews with managers.      Maintaining trackers and MIS for efficient candidate tracking.      Coordinating and scheduling daily line-ups and ensuring timely closure of positions.      Head hunting potential candidates from various online portals.      Posting, updating, and removing job ads from job boards, careers pages, and social networks.      Effectively managing accounts of multiple clients.            Candidate Qualifications:          To be successful in this role, you should possess the following qualifications:        Excellent written and verbal communication skills.      Quick learner with the ability to adapt to changing business needs.      Strong multitasking skills with a positive and proactive attitude.            Required Skills:            The ideal candidate should have familiarity with HRIS, ATS, and resume databases.      Experience with MS Office and a good understanding of full-cycle recruiting processes will be an added advantage.

column2: Job Purpose : Support accurate wind and solar resource assessment to ensure feasibility of installation of power generation units with the objective of increasing the MW capacity for Apraava Energy and improving profitability/revenues. This role is also responsible for analyzing wind and solar plant equipment performance pre-and post-project construction to ensure high power generation efficiency.    2. ORGANI SATIONAL CHART    3. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES    Accountabilities Major Activities Support strategy formulation and budgeting for the Renewables business to drive increased profitability/revenues     Manage Resource data of Renewable power generation to be used as inputs in supporting Renewables strategy and annual business plan formulation      Support business opportunity evaluation checking for feasibility of the project by assessing on -site resource availability for the si te under consideration      Track performance against budgets/business plan and provide monthly updates to the Department Head - Technical Analysis on deviations from the plan along with rationale for the same      Ensure internal/external audit preparedness by time ly collation and maintenance of required documents Oversee performance assessment of individual generating units at operating sites to ensure high power generation efficiency with the objective of increased asset profitability      Supervise performance assessment of the wind assets and the solar asset prior to and post construction      Coordinate with external consultants seeking support in performance analysis (if and where required); organize site visits and ensure timely provision of required data to the consultants      Conducting detailed performance and data ana lysis for individual turbines /solar panels at the assets -identifying trends in machine behaviour, generation, failure etc.; seek approval from the Manager -Technical Analysis/Department Head -Technical Analysis on the same      Study analysed data for deviations in power generation levels from estimated levels and conduct a Root Cause Analysis to provide inputs to the senior in successfully tackling the deviations      Support in validation of performance of wind turbines /solar panels with vendor guarantees and apprise senior to help take suitable action on deviations if any      Interact with site teams on issues with machines and provide options for action items; monitor implementation of agreed action plan Conduct accurate resource ass essment with the objective of increasing renewable power generation capacity and ensuring project profitability      Interface with 3rd party developer for timely installation of the MET Mast at suitable location to enable accurate data collection      Coordinate with the developer to e nsure collection of wind mast data and other inputs (e.g. power curve, contour maps, roughness maps etc.) at pre-defined intervals      Conduct quality checks on collected data and input the same in software for generation of resource availability trends ( long term wind speed and its variations , direction, duration etc.) General Manager -Operations (Renewables)Manager -Renewable ResourceAssistant Manager -Renewable Resource 3      Basis available inputs and wind resource avail ability trends, estimate energy production (at considered site); collate analysis into comprehensive reports      Collaborate with external consultants for support in resource assessment comparing reports for checking for deviations and timely addressing the sa me      Present feasibility study basis analyzed resource data to management thereby supporting business opportunity qualification      Conduct similar due diligence for solar resource assessment Drive timely collection and qualification of data from project sites to ensure accuracy of analysis with the objective of safeguarding Apraava Energy s business aspirations      Collate and maintain collected data for qualification for accuracy      Ensure use of suitable software for data and trend analysis; check output for any disturbance and consult Department Head - Technical Analysis for inputs for judgement on the same      Ensure timely r eview of documentation created from Manager -Technical Analysi s/Department Head -Technical Analysis      Maintain mutually beneficial relationships with 3rd party consultants , forecasting agencies, vendors/service providers for support with forecasting power generation, revenues of each operating site etc.    4. MAJOR CHALLENGES        Coordinating with developer for timely installation of MET -mast at suitable locations      Low degree of automation to manage large volumes of data to produce meaningful output      Geographic spread of Renewable Assets    5. DECISIONS    Decisions made by job holder As per the defined authority matrix Approvals within the budgets defined and decision matrix    Recommendations to or approval by superior Feasibility (in terms of solar/wind resource availability assessment) for new business opportunities    6. INTERACTIONS    Internal Clients    Role s you need to interact with inside the organization to enable success in your day to day work VP BD Commercial ( Renewables ) - support on feasibility study for new business opportunities Finance Team - budget approvals IT Team - support in automation of processes, implementation of software and applications Group Internal Audit - ensure compliance to Apraava Energy guidelines and policies    External Clients Role s you need to interact with outside the organization to enable success in your day to day work MET mast vendors - Support in timely installation of MET -Masts OEM contractors - Support on equipment performance data Service Providers/3rd party consultants - Availability of cost effective and superior services    7. DIMENSIONS    Financial Dimensions      OPex (2016 -17) ~ INR 2.5 Cr      CAPex (2016 -17) ~ INR 5.5 Cr (includes purchasing and upgradation of software, MET mast installation) 8. SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE Educational Qualifications      Mandatory Qualification: B.E/B.Tech Electrical / Mechanical / Electronics Functional Skills      Understanding of operations/key processes of Wind and Solar Farm s      Knowledge of wind and solar resource assessment      Knowledge of wind and solar plant equipment      Understanding of software such as WASP Engineering, Wind farmer, Wind Pro, CFD      Basic atmospheric and meteorological knowledge      Up to date with latest technology in the renewables industry      Commercial understanding of the functioning of the Apraava Energy business      Understanding of financial management      Planni ng and analytical skills, ability to take a long -term perspective    Relevant and total years of Experience      Specific Experience: 5 - 7 Yrs
