column2: The HR Service Administrator is an integral part of IBM and HR. Your goal is to create an outstanding employee experience for IBMers by delivering HR-related services and supporting our employees as they support our customers and clients. Help IBMers to build their career by providing them with a personalized experience. In this role, you can be part of a team that works with all areas of our global organization and is empowered to achieve goals that align with IBM strategy. Your Role and Responsibilities As Assistant ManagerRecruitment, you are responsible  for  working with partners and provide end to end recruitment support. You will work closely with the client, IBM's operation management, and staff. You will define, develop, plan and implement sourcing strategies to provide a qualified talent pool. Take ownership of sourcing life cycle, ensuring process adherence to Service Level Agreements (SLA) as appropriate, and taking actions where necessary to drive to success. Conduct initial assessment of candidate suitability.  Follow new methods with the approach for sourcing candidates and generating new leads Work in conjunction with the business head in the establishment of weekly/quarterly/yearly Global Delivery Center goals Utilize ATS to perform candidate screening (and other program tools) Ensure detailed screening and selection criteria to identify top talent and resolve meaningful strength of the talent in the pool Responsible to achieve transformation at a high level of change management experience, including challenging, inspiring, and leading the team Responsible for tracking and driving all process parameters critical to quality' for process delivery Required Technical and Professional Expertise 6-8 years of experience in recruitment standard methodologies (preferably in ITES BPO FA)  Good verbal and written English language skills Proven experience in People management for any International IT ITES Companies Experience in building rapport and collaborating with Hiring Managers through the open requisition, sourcing, debrief and offer stages  Expertise in sourcing through social media channels and other innovative sourcing channels  Demonstrable experience in partner management and strength to hold difficult conversations with them  Build expertise in deep domain knowledge, understanding of business strategy and drive innovation Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Experience in direct sourcing and recruitment experience in a corporate or consultancy (RPO set up is preferred)  Equipped with consultative instinct, passionate about recruiting and not view the role as transactional Proficiency and experience in Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) will be an advantage  Ambitious individual who can work under their own direction towards agreed targets/goals  Proven change management and be open to it good time management and work under tight deadlines  Demonstrated interpersonal skills while contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed  Maintain technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications

column2: Position The Manager  Resource Management will closely work with the Senior Leadership to consolidate the demand from various projects (including skillsets and duration) and would be responsible for staffing the resources as per the demand and ensuring the assigned team size is maintained across projects. Location:  Hyderabad, Telangana Roles and Responsibilities The roles and responsibilities of Manager  Resource management will include the following: Guide the Resource Management team to consolidate the demand for resources from various projects teams along with skillset requirements by leveraging the staffing tool and work closely with the Senior Management team Ensure the project and resource information on the staffing tool is up to date and accurate real-time Leverage the internal staffing tool to setup staffing processes within the company by working with the Senior Leadership team and adhere to the same regularly on an ongoing basis. Enhance the existing processes to ensure that the staffing processes are scalable with the growth of the organization. Ensure that the onboarding plan is shared with the new joiners, based on role and function, on a timely basis and track the onboarding progress.  Identify any delays in the onboarding progress and do a deep-dive into the root cause of the delay. Accordingly, enhance the processes to address the same. Ensure that the new joiners are staffed on projects immediately after they complete the onboarding. Having conversations with employees (or ensuring Senior Leadership has the conversations) related to any staffing changes before the communication is official Collate feedback on the staffing tool on a real-time basis and work with the technology maintenance team to update the tool as needed Consolidate the skillset information from all employees and maintain accurate and real-time information about the same. Identify opportunities in capturing the employee skillset. Leverage the employee skillset information to identify best-fit staffing options to fulfill the resource demand by working with the Senior Leadership team Leverage the Staffing dashboard to generate regular reports for the Senior Leadership team on weekly/monthly basis Pre-requisites and skillsets required to apply for this role:   At least 5 years of experience in similar roles at mid-size or multinational companies, preferably in Analytics sector Ability to think creatively to identify best-fit staffing options for the demand High-level of fluency in written and verbal communication using professional business language Should exhibit strong leadership skills and have the ability to communicate in an assertive way to negotiate with various teams regarding the resources to match company needs Comfortable in proactively following-up with senior management (as needed) Experience in working on Microsoft Excel and willingness to pick-up knowledge on other internal or third-party staffing tools Why Explore a Career at Merilytics: High growth environment:  Semi-annual performance management and promotion cycles coupled with a strong meritocratic culture, enables fast track to leadership responsibility Cross Domain Exposure:  Interesting and challenging work streams across industries and domains that always keep you excited, motivated, and on your toes. Entrepreneurial Environment : Intellectual freedom to make decisions and own them. We expect you to spread your wings and assume larger responsibilities. Fun culture and peer group:  Non-bureaucratic and fun working environment; Strong peer environment that will challenge you and accelerate your learning curve. Other benefits for full time employees:  Health and wellness programs that include employee health insurance covering immediate family members and parents, term life insurance for employees, free health camps for employees, discounted health services (including vision, dental) for employee and family members, free doctors consultations, counsellors, etc Corporate Meal card options for ease of use and tax benefits Work dinners, team lunches, company sponsored team outings and celebrations Reimbursement support for travel to office, as and when promulgated by the Company.  Cab reimbursement for women employees beyond a certain time of the day Robust leave policy to support work-life balance. Specially designed leave structure to support woman employees for maternity and related requests. Reward and recognition platform to celebrate professional and personal milestones. A positive & transparent work environment including various employee engagement and employee benefit initiatives to support personal and professional learning and development.

column2: We are an IT-based product company and a Great Place to Work certified company.  We are currently hiring for the role of Human Resource Business Partner in Hyderabad for our HRBP function. This position is specifically for experienced professionals with 2 to 5 years of expertise in HR Generalist or HR Business Partner roles. Please note that this opportunity is not suitable for recruitment profiles or freshers. Candidates should be available for immediate joining.   Roles & Responsibilities: Strategic Business Partnership: Collaborate with senior leadership to understand business goals and develop HR strategies to support organizational objectives. Provide proactive HR guidance and support to business units. Employee Engagement: Implement programs to enhance employee engagement, satisfaction, and retention. Conduct regular surveys to gather feedback and initiate action plans based on results. Employee Relations: Act as a liaison between employees and management, fostering positive employee relations and addressing concerns. Conduct investigations and provide resolution for employee relations issues. Performance Management: Oversee the performance management process, guiding managers and employees. Identify opportunities for skill development and career growth. Training and Development: Identify training needs and coordinate with the L&D team to implement relevant training programs. Support career development initiatives for employees. Organizational Development: Assess organizational needs and facilitate organizational change initiatives. Drive initiatives related to culture, diversity, and inclusion. HR Policies and Compliance: Ensure compliance with all HR policies, labor laws, and regulations. Update and communicate changes in HR policies as necessary. Compensation and Benefits: Assist in the design and administration of competitive compensation and benefits programs. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices related to compensation. Qualifications: 2-5 years of progressive HR experience, with a focus on HRBP functions. Strong understanding of the IT and ITES industry. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills. Show meticulous attention to detail in HR processes and initiatives. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. MBA is a must. HR certification (e.g., SPHR, GPHR) is a plus. Only Female Candidates.     Why work with us: If you're looking to make an impact, Pro-Vigil, Inc. is the place for you. We are a young organization that is growing fast. You have the freedom to experiment, learn, and grow with like-minded people. We focus on getting things done through our team of people who bring creativity, energy, and excellence to every engagement. The breadth of what we do means exceptional opportunities for learning and development. We grow when our employees grow, so we give them lots of opportunities to learn and grow. As a group, we are flat and treat everyone the same. Work doesn't always have to be serious; we strive to have activities to keep our employees fun-filled with high energy. Benefits ??Benefits and compensation include competitive salaries, gratuities, and retirement plans. ??Flexible work hours, with opportunities to work from home. ??Comprehensive training and career development program. ??Extensive Insurance Coverage with Group Health Insurance, Group Accident Insurance, and Group Term Life Insurance.  Salary Best in the Industry, Looking for Immediate to 30-Day Joiner.

column2: Job Title:  Executive/Senior Executive  Job Type:  Permanent, Full-time Function:  Human Resources  Business:  Godrej Industries and Associate Companies  Location:  Mumbai, Maharashtra, India About Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies (GILAC) GILAC is a holding company of the Godrej Group. We have significant interests in consumer goods, real estate, agriculture, chemicals, and financial services through our subsidiary and associate companies, across 18 countries.  https://www.godrejindustries.com/ About the role The US Payroll Processing Specialist is responsible for accurately processing payroll for employees in compliance with company policies and government regulations. This role requires attention to detail, strong numerical skills, and a comprehensive understanding of payroll procedures. Key Responsibilities: Process payroll for employees on a regular basis, ensuring accuracy and timeliness. This includes calculating salaries, overtime, bonuses, deductions and full and final settlement of resigned employees etc. Maintain employee payroll data accurately in the payroll system, including new hires, terminations, changes in salary or benefits, and timekeeping records. Stay up to date with federal, state, and local payroll tax laws and regulations to ensure compliance. Prepare and submit payroll taxes and reports accurately and on time. Investigate and resolve payroll discrepancies and issues in a timely manner. Address employee queries regarding payroll matters professionally and promptly. Generate payroll reports as needed for management review, budgeting, and auditing purposes. Provide insights and analysis on payroll data as required. Maintain accurate and organized payroll records and files, ensuring confidentiality and security of sensitive information. Continuously evaluate payroll processes and identify opportunities for improvement in efficiency, accuracy, and compliance. Implement changes as approved. Who are we looking for?  Education:   Graduate in any stream Experience:   3+ years of relevant experience  Skills: Strong understanding of payroll regulations, tax laws, and compliance requirements. Proficiency with payroll software and Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel. Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and calculations. Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Ready to work as an individual contributor. Whats in it for you? Be an equal parent Maternity support, including paid leave ahead of statutory guidelines, and flexible work options on return  Paternity support, including paid leave  New mothers can bring a caregiver and children under a year old, on work travel Adoption support; gender neutral and based on the primary caregiver, with paid leave options  No place for discrimination at Godrej  Gender-neutral anti-harassment policy  Same sex partner benefits at par with married spouses  Gender transition support We are selfish about your wellness  Comprehensive health insurance plans, as well as accident coverage for you and your family, with top-up options  Uncapped sick leave  Mental wellness and self-care programmes, resources and counselling Celebrating wins, the Godrej Way   Structured recognition platforms for individual, team and business-level achievements  Performance-based earning opportunities  https://www.godrejcareers.com/benefits/  An inclusive Godrej  Before you go, there is something important we want to highlight. There is no place for discrimination at Godrej. Diversity is the philosophy of who we are as a company. And has been for over a century. Its not just in our DNA and nice to do. Being more diverse - especially having our team members reflect the diversity of our businesses and communities - helps us innovate better and grow faster. We hope this resonates with you. We take pride in being an equal opportunities employer. We recognise merit and encourage diversity. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination on the basis of nationality, race, colour, religion, caste, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, age, or marital status and ensure equal opportunities for all our team members.  If this sounds like a role for you, apply now!  We look forward to meeting you.

column2: Job Description: Zavenir Group   Job Title :  Plant HR/IR & Admin   Binola (Manesar) Are you a seasoned HR professional with a passion for industrial relations and administrative excellence? Do you thrive in a dynamic manufacturing environment where you can drive worker engagement and ensure statutory compliance? If so, this role is tailor-made for you. At Zavenir Group, we are committed to fostering a culture of excellence and employee welfare. We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Plant HR/IR & Admin to join our team at our manufacturing plant in Binola, Manesar.   Areas of Responsibility Effective Worker Planning & Retention:  Develop strategies for worker planning and retention, including addressing absenteeism and implementing disciplinary actions as needed. Recruitment and Onboarding:  Lead the recruitment process for workers, supporting their induction and onboarding to ensure a smooth transition into the organization. Statutory Compliance:  Ensure adherence to all statutory compliances related to labor laws, factory licenses, and other regulatory requirements, overseeing a team of compliance specialists. Training and Development:  Support the training and development initiatives for workers, identifying skill gaps and implementing programs to enhance their capabilities. Performance Management:  Manage the performance appraisal process for workers, facilitating promotions and providing feedback to drive continuous improvement . Grievance Management:  Handle grievances raised by workers in a timely and effective manner, promoting a culture of transparency and trust. Contract Labor Management:  Oversee the management of contract labor, ensuring compliance with contractual agreements and labor regulations. Worker Engagement & Welfare:  Implement initiatives to enhance worker engagement and welfare, including recognition and reward programs, committee participation, and health and safety measures. Admin Operations:  Provide support for day-to-day admin operations, including security, transportation, travel arrangements, canteen management, guest house facilities, and housekeeping.   Competencies Needed for the Role  MBA/PGDM in HR & IR from a reputable institution. 6 to 10 years of relevant experience in HR and industrial relations, preferably in a manufacturing environment. Solid knowledge of labor laws, factory acts, and statutory compliances. Experience in setting up greenfield projects will be an added advantage. Sound understanding of industrial relations practices and conflict resolution techniques. Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build positive relationships at all levels. Self-motivated with a proactive approach to problem-solving and decision-making. Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment.     Why Zavenir Group is Your Next Home: Leverage our flexible work hour arrangements to be your productive self. Diverse leave policies (9 types) to ensure you get your time off when needed. Enjoy several unique benefits including but not limited to comprehensive family insurance policies, Reward and recognition, full access to our in-house Learning Academy  Avenir Academy for Advancement, etc.   Additional Details About the Role Location:  Binola, Manesar  Job Type:  Full Time (Permanent) Team Responsibilities : Individual Contributor  Level:  Mid Senior   Are you ready to take on the challenge of driving HR and administrative excellence in a manufacturing setting? Join us at Zavenir Group and be a part of our journey towards operational excellence. Apply now and be the driving force behind our success. About Zavenir Group (Zavenir Daubert) Zavenir Daubert  is a premier manufacturer of specialty chemicals for corrosion protection and metal working. Founded in 1995, Zavenir Daubert today has 1500+ products, 5000+ indirect customers, 250+ direct customers and 35+ channel partners. Global markets require leading-edge products and outstanding services at an affordable price to be able to produce goods of high-quality standards. Through its leading international collaborations, Zavenir Daubert has been fostering this vision with its concept of Global Technologies, Made in India.  Zavenir Daubert,  in collaboration with Daubert USA advancing its vision abiding by the core values of DISC. It enjoys leadership position in the metal cutting and corrosion protection space in India. It is now extending its footprint in Middle east and southeast-Asia. Zavenir Daubert is also a partner of Nihon Parkerizing Japan that was licensed by Daubert in the 1960s to manufacture NOX-RUST products to serve the Japanese Industry. By constant development of the NOX-RUST technologies through its vast experience in the surface modification field, Nihon Parkerizing today enjoys a vast reputation as a Daubert partner through-out the Far East and South-East Asia with approvals from most Steel & Automotive manufacturers. Nihon Parkerizing's strength lies in their pioneering work on the development and usage of NOX-RUST throughout the supply chain of the automotive industry. Visit our website Zavenir Daubert | Specialty Chemicals | Metal Working | Corrosion Protection to know more.

column1: HR Head / Head of Human Resources
column2: Job description   This leadership role in HR requires a strategic partner for the top management team. You'll be responsible for creating a performance-driven culture by building strong teams and fostering new leaders. Your duties will encompass all aspects of HR, including organizational development, policies, operations, change management, talent development, and more.  Role & responsibilities   Managing talent acquisition and employee relations activities and setting priorities to improve the competence of the workforce. Establishing and institutionalizing career progression assessment platforms, processes and policies to attract and retain talent in line with the business strategy.  Overseeing the integrated management of the workforce for strategic and   operational demand, workforce planning, talent acquisition, on-boarding,   skill management, learning and development.            Leading   the design and development of a competitive performance management system   philosophy, framework, and online platform; implementing end-to-end   performance management for employees across the organization.              Implementing performance appraisal processes enterprise-wide, improving   employee skills and motivation, and enhancing employee engagement to achieve   best-in-class engagement scores.     Collaborating with senior management to align talent management strategies   with overall business goals and objectives.              Designing and implementing employee development programs to enhance skills   and knowledge in key areas such as leadership, communication, and technical   expertise.              Providing guidance and coaching to managers and supervisors on best practices   for performance management and employee development      Conducting regular talent reviews to identify high-potential employees and   provide opportunities for advancement and career growth              Monitoring and analyzing key workforce metrics to identify trends, areas for   improvement, and make recommendations for action.              Managing and maintaining an up-to-date succession plan to ensure the   organization has a strong pipeline of leaders and key contributors.              Providing oversight to the design and delivery of training programs to   support continuous improvement and development of the workforce              Partnering with other HR functions to ensure effective delivery of all talent   management and development activities.     Developing policies and initiatives to identify and develop high-performing talent within the organization through accelerated development assignments and training opportunities.   Ideal Candidate Traits: Should possess an MBA in HR through a full-time program from a recognized establishment. Requires 20-25 years of in-the-trenches experience, preferably in the Manufacturing sector. Must exhibit proven capability in a leadership role, with a strong focus on stakeholder engagement and hands-on management experience.

Employee Engagement and Relations ??Total Rewards: Participate in the development of incentive and benefits plans that reflect employee needs. ??Employee Engagement: Drive initiatives to maintain high levels of employee satisfaction and retain critical talent. ??Employee Relations: Conduct regular sessions to address and  resolve employee grievances, ensuring timely support and  adherence to process timelines. ??Provide timely information and/or education for all levels of a company on HR issues/policies 2   JOB DESCRIPTION ??Analyze and interpret various types of employee reports (e.g.,  compensation, job levels, and attrition) to guide decision making  and provide proactive solutions to their client group. Talent Acquisition and Organizational Development ??Talent Acquisition: Manage manpower planning, organizational  structure, and the selection process, ensuring the onboarding of  new hires aligns with company goals. ??HR Practices: Implement and innovate HR best practices,  working with L&D to plan necessary training and development  programs. Strong Functional knowledge of Human Resources around Organizational behaviour, Performance management, Leadership development practices is a must.

column2: THE POSITION The Shiv Nadar School seeks a creative People & Culture Partner at the Core team who is competent, passionate, and dedicated to bringing in change and innovation within the education sector.? The P&C Partner will be responsible for managing the overall People & Culture strategies and practices across all campuses of Shiv Nadar School along with strengthening the existing processes and operations with support to all campus P&C Team.? The P&C partner must have a progressive mindset with the ability to translate vision into reality through a strong execution orientation and proven track record of delivery. This role largely requires the appointed person to collaborate closely with school stakeholders to drive People & Culture Practices. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES RECRUITMENT, TALENT MANAGEMENT AND RETENTION 1. Oversee manpower planning and requisition for school campuses with campus People and Culture team. 2. Oversee manpower deployment as per organogram. 3. Build relationships with placement firms, take lead on leadership hiring and be actively involved in interviews of senior hires with sourcing, hiring, selection as per requirements. 4. Manage attrition and devise measures to promote retention of staff. 5. Maintain a succession plan for all the schools and departments and discuss this on a continuous basis with respective Principals and Department Heads. 6. Will be the custodian of all P&C policies related to recruitment, talent development, management and retention. ON BOARDING & INDUCTION 1. Oversee on-boarding plan and schedule for new employees at campuses with P&C teams. 2. Facilitate induction and on-boarding process for new employees across campuses in collaboration with P&C teams. 3. Facilitate meetings and introduction to stakeholders as per induction plan for Senior Leadership roles. EMPLOYEE ENGAGEMENT, COMMUNICATION, REWARD & RECOGNITION 1. Facilitate employee engagement initiatives at campuses in collaboration with central and school P&C teams. 2. Create and drive R&R initiatives and events for entire Shiv Nadar School community across all campuses. HUMAN RESOURCES POLICY 1. Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law and advise the senior management of the organization on the necessary changes in policy, practice, and resources. 2. From time to time bring about improvements in internal HR systems and processes to build efficiency and robustness in all HR activities. 3. Monitor and ensure all policies and procedures are up to date and the organization is compliant with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations; review and modify policies and practices to maintain compliance and recommend best practices. 4. Have oversight and ensure policies are implemented appropriately across the organization. 5. Conduct research and analysis of organizational trends including review of reports and metrics from the organizations human resource information system (HRIS) or talent management system. PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT 1. Design and deliver initiatives which foster a high-performance culture, including that of reward and recognition of high performers. 2. Coordinate the performance management of employees and ensure all Job Descriptions are kept up to date and create new JDs as and when necessary. 3. Ensure appraisal cycle is completed within the stipulated timeframe across campuses. 4. Chalk out strategies for putting in place a robust performance support plan. TRAINING / LEARNING & DEVELOPMENT 1. Oversee and support training needs analysis for all staff and design and implement a training plan with input from department heads and school teams. 2. Design models / opportunities to develop latent interest, talents and qualities of staff that will be beneficial to organizational growth. 3. Facilitate professional development, training, and certification activities for People and Culture employees. EXPERIENCE AND COMPETENCIES EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION A Post Graduate degree from a recognized B school in HR with 7-10 years of relevant work experience in roles with similar responsibilities as outlined in this job description. MUST HAVES 1. Minimum 7-10 years of full time HR experience. Experience in educational ecosystem is an added advantage. 2. Awareness of Indian and state employment laws and compliances. 3. Excellent communication skills (must) with ability to communicate fluently and effectively in English, Hindi. 4. Proven ability to work effectively with people from all cultures and backgrounds 5. Experience with ERP software such as SAP, PeopleSoft, Oracle, RAMCO etc. will be an added advantage. 6. Proficiency in Microsoft Office or similar products. COMPETENCIES 1. Creative thinker & strategist and a problem solver 2. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships. 3. Flexibility and openness in operating style to adapt to change and seize opportunities that come with shifts in priorities. 4. Proficiency in Microsoft Office or similar products

column2: Key hiring partnership with Loopio s Engineering, Product & Design teams in India on all facets of technical hiring, and support for various teams as needed      Support the full recruitment cycle by completing phone screens, scheduling interviews, and being the main point of contact for applicants with a focus on providing exceptional candidate experiences      Guide Hiring Managers through the recruitment process that is in accordance to the Loopio Hiring Policy.      Bring forth ideas on how to build creative sourcing strategies, innovative solutions to recruitment, and consistently build a quality pipeline (beyond LinkedIn) of potential candidates for open positions across departments      Collaborate with our People Team in Canada when it comes to hiring and onboarding new hires in our India Hub.      Being the point of People Team contact for new hires and the India team. This may include: hosting Welcome to Loopio sessions, answering new hire questions, and supporting new India hires in their first few weeks. Support on other logistical People activities that require an in-person presence, as required.      Manage the new hire documentation process, such as offer letters and employment contracts, which may include facilitating a legal stamp process.      Working closely with the Talent Experience Team to help grow and develop best practices and processes in talent acquisition and management.      Use your curiosity to deeply understand all roles in the recruitment process and be a trusted advisor to our teams and hiring managers      Manage a high volume of requests and coordinate complex schedules to ensure an efficient recruitment process; a sense of urgency is crucial in this role      Participate and represent Loopio at virtual and in-person (when possible) recruitment events      Consistently deliver an exceptional, high-touch and personalized candidate experience, while bringing new and innovative ideas forward to continuously improve our processes      Maintain a high level of discretion and confidentiality at all times                      What You ll Bring to the Team        3+ years of experience in a full cycle technical recruitment role within an agency or high-growth SaaS company, with at least 1 year of corporate recruitment experience.      Expertise in scaling engineering, design and product teams is essential for this role; example focus areas include Cloud, Infrastructure, Machine Learning, Product Management, and Product Design      Impeccable verbal and written communication skills      Phenomenal skills in research, problem-solving, time management, and attention to detail      Proven ability to multitask and prioritize projects in a fast-paced recruitment environment      A people-focused and welcoming personality (you ll often be the first Looper a candidate meets!)      Adaptable and has the ability to pivot according to evolving business needs      Supportive team player who is comfortable in a continuous feedback environment      Desire to continuously learn and refine your skills in Talent Acquisition      A background in HR or People Operations is an asset      Knowledgeable or interested in Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI)      Experience working with Google Suite, LinkedIn Recruiter and Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS). Bonus points if you ve worked with Lever before!                Where You ll Work        Loopio is based in Canada with hub regions around the world. Right now, our employees (or Loopers, as we call ourselves!) live and work in Toronto, Vancouver, London, and India. You will be partnering closely with team members across Canada, India, US and the UK.      Loopio is a remote-first workplace because we recognize the advantages of working flexibly. Our India hub employees live and work remotely around Gujarat, India) and work according to regular business hours in their timezone unless otherwise stated. In this full-time role, the Talent Partner will be expected to work from 12 - 8 pm IST during your regional working business days to accommodate for the time zone differences with our Canada Hub.      You ll collaborate with your teams virtually across the UK, India, and North America (we re just a Zoom call and Slack message away!) and have established core sync hours and focus time during the workday to enable us to work smarter together. Additionally, we encourage asynchronous collaboration to effectively work as a global #OneTeam!                Why You ll Love Working at Loopio        Your manager supports your development by providing ongoing feedback and regular 1-on-1s      You have tons of autonomy and responsibility: this role provides an opportunity to try new things and push creative boundaries      You ll learn more than you thought was possible; our team is obsessed with personal and professional growth (every Looper receives a professional mastery allowance each year)      You ll be set up to work remotely with a MacBook laptop, a monthly work-from-home budget to support your remote work!      Join us in regular company socials, AMA (Ask-Me-Anything), and quarterly kick-off to celebrate the big wins and milestones as #oneteam!      You ll be joining a culture that has thoughtfully built out opportunities for connections in a remote-first environment.      We have Employee Resource Groups, various fun virtual activities, and many more moments for us to have fun and learn together!      You ll be a part of an award-winning workplace and one of Canada s fastest-growing companies with ample opportunity to make a big impact here

column2: As a full-service consulting, engineering, construction, and operations firm, we deliver exceptional client service, quality results and enduring value across the entire project life cycle.         Job Description     CDM Smith is hiring a Senior Engineer / hydraulic modeler to work on gravity and pressurized network Projects.       This role will be supporting our Middle East Projects.      The expectation from the candidate is a challenging and rewarding opportunity to apply knowledge, experience, and problem-solving skills. We offer a diverse and challenging workplace.     ?We value applications from a good team player. To perform the role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:     Develop concept, preliminary, detailed design, and related calculations for Strom/Water and Sewer design. Professional Qualifications will be added as an advantage   Good written and verbal English language communication skills     Domestic and/or international travel may be required. column2: Designation - SAP HCM Executive (End User) Department - SAP Work Location - Ghatkesar Responsibilities: Organization Management Configure organizational units, jobs, positions, tasks, and work centers based on new requirements. Create and maintain number ranges for organizational units, positions, jobs, and employee IDs. Personnel Administration Handle hiring actions and manage employee life cycle events such as leaving, transfer, salary revision, return from leave, and promotion. Maintain employee master data including personal information, contact details, identification documents, and salary details. Debug employee master data processing errors. Prepare RFID card for employee identification. Time Management Generate work schedules with rules and variants, manage absence and attendance quotas, and handle overtime. Run time evaluation processes and update holiday calendars in SAP. Process and provide technical support for biometric punch-in and punch-out data. Debug time management-related issues. Payroll Manage payroll areas, control records, payroll periods, basic pay, additional payments, deductions, and remuneration information for different employee groups. Execute monthly payroll processes, prepare salary and bank statements, and handle full and final settlement calculations. Monitor payroll schemas and personnel calculation rules (PCRs), debugging issues if professional tax, provident fund, or ESI calculations are incorrect. Post payroll results to FICO SAP S/4, validate GL accounts and perform monthly and yearly processes reflecting in FICO SAP S/4. Generate and distribute/e-mail payslips via SAP. Income Tax Update income tax information in SAP based on government/SAP India support changes. Calculate monthly income tax for all employees through SAP. Prepare income tax-related reports such as Form-24Q and generate monthly, quarterly, and yearly reports in SAP.

Job Overview: The HR Executive will be responsible for managing the end-to-end recruitment process, from sourcing and attracting candidates to on boarding new hires. This role will involve collaborating with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs, developing recruitment strategies, and ensuring a positive candidate experience. If you are interested in joining our team, please submit your resume to hr@biomatiq.com. We look forward to hearing from you! LOCATION: HYDERABAD Key Responsibilities: Partner with hiring managers to understand staffing requirements and develop recruitment plans. Source and attract qualified candidates through various channels, including job boards, social media, and networking events. Screen resumes and conduct initial phone interviews to assess candidate qualifications and fit. Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and candidates. Facilitate the interview process, including providing feedback to candidates and managing communication between candidates and hiring managers. Conduct reference checks and background screenings as needed. Extend job offers to successful candidates and manage the on boarding process. Maintain accurate and up-to-date recruitment data and reports. Stay informed about industry trends and best practices in recruitment. Support other HR initiatives as needed. Qualifications: MBA in Human Resources, or related field. Proven experience in recruitment or talent acquisition role (1-3 years preferred). Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and HR databases not mandatory but a value addition Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong organizational and time management abilities. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities. High level of professionalism and integrity. Benefits: Competitive salary in par with market standards. Covered under Health and Personal accidental policies Professional development opportunities

column1: HR Generalist (Senior Executive / Asst. Manager - HR)
column2: Role & responsibilities: Recruitment:  Bring to life our culture through creative attractive strategies and great recruitment experiences  Employee lifecycle management:  Support our employee experience through the full employee lifecycle, from recruitment to offboarding and beyond. HR technology:  The systems administration and continuous improvement of our SaaS people technology (Hibob HRIS and Greenhouse ATS). People advisory:  Provide timely and prudent advice to managers and employees. Employee Engagement:  Management of events which create excitement and drive engagement.  Internal communications:  Creating and implementing creative and engaging employee communications and employer brand content. Payroll support:  Work with the Business Partner and accounts team for payroll inputs and related activities. (as and when required). Project coordination:  Work with the Culture team to improve our employee experience and deliver on our global Culture strategy. These projects scan the whole people operations spectrum, including systems and technology, policies, remuneration and benefits, change management, recruitment, and improvements to our ways of working.  Preferred candidate profile:   Desired Skills 5+ years in a role with HR generalist experience (this involves 60% IT and non IT recruitment) along with HR operations and skills mentioned below are great to have. Great attitude with a willingness to do the work and get stuck in, proactive and go above and beyond at the call of duty. Exceptional interpersonal verbal and written communication skills and ability to work confidently across levels and cultures. Experience in hiring for technology roles and  experience as HR generalist As the go-to person managing our recruitment system and HRIS youll need to be able to hit the ground running picking up new systems, processes and technologies. (someone having worked on HRIS tools like Hi bob and Greenhouse ATS is an added advantage) Innovation and creativity, capability to think outside the box to deliver our unique employer brand through social media in candidate experience.  Attention to detail, accuracy, and organisational skills. Qualification & Experience required: PGDM - HR/ MBA - HR / equivalent  from a recognized university/ Bschool 5+years  of experience in HR generalist role  Perks and benefits     Why should one consider joining EnergyTech? EnergyTech Global is situated in a government business park with amazing workplace facilities away from the concrete jungle EnergyTech Global is the team behind creating the exceptional technology that drives our award-winning retail businesses, Electric Kiwi in New Zealand and ReAmped Energy in Australia. We believe creativity, innovation, and technology can deliver something incredible for us, our customers, and the world. We have grown into a global team of mavericks who dare to be different. Were a community at heart, and were unstoppable when everyone has the freedom to be themselves. We strive to give an unbeatable employee experience coupled with benefits like health insurance (Parents too), Provident Fund, gratuity, collective shares, coffee, breakfast, and lunch in the house. We enjoy the ride and love to celebrate milestones together with cake or Biryani, and much more! Flexible working. Excellent leave policy:  42 days time off in a year (20 days  Paid time off, 10  days  National/Public holidays, 10  days  of casual leaves, 5 Me Time days).

She/he will lead the HR Operations of Branch, will manage all the HR Activities and support business partners. Job Description: Effectively and efficiently resolve queries and concerns of employees of the respective vertical/process and track/report query resolution TAT Ensure compliance to labor laws Implementation of the Discipline Policy and Code of Conduct Attrition at 5% or below Work on Employee Engagement through cross-function teams Facilitate engagement action planning record minutes, action points, responses and circulate, track and report and communicate closures. Ensure timely sign-offs of KRAs from new employees and role movements Coordinate and ensure timely completion of half-year and annual Performance appraisals Track and monitor adherence to training plan for the process Conduct exit interview for employees Collate exit survey data and report on a monthly basis trends and action to be taken Employee Retention Branding & Intelligence Ensure adherence to the Security Policy and Disciplinary Policy Ensure adherence of business supported on the Security Policy, Zero Tolerance Policy, United Privacy Policy, Disciplinary Policy and Learning Agreement Qualification Graduate of any Bachelors degree in Psychology, Industrial Relations, or Human Resource Management or any Bachelors degree with experience in HR and experience as an HR Generalist or Specialist focusing on Labor Relations and Employee Engagement in a BPO/Call Center industry Candidate must be proficient in MS Office, has strong analytical and problem-solving skills and has basic knowledge of labor laws and can facilitate engagement action planning. Must have an excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines. Candidate can also resolve effectively and efficiently the queries concerns of employees about the respective vertical/process and track/report query resolution. Amenable to work  onsite  in Bangalore City, in a flexible in shifting or rotational schedule within 24/7 work hours.

column2: Job Openings: Senior Compliance Executive Location: ITPL, Whitefield Bangalore Notice period: Immediate or within 15 days Qualifications: Any Graduate or Post Graduate? Responsibilities: As a Senior Compliance Executive, you will be responsible for ensuring compliance in various areas, including PF, ESIC, LWF, and PT.  Your duties will include: - Conducting regular audits and inspections to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations. - Coordinating with relevant authorities and ensuring timely submission of compliance reports. - Developing and implementing compliance policies and procedures. - Monitoring and managing compliance risks within the organization. - Training staff and providing them with guidance on compliance matters. - Conducting investigations and resolving compliance issues promptly. - Maintaining accurate records and documentation related to compliance. - Collaborating with other departments to ensure compliance integration into overall business strategies. Skills: - Strong knowledge of PF, ESIC, LWF, PT. - Excellent understanding of Advance Excel and data manipulation. - Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - Ability to work independently and as part of a team. - Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks. Benefits: - Competitive salary and benefits package - Career growth and development opportunities - Collaborative and inclusive work environment If you are an experienced compliance professional with 4+ years of experience in PF, ESIC, LWF, PT Statutory Compliance and proficiency in Advance Excel, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Looking only for immediate joiners. Please send your resume to  stephan.m@alpconsulting.in Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview.

column1: Job Opening For Hr Payroll executive For Sakinaka location near Metro
column2: Dear Candidates, Title: Payroll HR  Salary -25k to 27k ctc  Experience-2 to 3 Years  Location - Sakinaka Near Metro station Overview:  As a Payroll HR Specialist/Coordinator/Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of payroll processing and administration, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies and legal requirements. You will also play a key role in supporting HR functions related to employee compensation, benefits administration, and record-keeping. Responsibilities: Payroll Processing: Collecting and verifying timekeeping information. Calculating wages, deductions and adjustments. Processing payroll transactions accurately and timely. Distributing paychecks or direct deposits to employees. Resolving payroll discrepancies and answering employee inquiries regarding pay. Compliance and Record-Keeping: Ensuring compliance with federal, state, and local payroll regulations. Maintaining accurate records of employee payroll data. Preparing and filing payroll tax returns and other related documents. Keeping abreast of changes in payroll laws and regulations and implementing necessary updates. Benefits Administration: Assisting with the  administration of employee benefits programs, such as health insurance, retirement plans, and other fringe benefits. Processing enrollment and changes in benefits status. Coordinating with benefit providers and resolving employee inquiries related to benefits. HR Support: Assisting with the onboarding and offboarding process, including processing new hire paperwork and  conducting exit interviews. Supporting HR initiatives such as performance management, employee relations, and training programs. Maintaining confidentiality of HR and payroll information. Reporting and Analysis: Generating payroll reports for management review. Analyzing payroll data to identify trends and make recommendations for process improvements. Assisting with budgeting and forecasting related to payroll and benefits costs. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree  If anyone interested so please share me your CV to yasmin@aforeserve.co.in or call 8451980441 if you not interested so please refer your Friend

column1: Sr. Executive Training/ Learning and Development Specialist
column2: The opportunity is to identify the need for training and create development plans. You should plan, develop, and conduct training activities and educational programs to help the employees learn new skills. You will manage the smooth and effective roll-out of training sessions and special projects throughout our company. The ideal candidate should have experience with various training methods, including on-the-job coaching, mentorship programs and e-learning. Experience with different projects, like management training and soft-skills development, is also essential. . Basically, to oversee all professional development at Evolute Group.    Key responsibilities include: 1.   Strategic responsibilities: -  Develop interactive training programmes across the company. Choose the best training methods or activities according to the particular purpose and audience. Promote training opportunities to employees in a compelling way that provides all necessary information and entices participation. Oversee and maintain training facilities and necessary equipment. See the big picture and conduct company-wide needs assessments. Uphold best practices and corporate education principles for training. Design and prepare educational materials as needed. Measure effectiveness of training and generate a summative evaluation report. Liaise with various experts regarding instruction and scheduling. Facilitate train-the-trainer sessions for in-house trainers. 2.   Functional responsibilities: - Schedule continuing      skill development and technical training classes for existing staff      members. Stress the importance of continual growth and learning. Cooperate with      management to create and conduct surveys designed to identify specific      training needs within the organization. Utilize a variety of      methods such as conferences, demonstrations, workshops, classroom      training, meetings, and on-the-job training to make continuous training      and development an interesting and dynamic process. Instruct supervisors      and instructors in effective methods for dealing with employees and      training them in their various responsibilities. Arrange on-the-job training for new hires and      conduct orientation sessions to familiarize new staff members with correct      procedures and processes. To qualify for the role, you must have: - Bachelors degree in Education, Training, HR or related field with 4-6 years of exp in Training management. Proficient using Microsoft Suite Experience with e-learning platforms and delivering training will be added advantage. Extensive knowledge of best practices in creating instructional materials Excellent grasp of English grammar and communication skills. Key attributes for success : - Ability to effectively organize and manage multiple training      initiatives simultaneously Ability to design effective training programs & convey complex      information in an understandable way You will earn brownie points if you have : - Proven track record, showing the ability to successfully complete      the full training cycle. Ability to manage and handle multiple tasks. Knowledge of competency assessment and Managing  training budget

column2: Job   Description Role   Title  HR Executive  Function  Human Resource Reports   To  HR Manager  Location  Navi Mumbai (Vashi) Company   Profile Finulent is an innovative global corporation with a strong commitment to crafting solutions which will minimize our carbon footprint. Our team comprises of skilled engineers and thought leaders who are steadfastly dedicated to the advancement of renewable power facilities, eco-friendly architectural designs, clean and efficient transportation solutions, and state-of-the-art blueprints of information network infrastructure. Mission   (Why   does   this   role   exist?)   and   Scope   (About   the   Job) To provide support, assistance and consultation to the broader HR team in building, documenting and optimizing HR business processes utilizing knowledge of HR processes, policies and leading practices. Key   Responsibilities   and   Outcomes   (What   the   Person   needs   to   accomplish   in   the   role?) ?? Talent   Acquisition: o Collaborate with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and  requirements. Source potential candidates through various channels,  including job boards, social media, and professional networks. o Review resumes, screen applicants, and conduct initial interviews to assess  qualifications and fit. o Manage and update job postings on the company's careers page and external job portals. ?? Interview   Coordination: o Schedule and coordinate interviews with candidates and hiring teams. o Ensure a positive and professional candidate experience throughout the  interview process. o Provide feedback to candidates and facilitate communication between candidates and hiring managers. ?? Candidate   Assessment   &   Offer   Management: o Conduct reference checks and background screenings as needed. o Assess candidates' skills, experience, and cultural fit. o Collaborate with hiring managers to make informed hiring decisions. o Extend offers of employment to selected candidates. o Negotiate salary and benefits packages when necessary. o Ensure timely submission of required documents and information from  candidates.   Recruitment   Metrics   and   Reporting: o Maintain recruitment data and metrics to track the effectiveness of the recruitment process. o Prepare regular reports on recruitment activities for HR leadership.   Administration: o Onboarding of vendors with competent negotiations o Preparing end-to-end travel arrangements for managers as per  requirement. o Maintaining office operations and supplies such as stationery, and housekeeping, beverages. o Keeping records of vendors invoices and data management as per office compliances. ?? Employee   Engagement: o Engaging employees to be enthusiastic about their work, motivated to  contribute their best efforts, and feel a sense of purpose in their roles. o Organize team-building events and activities to foster collaboration and  strengthen relationships among employees. ?? Employee   Relations: o Provide multiple channels for employees to report grievances, including anonymous options if possible. o Assure employees that their concerns will be treated confidentially and that they will not face retaliation for reporting grievances. Minimum   Qualifications   and   Experience ??Bachelors/Masters Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field ??Proven 3+ years experience in the Human Resource Domain. Requirements ??Excellent verbal and written communication skills ??Language Proficiency in English, local area language ??Strong interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills ??Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate. ??Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality. ??Thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations ??Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software. ??Proficiency with or the ability to quickly learn the organizations talent management system  Website: https://www.finulent.com E-mail ID: kajol.mishra@finulent.com  Phone No : 8591518031
column11: End To End Recruitment, Offer Generation, Lateral Hiring, NON, Talent Acquisition, REC, NEG, Campus Hiring, Offer Negotiation, Employee Engagement, Mass Hiring, Leadership Hiring, Bulk Hiring, Talent Sourcing, Campus Recruitment

column2: Lead the recruitment and selection process, including sourcing candidates, screening resumes, conducting interviews, and coordinating with hiring managers to fill open positions in a timely and efficient manner.      Develop and implement effective strategies for talent acquisition, employer branding, and candidate engagement to attract top talent and build a strong talent pipeline for current and future staffing needs.      Oversee employee onboarding and orientation programs to ensure a smooth transition for new hires, including facilitating orientation sessions, providing information on company policies and benefits, and conducting new hire surveys for feedback.      Manage employee relations activities, including handling employee grievances, conflicts, and disciplinary issues in accordance with company policies, labor laws, and best practices, fostering a positive and inclusive work environment.      Provide guidance and support to managers and employees on HR policies, procedures, and practices, including performance management, employee engagement, career development, and workplace accommodations.      Administer performance appraisal processes, including goal setting, performance evaluations, and feedback sessions, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and individual development plans.      Coordinate training and development initiatives, including needs assessment, training program design, delivery, and evaluation, to enhance employee skills, knowledge, and competencies in alignment with business objectives.      Manage employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other employee perks, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, vendor management, and employee communication.      Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, HRIS data, and personnel files, ensuring confidentiality, data integrity, and compliance with privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).      Prepare HR reports, analytics, and metrics on key HR indicators, such as turnover rates, recruitment metrics, training effectiveness, and employee engagement survey results, to inform decision-making and continuous improvement efforts.

column2: Summary of the Job : The Purpose of the role will be to effectively manage the complete employee life cycle including Talent Acquisition & on boarding. Talent Acquisition responsibilities include planning, sourcing, screening, selecting, hiring and On-boarding. The Role also demands to manage all other aspects of HR business partnering like Query Resolution, employee grievances, Performance Development, Employee Engagement & Employee Retention by leveraging technology. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Recruitment life cycle Planning, Sourcing, screening, selecting, hiring and On-boarding. Establish and adapt new age hiring methodology like social recruiting. Coordinate with hiring managers to identify staffing needs Determine selection criteria Source potential candidates through online channels (e.g. social platforms and professional networks) Plan interview and selection procedures, including screening calls, assessments and in-person interviews Assess candidate information, including resumes and contact details, using our Applicant Tracking System Design job descriptions and interview question repository that reflect each positions requirements Lead employer branding initiatives Organize and attend job fairs and recruitment events Forecast quarterly and annual hiring needs by functions/Business Foster long-term relationships with past applicants & potential candidates determine and recommend employee engagement practices necessary to establish a positive employer-employee relationship. Business Partnering Focus on strategic alliance with business for overall organization performance. Design programs and interventions for enabling the right tools resources for the employees. Develop and implement process of organizational development including succession planning. Execute compensation strategy, performance appraisal programs, employee benefit programs and employee engagement programs. Onboarding Plan and implement company talent acquisition strategy. Develop On boarding Program with feedback mechanism. Align Documentation, assimilation of Competency Module & HR Practices, Policies. Counsel the candidate on corporate benefits, salary, and company Culture. HR Analytics Effective use of HR Analytics and machine intelligence for effective decision making. Performance Metrics Designing HR performance metrics across different processes impacting business directly and indirectly. Analyse Return on Investments for various initiatives and make subsequent relevant changes. QUALIFICATIONS   & SKILLS An MBA from a reputed Institute / University with graduation in any discipline EXPERIENCE REQUIRED 3+ Years work Experience in HR Familiarity with social media, HR Technology platforms, resume databases and professional networks. s

column2: The groups HR & Admin Department is properly set up. In recent times we have understood the strong need to build   training & development culture specially at our factory location for   staff as well as workers in terms of job specific functional and behavioral   training to build the required skills. The objective is to focus on improving   productivity & efficiency of people so as to achieve required individual   as well as organization level growth. To do so, HR team has started focusing on structured approach   and end to end process of training & development which would includes   from skill mapping, gap identification, content development, classroom and or   on the job training, training evaluation, feedback and building up individual   development plan across wide range of team members.   Setting   up Training & development SOP & ensure its compliance.  Plan   and ensure required training program (Functional/Behavioural) are being conducted   at plant & office based on job requirement. Create   T&D Plan which would include training calendar, content development,   calendar invites, program coordination, post program feedback and follow up   on action items. Plan   and execute worker??on job training & engagement programs to ensure their   skill development and retention. Plan   and execute Induction & Onboarding of new joiners which includes staff,   workers, ITI and Graduate trainee. Work   on competency building , skill assessment, HIPO Individual development   projects and ensure its consistency and implementation Plan   and implement Campus Recruitment drive with local institute Review   and update Induction videos and work on new and creative ways of building up   training videos. Take   lead in designing & driving various employee engagement initiatives. Search   on various E-Learning/Onsite cost-effective programs and update HR Head &   Factory HR about the same. Prepare   and update L&D Budget including Training Manday planned vs Actual and overall   actual cost vs ROI. Seek   suggestions/improvement areas from employees to make the workplace a better   and engaging place to work.   Should have worked on Core areas of L&D at   factory and office. Should have worked on wide range of   worker??, ITI, GETs induction, orientation and skill development programs in   a manufacturing set up Has good fair knowledge and experience of factory set up and its working. Should be passionate about training & development of people. Should have an ability to think out of box & drive innovation.   Able to adapt to any changes in structure/situation/priorities with plan   b or c in place. Proactive and go getter attitude.  Should be good in   Excel/Power Point/Drafting with fluency in English communication (Written and   Verbal)

column2: We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Senior HR Executive to join our team      You will play a crucial role in overseeing and managing various human resources functions within the organization      You will be responsible for sourcing candidates through various channels, planning interview and selection procedures, and hosting or participating in career events      You will be involved in developing and implementing Recruitment strategies, and programs to attract, retain, and develop the best talent while collaborating with the HR team, department heads, and hiring managers to align HR strategies with the company s overall goals      You will be a driving force behind the development of career paths and growth opportunities, promoting a culture that encourages employees to reach their full potential within the company      Your strategic vision, exceptional interpersonal skills, and expertise in recruitment and talent management will be instrumental in building and maintaining a strong, cohesive, and high-performing workforce              Educational Qualification:          Bachelor s degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or a related field a master s degree is a plus.          Proven work experience as an HR Executive/Recruiter or similar role          Strong leadership and people management skills with the ability to inspire and motivate a diverse workforce.        Key Responsibilities        Collaborate with department heads to understand their hiring needs and develop effective strategies to attract the best talent in the industry.          Analyze workforce trends, talent needs, and skill gaps to create effective workforce planning and recruitment strategies.          Handle the recruitment process, from job postings to candidate selection, ensuring a diverse and qualified talent pool.          Implement effective sourcing strategies along with sourcing potential candidates through online channels (e.g. social platforms and professional networks.) while maintaining relationships with recruitment agencies and job portals, educational institutions.          Conduct interviews for different profiles and participate in the final selection process.          Develop and implement employer branding initiatives to attract top talent and enhance the company s reputation as an employer of choice.          Perform reference checks and negotiate job offers with potential hires.          Build and maintain a strong talent pipeline for current and future hiring needs.          Coordinate with hiring managers to onboard new employees and support their integration into the company culture.        Key Skills Required        Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build effective relationships across all levels of the organization.          Solid understanding of talent acquisition and hands on experience with recruiting and sourcing candidates.          Excellent knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems and resume databases          A keen understanding of the differences between various roles within organizations          Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.          Analytical mindset with the ability to use data to drive HR strategies and decision-making.          Ability to work independently, as well as collaboratively within a team.          Strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities along with making effective decisions.          High level of integrity and ability to handle sensitive and confidential information          Level headed attitude with attention to detail.          Proficiency with or the ability to quickly learn different processes and procedures related to the profile.        Benefits & Perks        5 Days working          Flexible working hours          Leadership opportunities , irrespective of no of years you have worked & your educational backgrounds          Exposure, training & mentorship of in-demand skill set          Transparent and open culture          Cool Infrastructure with Gaming Zone, Breakout Spaces and Pantry          Encashment of leaves          Opportunity to work with industry experts          No Dress code          Paid Leaves          Maternity / Paternity Leaves          Health Insurance

column2: Eligibility Criteria / Branch:    Any Graduate, Post Graduate in HR       Rolls     Responsibility of HR Executive         Recruitment Process:       1)Coordinate staff recruitment and selection process in order to ensure timely recruitment of staff.   2)Prepare and put up advertisements for job vacancy in free websites, news papers, etc.   3)Liaise with Recruitment Agency for recruitment.       Employment Process:       1)Prepare Letter of Offer/KET for shortlisted candidate Inform and liaise with candidate to sign Letter of Offer and to provide necessary documents, Bank Account, qualification certificates, testimonials etc.   2)Arrange workplace, computer, office equipment/stationery, PPE.   3)Create the new worker/staff information in HR system Work Pass Process Familiar with MOM work pass procedures in terms of application of Work Permit and S Pass for foreign candidate.   4)Inform the candidate of the approved WP/S Pass.   5)Arrange candidate to go for medical check up and other MOM required process.   6)Arrange security bond before e-issue of the approved in principle letter Cancel WP when worker end their contract.   7)Apply for waiver of WP levy when worker returns for home leave.       Payroll Process:       1)Assist in uploading TMS to payroll, check and ensure accuracy of the TMS records.   2)Ensure all supporting documents for payroll are filed in the payroll file audit purposes.       Training Administration:       Training Administration:     1)Monitor and update the list of training courses attended by the worker and staff.   2)Source and register the staff for the training course approved by Management.   3)Highlight to Management on compulsory required training courses for workers/staff.   4)Arrange and make payment to training organizer upon registration.   5)Inform staff on the date and venue of the training courses.   6)File the certificates in the worker/staff personal file upon completion of the training course as part of projects submission.   7)To perform any other ad-hoc duties as and when assigned.       Skills Require for HR Executive:       1)Proven work experience as an HR Executive.   2)Familiarity with Human Resources Management Systems and Applicant Tracking Systems.   3)Experience with full-cycle recruiting.   4)Good knowledge of labor legislation (particularly employment contracts, employee leaves and insurance)   Demonstrable leadership abilities.   5)Solid communication skills.

column2: We are looking for Executives to join our HR department and help us grow our teams. In recruitment, the responsibilities include sourcing, screening, and providing a shortlist of qualified candidates for various technical roles. You will also network online and offline with potential candidates to promote our employer brand, reduce our time-to-hire and ensure we attract the best professionals. The responsibilities include creating referral programs, updating HR policies and overseeing our hiring processes. To be successful in this role, you should have an extensive background in Human Resources departments and thorough knowledge of labor legislation.      Ultimately, you will make strategic decisions for our company so that we hire, develop and retain qualified employees. You will build a strong tech talent pipeline and help hire and retain skilled employees for our IT positions. Also, you will foster a healthy workplace by ensuring our HR procedures always run smoothly.        Essential duties and responsibilities:          Developing and implementing HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy          Bridging management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances or other issues          Implement effective sourcing, screening, and interviewing techniques          Forecast hiring needs and ensure recruitment process runs coordinate learning and development initiatives for all employees          Measure employee retention and turnover rates          Oversee daily operations of the HR department          Monitor budgets by department          Implement training and development plans          Address employees queries (e.g. on compensation and labor regulations)          Required Skills and qualifications:          Proven work experience as an HR Executive, HR Manager or similar role          Familiarity with Human Resources Management Systems, Applicant Tracking Systems and resume database          Experience column2: A Guest Coordinator in HR typically plays a crucial role in managing the guest experience within an organization, especially during events, meetings, and visits. Here's a comprehensive job description for such a role: **Job Title: HR Guest Coordinator** **Job Summary:** The HR Guest Coordinator is responsible for managing all aspects of guest relations within the Human Resources department. This role involves coordinating the logistics of guest visits, ensuring a seamless experience for guests, and representing the organization professionally at all times. The HR Guest Coordinator works closely with internal stakeholders to understand guest needs and preferences, and collaborates with various departments to ensure guest satisfaction. **Key Responsibilities:** 1. **Guest Coordination:**  - Serve as the primary point of contact for all guest inquiries and requests.  - Coordinate guest visits, including scheduling meetings, arranging accommodations, and coordinating transportation if necessary.  - Prepare and distribute guest itineraries, ensuring all relevant information is provided in a timely manner.  - Welcome guests upon arrival and provide them with necessary information and resources. 2. **Event Management:**  - Assist in planning and executing HR events, including seminars, workshops, and recruitment drives.   3. **Communication and Liaison:**  - Serve as a liaison between guests and internal departments, ensuring clear and effective communication.  - Collaborate with HR team members to gather information and materials relevant to guest visits and events.  - Communicate guest feedback and requests to appropriate stakeholders for follow-up. 4. **Hospitality and Service:**  - Provide exemplary hospitality and service to all guests, ensuring their needs are met promptly and professionally.  - Anticipate guest needs and proactively address any issues or concerns that may arise.  - Maintain a positive and welcoming atmosphere for all guests, representing the organization in a favorable light. 5. **Documentation and Record Keeping:**  - Maintain accurate records of guest visits, including contact information, purpose of visit, and any relevant feedback or notes.  - Prepare post-visit reports summarizing guest interactions and highlighting areas for improvement.  - Ensure all guest-related documentation is organized and easily accessible. **Qualifications:** - Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Hospitality, Business Administration, or related field. - Proven experience in guest relations, event management, or customer service. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - Strong organizational and time management abilities. - Attention to detail and a commitment to providing exceptional service. - Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. - Proficiency in MS Office suite and event management software is a plus. **Additional Requirements:** - Flexibility to work evenings or weekends as needed. - Willingness to travel occasionally for off-site events or meetings.
column11: GRE, Guest relation, HR
