column2: We are in search for a driven, outcome-oriented, and experienced    Sr. Talent Acquisition Specialist    to join our Human Resources Team and play a pivotal role in attracting top talent to support our organizations growth in the India region.           The Sr Talent Acquisition Specialist    will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and hiring candidates for various positions within our organization     You will lead the end-to-end recruitment process, from sourcing and screening candidates to managing offer negotiations and onboarding     Sr Talent Acquisition Specialist collaborates closely with hiring managers and business leaders to understand talent needs and develop effective recruitment strategies to meet those needs     The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of recruitment processes, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment                Responsibilities:           Utilize various sourcing techniques to identify and attract potential candidates, including job boards, social media, networking, and employee referrals.     Review resumes and applications to identify qualified candidates.     Conduct phone screenings to assess candidate qualifications and fit for open positions.     Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers.     Assist in the development of job descriptions and job postings.     Manage the applicant tracking system (ATS) to ensure accurate and up-to-date candidate information.     Build and maintain relationships with candidates to ensure a positive candidate experience.     Provide regular updates to hiring managers on the status of open positions and candidate pipelines.     Collaborate with other members of the HR team to streamline recruitment processes and improve efficiency.     Participate in recruitment events, such as job fairs and networking events, to promote the company and attract talent.     Represent the companys employer brand effectively to attract top talent. Develop and maintain relationships with candidates, providing them with a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process.     Enhance and optimize recruitment processes to ensure efficiency and a positive candidate experience at every touchpoint.     Track and analyze recruitment metrics, such as time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, and quality of hire, to measure recruitment effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.     Prepare regular reports and presentations on recruitment activities, metrics, and progress to share with hiring managers and senior leadership.     Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and act as a trusted advisor on recruitment-related matters.     Provide guidance and support to hiring managers on recruitment best practices, interviewing techniques, and talent assessment.     Continuously evaluate and improve recruitment processes, tools, and systems to enhance efficiency, quality, and candidate experience.     Stay updated on industry trends, recruitment technologies, and best practices to ensure the organization remains competitive in talent acquisition.           Additional Position Details:           Full Time position     Onsite/Hybrid     Location: HYDE/HYDW      Core Hours: As per business requirement     Core Days Worked: Monday - Friday            Requirements:           Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.     5+ years of experience in recruitment, preferably in a high-volume BPO environment.     Strong understanding of recruitment processes and best practices.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.     Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools (ADP Preferred)     High level of professionalism and integrity.     Ability to work independently and as part of a team.     Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines.     Experience in using social media and other online platforms for recruitment purposes is a plus.     Strong organizational and time management abilities, with the capacity to manage multiple recruitment projects simultaneously.     Results-oriented mindset with a focus on delivering high-quality talent to meet business needs.     Knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and compliance requirements related to recruitment required.     Experience working with a US based company (preferred)

column2: We are looking for a dedicated and results-oriented Senior Sourcer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for driving end-to-end recruitment efforts, focusing on sourcing top-tier candidates, screening applicants, conducting initial interviews, and selecting qualified individuals who will contribute to the success of our projects. Your expertise in sourcing strategies and talent acquisition will play a critical role in meeting our staffing needs and achieving project objectives.                                                ?                   Key Responsibilities:                                 Develop and implement comprehensive sourcing strategies tailored to specific projects, utilizing a variety of channels and platforms to identify qualified candidates.                             Conduct proactive candidate sourcing activities, including but not limited to, sourcing through job boards, social media platforms, professional networks, and industry events.                             Screen incoming applications and resumes to assess candidate qualifications, skills, and suitability for project requirements.                             Conduct initial interviews with prospective candidates to evaluate their experience, competencies, and cultural fit for the organization and specific projects.                             Collaborate closely with hiring managers and project stakeholders to understand project requirements, prioritize staffing needs, and align recruitment efforts accordingly.                             Provide timely and accurate feedback to candidates throughout the recruitment process, ensuring a positive candidate experience and maintaining strong communication channels.                             Maintain accurate records of candidate interactions, application statuses, and recruitment activities in the applicant tracking system (ATS) or designated recruitment software.                             Monitor and analyze recruitment metrics and performance data to assess the effectiveness of sourcing strategies and identify areas for improvement.                             Stay updated on industry trends, market dynamics, and best practices in recruitment to enhance sourcing techniques and optimize recruitment outcomes.                             Contribute to the continuous improvement of recruitment processes, tools, and methodologies to streamline operations and enhance efficiency.                                 Why we think this job is great:                                 It's a 100% remote position where you'll work from home                             you'll have the resources you need to learn, lead, and deliver results                                     Qualifications:                                 Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.                             Proven experience as a sourcer or recruiter within the BPO industry, with a focus on high-volume recruitment and project-based staffing is a plus.                             Demonstrated expertise in sourcing techniques, including direct sourcing, database mining, and talent mapping, preferably within the BPO or related sectors.                             Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage candidates effectively and build rapport.                             Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.                             Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and recruitment software to manage candidate pipelines and track recruitment activities.                             Flexible and adaptable approach to recruitment, with the ability to adjust sourcing strategies based on project needs and changing priorities.                             High level of professionalism, integrity, and confidentiality in handling candidate information and recruitment processes.                             Able to support a Work from Home setup                             Own PC/laptop (Minimum of i3 processor, 4 gig RAM)                             Internet speed no lower than 15 Mbps download, 10 Mbps upload

Combining the power of human knowledge and data, Taggd has successfully fulfilled talent mandates of more than 100+ clients and ensured hiring managers success for half a million jobs from over 14+ sectors. With a vision to fulfil 1 million Jobs through our talent platform by 2025, we strive to connect people with people, people with companies, and people with opportunities. Just right. Every time. For more information pls visit  www.taggd.in About   the   Position: Role:   Senior   Recruitment Associate Associate Reporting   to:  Manager RPO  Location:  Pune (Pimpri) Working: 6 days (Monday-Saturday) Work from Office About   the   Role:  At Taggd, our people are our most important resource. Were looking for a highly skilled recruiter to become one of them, and to help us find them. The ideal candidate will have prior experience in recruitment or talent acquisition, with knowledge of screening, interviewing, and hiring practices. If you have a passion for finding untapped talent, driving company growth, and helping individuals find promising careers, we want to hear from you. Job   Requirements:  ??Excellent Written and Oral Communication ( Must Have )   ??Should have end-to-end recruitment experience.   ??Should have experience in Sourcing and Recruiting for Non-IT industry.   ??Stakeholder Management experience Mid-Senior level, Global.  ??Strong knowledge of professional network and job portals usage ( Must Have )  ??Head Hunting Skills( Must have )   ??Positive attitude towards work ( Must Have )  ??Ability and willingness to keep oneself updated of various developments in IT industry & latest technologies ( Must Have )  ??Experience of engaging specialized, high-skilled, or difficult-to-attract talent. ??High target and delivery orientation ( Must Have )  ??Advanced knowledge of MS Office, database management (ATS), and Boolean/advanced searches ( Must Have ) Daily   &   Weekly   Responsibilities: Work closely with managers to gain a comprehensive understanding of the clients hiring needs for each position and meet competitive hiring goals and expectations.  Manage the full recruiting lifecycle across a variety of open roles helping management find, hire, and retain quality talent. Work and form relationships with internal management teams to know the ins and outs of their departments and better understand their hiring needs and job specifications. Create and post job listings on various platforms, including social media and job boards. Utilize knowledge of multiple recruiting sources and execute innovative recruiting strategies to find quality candidates and prospect for new business. Screen resumes and prospects, qualify, interview, and manage candidates throughout interview process from prepping before interviews to assisting with final offer negotiation. Maintain a database of candidate records, including active and passive prospects, hired and terminated employees, and other relevant relationships. Follow up on interview process status and update records in internal database. OTHER   PERSONAL   CHARACTERISTICS: ??Dynamic, engaging, self-reliant. ??Ability to deal with ambiguity. ??Manage a collaborative and analytical approach. ??Articulate communicator. ??Self-confident and humble. ??Open to continuous learning. ??Intelligent, rigorous thinker who can operate successfully amongs't bright people.

column2: The IT Solution Design Specialist focuses upon the provision of solution design advice and administration regarding the design and implementation of a solution and the application architecture (e.g. for a particular platform/business capability/user journey) according to the overall vision and target architecture.  The IT Solution Design Specialist has a good understanding of established concepts and procedures in solution design and conducts technical analysis enabling the translation of the technical vision into a holistic solution design of future capabilities and features, including external dependencies, cross-domain integrations (APIs), and technical enablers/stories.  Typically reports to the IT Solution Design Manager.  Who you are  Demonstrates a good understanding of procedures and concepts through extensive experience and advises on the execution of designing end-to-end solutions and cross domain integration and APIs in support of the technology roadmap;  Supports the team to deliver activities related, but not limited to delivery of the target architecture vision and roadmap. Evaluating and prioritising roadmap items and translating them into designs, changes and non-functional requirements;  Uses communication skills to exchange ideas and information in a concise and logical way to support defining technical stories to enable business capabilities, fostering re-use of existing components and accepts technical features following demos;  Effectively interacts with colleagues, supporting with facilitating solution compliance to security, privacy, and regulatory needs, providing input and support to release planning and the adoption of new technologies into solutions;  Works effectively with colleagues through defining non-functional, operational, security and quality requirements for solutions;  Supports the team to maintain solid relations with engineering and delivery teams to ensure the development of technical stories are aligned to defined architecture principles and patterns;  Helps to ensure all relevant technical functions (e.g. architects, developers and operations) are involved during the definition and impact of the solution and facilitates interactions;  Performs other job-related duties or tasks defined by the supervisor or resulting from assigned agendas.  Not a perfect fit  Worried that you dont meet all the desired criteria exactlyAt Vodafone we are passionate about Inclusion for All and creating a workplace where everyone can thrive, whatever their personal or professional background. If youre excited about this role but your experience doesnt align exactly with every part of the job description, we encourage you to apply as you may be the right candidate for this role or another role, and our recruitment team can help you see how your skills fit in.  What's in it for you  We want you to feel happy and fulfilled at work, without compromising the other things in life that matter to you. There are lots of ways we support this, including hybrid working and generous parental leave. You'll also get four Spirit Days a year to focus on your personal development and wellbeing, plus a host of other great benefits too.

column2: We are seeking a seasoned Talent Acquisition with profound expertise in recruiting for technology / Non technology role for Shared Services or Global contact centres. As the Talent Acquisition Leader, you will play a pivotal role in driving our growth by strategically identifying, attracting, and onboarding top-tier talent. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successful strategic hiring initiatives, exceptional leadership skills, and a deep understanding of the nuances of talent acquisition in the shared services set up. Some of the key responsibilities will include: Act as a talent advisor to business leaders, providing insights on market demographics and internal recruiting processes. Lead and execute difficult and senior-level searches, owning relationships with senior executives. Develop sourcing initiatives, manage client relationships, and negotiate offers effectively. Serve as a subject matter expert for recruiting, continuously mapping company, and talent landscapes in key areas. Engage prospects, assess / screen candidates, and contribute to the knowledge base of the organization. Build talent networks and leverage industry sources to maintain a pool of qualified candidates. Lead client update meetings, conduct on-site interviews, and participate in offer negotiations. Coach leaders to enhance their talent acquisition capabilities, particularly at the senior level. To be eligible for this role you will require: 7+ years of progressive corporate and/or search firm recruiting experience, focusing on passive candidate generation. 5+ years of experience advising and influencing executive leadership. Proficiency in recruiting/sourcing tools, including applicant tracking systems and CRMs. Bachelors Degree or equivalent work experience. Strategic thinker with strong tactical execution skills.  Ability to leverage data for decision-making purposes. Results-oriented with a commitment to superior client service. Base Location: Bangalore, India.

column2: Title : Human Resources Business Partner Location : Hyderabad About Syngene  :  Syngene (www.syngeneintl.com) is an innovation-led contract research, development and manufacturing organization offering integrated scientific  services from early discovery to commercial supply.  At Syngene, safety is at the heart of everything we do personally and professionally. Syngene has placed safety at par with business performance with shared responsibility and accountability, including following safety guidelines, procedures and SOPs, in letter and spirit. Mandatory expectation for all roles as per Syngene safety guidelines Overall adherence to safe practices and procedures of oneself and the teams aligned Contributing to development of procedures, practices and systems that ensures safe operations and compliance to company's integrity & quality standards. Driving a corporate culture that promotes environment, health, and safety (EHS) mindset and operational discipline at the workplace at all times. Ensuring safety of self, teams and lab/plant by adhering to safety protocols and following environment, health, and safety (EHS) requirements at all times in the workplace. Ensure all assigned mandatory trainings related to data integrity, health, and safety measures are completed on time by all members of the team including self. Compliance to Syngene s quality standards at all times. Core Purpose of the Role: HRBP aligns business objectives with employees and management in designated business units. The HRBP serves as a consultant to management and works collaboratively with the leaders in the OU team in understanding the business strategies, goals, objectives and key performance measures of the OU.   Role Accountabilities    ??Collaborating closely with the Operating Unit level leadership team and provide required guidance and support with regard to Human Resources.  ??Provide strategic and operational leadership in the design, development, and implementation of robust people centric programs for the Operating Unit which is on fast pace growth path.  ??Partner with business leaders and other support functions to maintain a highly motivated and engaged workforce.  ??Implement new policies, procedures, and programs for the Operating Unit.  ??Responsible for onboarding activities and partnering with the recruitment team in hiring associates based on business forecasts.  ??Support the L&D needs team in conducting training needs assessment for employees across levels.  ??Provide MIS support for attrition analysis, includes- analysing Exit Interview, observe trends and highlight important aspects, prepare, and publish dashboards for Division and OU leadership.  ??Strong understanding of Labour related laws and statutes and ability to manage employee grievances in conjunction with the team.  ??Ability to influence and partner with different levels of the organization to achieve results.  ??Creatively apply strong business acumen with robust communication skills in driving the people engagement and initiatives  ??Liaising with other HR teams and providing active support to Operating Unit head, around recruitment, compensation planning, resource planning performance management, L&D, rewards and recognitions, succession, and career planning, etc.  ??Ability to drive a culture of Safety , Quality, Integrity and Compliance (SQIC).   What are we looking for?  ??A creative problem solver.  ??Adaptable to work in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment.  ??Ability to question the status-quo, to not settle for the expected norms and processes.  ??Business acumen - ability to connect industry trends, ecosystem changes.  ??5-8 Years of experience in managing human resources business partnering activities.  ??Excellent skills in MS office suite - specific high impact PowerPoint presentations. Syngene Values All employees will consistently demonstrate alignment with our core values Excellence Integrity Professionalism Specific requirements for this role 1. Experience:  Minimum 7 plus years of relevant experience in Human Resource Business Partnering and development. 2. Education:  Full time Postgraduate in Human Resources from a reputed institute. Skills and Capabilities -Strong written and oral communication skills. -Possess the knowledge and exposure to environment, health, safety and sustainability (EHSS) practices. -Ability to adapt to a continually changing business and work environment and manage multiple priorities. -Strong analytical skills and the ability to understand business requirements to develop appropriate learning solutions. -High level of professional and personal integrity and ability to exercise good judgment. -Team management skills in leading, motivating, and managing assigned team members to effectively deliver pre-determined learning goals and objectives. -Strong Interpersonal skills to effectively operate in a culturally diverse environment across a variety of positions and levels with astuteness and sensitivity.  -Skilled at building cross-functional and multi-level relationships.

column2: Associate Vice President, Talent Management Job Description We are seeking an experienced and strategic-minded AVP of Talent Management to join our company. As the AVP of Talent Management, you will play a critical role in developing and implementing talent management strategies that align with our organization's goals and objectives. You will be responsible for attracting, developing, and retaining top talent, as well as creating a positive and engaging work culture. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in talent management, a deep understanding of HR practices, and the ability to effectively lead and drive change within a dynamic organization. AVP, Talent Management Responsibilities 1. Develop and implement talent management strategies, initiatives, and programs that support the recruitment, development, and retention of high-performing employees. 2. Create and maintain a comprehensive talent management framework including performance management, employee development, succession planning, and career pathways. 3. Oversee the design and implementation of performance management processes, including goalsetting, performance evaluations, and feedback mechanisms. 4. Drive the development and execution of employee training and development programs to enhance employee skills, knowledge, and performance. 5. Lead the talent acquisition process, including identifying hiring needs, developing job descriptions, and partnering with recruitment teams to attract and select top talent. 6. Develop and implement employee engagement strategies to foster a positive work environment and enhance employee satisfaction and retention. 7. Collaborate with leaders and managers to identify high-potential employees and create development plans to accelerate their growth and advance their careers. 8. Design and implement diversity and inclusion initiatives to foster a diverse workforce and promote an inclusive culture. 9. Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices in talent management, and make recommendations for continuous improvement to drive organizational performance. 10. Partner with senior leadership to align talent management strategies with business objectives and drive organizational change and transformation. AVP, Talent Management Required Skills 1. Strong leadership abilities with the ability to inspire and motivate others to achieve results. 2. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization. 3. Strategic thinker with the ability to design and implement talent management initiatives that align with organizational goals. 4. Demonstrated experience in talent acquisition, development, and retention strategies. 5. Solid understanding of HR practices and employment laws. 6. Proficient in using HRIS systems and talent management software. 7. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to collect and analyze data to inform talent management decisions. 8. Exceptional organizational and project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines. 9. Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and changing environment and drive change within the organization. 10. Commitment to continuous learning and professional development in the field of talent management Required Qualifications 1. Overall, 18 plus years of experience is required in HR domain and Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in talent management and development portfolio and should have BPO/ITES industry experience 2. Proven track record of successfully developing and implementing talent management strategies and initiatives. 3. Previous experience working with senior leaders and executives to drive talent management initiatives. 4. Certification in Human Resources is preferred. 5. Demonstrated experience in managing a diverse workforce and promoting diversity and inclusion initiatives. 6. Strong knowledge of employment laws and regulations. 7. Experience working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. 8. Proven ability to manage and lead change initiatives within an organization. 9. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
column11: Talent Management, Talent Development, Succession Planning, Capability Building, OD Interventions, Training And Development, Competency Mapping, Learning And Development, Skill Gap Analysis, Training Management, Organizational Development

column2: A Sourcing Specialist is a professional responsible for identifying, evaluating, and selecting suppliers or vendors for an organization      Their primary goal is to find the best suppliers who can provide high-quality products or services at competitive prices      Sourcing Specialists play a crucial role in ensuring that the organization's supply chain is efficient, cost-effective, and meets the company's needs      The responsibilities of a Sourcing Specialist may include:Supplier Identification: Researching and identifying potential suppliers or vendors based on the organization's requirements and criteria      Supplier Evaluation: Assessing suppliers based on factors such as quality, reliability, pricing, delivery capabilities, financial stability, and compliance with industry standards      Negotiation: Engaging in negotiations with suppliers to secure favorable terms and conditions, including pricing, payment terms, delivery schedules, and service levels      Supplier Relationship Management: Building and maintaining relationships with suppliers to ensure ongoing collaboration, address any issues or concerns, and explore opportunities for improvement      Contract Management: Drafting and managing contracts and agreements with suppliers, including terms and conditions, performance metrics, and service level agreements      Market Research: Keeping abreast of market trends, industry developments, and emerging suppliers to identify potential opportunities for cost savings or process improvements      Risk Assessment: Assessing and managing risks associated with suppliers, such as supply chain disruptions, quality issues, or regulatory compliance      Cost Analysis: Conducting cost analysis and price benchmarking to optimize procurement decisions and achieve cost savings
column11: Sourcing Specialist

column2: SUMMARY        As a Roustabout on our offshore drilling platform, you will be an integral part of our operations team, contributing to the success of our projects through your hard work and dedication. Roustabouts perform a variety of manual labor tasks to support drilling operations and ensure the smooth functioning of the rig.    Responsibilities:         Assist in the assembly, disassembly, and maintenance of drilling equipment under the guidance of experienced crew members.   Handle and move equipment and supplies on the drilling floor, including pipes, fittings, and tools.   Perform general labor tasks such as cleaning, painting, and maintaining the rig structure and equipment.   Assist in the loading and unloading of supplies and equipment from supply vessels and helicopters.   Work closely with other members of the drilling crew to ensure safe and efficient operations.   Adhere to safety protocols and procedures at all times to prevent accidents and injuries.    Participate in safety meetings, drills, and inspections to maintain a culture of safety on the rig.   Assist in emergency response situations as needed, following established protocols and procedures.   Follow instructions from supervisors and experienced crew members to carry out assigned tasks effectively.               Requirements      High school diploma or equivalent.    Previous experience in a similar role on offshore rigs preferred but not required.    Physical fitness and stamina to perform manual labor in a challenging offshore environment.   Ability to work effectively as part of a team and follow instructions closely.    Willingness to work in remote offshore locations on a rotational basis.    Commitment to safety and adherence to safety protocols and procedures.               Benefits       Competitive compensation package   Health, dental, and vision insurance    Retirement savings plan    Opportunities for training and career advancement   Safe and supportive working environment

column2: Job brief: We are looking for an HR Recruiter to manage our full cycle recruitment, from identifying potential hires to interviewing and evaluating candidates. HR Recruiter responsibilities include sourcing candidates online, updating job ads and conducting background checks. If you have experience with various job interview formats, including phone screenings and group interviews, and can help us recruit faster and more effectively, wed like to meet you.   Ultimately, you will play an important part in building a strong employer brand for our company to ensure we attract, hire and retain the most qualified employees.  Role & responsibilities     Design and update job descriptions Source potential candidates from various online channels (e.g. social media and professional platforms like StackOverflow and Behance) Craft recruiting emails to attract passive candidates Screen incoming resumes and application forms Interview candidates (via phone, video and in-person) Prepare and distribute assignments and numerical, language and logical reasoning tests Advertise job openings on companys careers page, social media, job boards and internally Provide shortlists of qualified candidates to hiring managers Send job offer emails and answer queries about compensation and benefits Monitor  key HR metrics , including  time-to-fill ,  time-to-hire  and  source of hire Participate in job fairs and host in-house recruitment events Collaborate with managers to identify future hiring needs Act as a consultant to new hires and help them onboard. column2: Job Title : Labour Law Compliance Associate Location : Hyderabad Job Type : Full-Time Department : Human Resources Reports To : Compliance Manager Job Summary : We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated individual to join our team as an Labour Law Compliance Associate. In this role, you will support the compliance team in ensuring the company's adherence to labour laws and regulations. This position is ideal for individuals with 1-2 years of their career in labour law compliance. Key Responsibilities: Research and Analysis: Assist in researching state, and local labour laws and regulations. Analyze legal documents, government guidelines, and regulatory updates to ensure company compliance. Prepare summaries and reports on relevant labour law topics. Documentation and Record Keeping: Maintain accurate records of compliance activities, including audits, investigations, and corrective actions. Assist in the preparation and organization of compliance documentation for internal and external audits. Ensure timely and accurate filing of required compliance reports and documentation. Compliance Audits and Reviews : Participate in internal compliance audits to assess adherence to labour laws and company policies. Assist in identifying areas of non-compliance and help develop corrective action plans. Follow up on audit findings to ensure issues are addressed and resolved. Training and Education: Support the development and delivery of training programs on labour law compliance for employees and management. Assist in creating educational materials and resources to promote awareness of compliance requirements. Policy Development and Implementation: Assist in the review and update of company policies and procedures to ensure compliance with labour laws. Help implement new compliance initiatives and monitor their effectiveness. Communication and Liaison: Serve as a point of contact for employees regarding basic compliance questions and issues. Communicate compliance updates and changes to relevant departments and personnel. General Administrative Support: Provide administrative support to the compliance team, including scheduling meetings, preparing correspondence, and managing files. Assist with special projects and other duties as assigned. Qualifications: Education: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Law, or a related field. Experience:  1 to 2 years experience in Labour law compliance field Skills: Strong research and analytical skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. High attention to detail and strong organizational skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with basic labour laws and regulations. Experience in a corporate or legal environment.

column2: The HR Business Partner plays an essential role in establishing and driving HR programs/talent initiatives      forward within specific company functions, while always ensuring they align with the companys businessobjectives.      The HR Business Partner must possess deep business acumen; they must understand the company and itschallenges to help address the organization and talent needs.      The HR Business Partner must be able to work at all levels of the HR stack strategic, operational, and      tactical, influence effectively across all levels of a company, and navigate through ambiguity, recognizing when      it is appropriate to introduce more structure and process without derailing current production.      The HR Business Partner sets and aligns the global talent strategy with the companys business priorities todrive results, defines and drives the delivery of talent processes and programs, and actively participates in the      functional leadership teams as a partner to the business.        Key Responsibilities:        Partner with senior leadership to develop and implement effective HR policies and practices that will      support the strategic growth of the business.      Offer thought leadership regarding organizational and people-related strategy and execution.      Provide timely information and/or education for all levels of the company on HR issues.      Educate, coach, and partner with managers on performance management and employee      development goals.      Provide HR expertise in the areas of feedback, employee relations, development and coaching,      compensation, and organizational development.      Participate in the continual development of HR programs, such as recruiting, retention,      compensation, benefits, and Learning & Development.      Collaborate with the HR team to champion and accelerate a culture of excellence in which people feel      engaged and inspired to deliver top business results.      Develop people strategies and design approaches for diagnosing and enhancing organizational      effectiveness and employee satisfaction.      Educate team members on compensation practices, including compensation, performance feedback,      performance calibration, and career transitions.              Qualifications & Experience:      Basic:        Master s degree in Human Resources with a minimum 7 years of experience in the HR Business      Partner role.      Successful experience as an HR leader in a 500 employee company aligned to the specific HR Business      Partner role/client group.      Demonstrated experience in the various HR functional areas, especially organization development,      change management, and employee relations.      A deep knowledge of HR programs and practices, including applicable state and federal employment      laws and regulations.        Preferred:        Demonstrated analytical thinking, problem solving, and decision making skills. Critical thinker with      success in developing innovative solutions to business issues.      Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written.      Demonstrated credibility and integrity in communications to ensure information flows upward and      downward.      Ability to listen and understand the needs of the employees, together with those of the company.      Ability to stylistically adapt communication based on audience.      High integrity/will stop at nothing to safeguard compliance standards and company values      COE background, i.e., Analytics, Compensation, HRIT, HR Ops.      Ability to manage multiple, complex issues and prioritize projects concurrently      Lead management in organizational assessment and diagnosis to turn business strategies into action.      Provide and demonstrate change management leadership.      Coach and influence to achieve business results.      Use knowledge of the business strategy or the ability to probe for required understanding of business      strategy/context in order to properly align solutions or problem solving approaches.      Make decisions that effectively incorporate global context and support necessary collaboration across      org/geo boundaries.

column1: HR Business Process Associate ( Night shift)
column2: NOTE:  Please apply only if you are willing to work in the night shift and from the office.  Shift Hours - 7:30pm -- 3:30am IST HRBPA Roles & Responsibilities:  Specialized in interpreting and applying HR laws, regulations, policies, program principles, and concepts to provide advice or technical services in one or more HR functional areas; conducting factfinding and recommending solutions to resolve well-precedented factual, procedural, and/or recurring HR issues.  The individual would be responsible to process US H1B Work Permit (CAP, Extension & Amendment) request from partners. The responsibilities around immigration will include (but not exhaustive): Individual will have to coordinate, execute, and track onboarding process related activities and ensure a smooth transition of the new hire from TA to business, Liaise between employees, payroll, legal, I-9, and other internal stakeholders to support employees and their immigration actions Managing the H-1B Extension and amendment request received from employees Receiving and validating documents submitted by the employees as per checklist Assess eligibility for extension and amendment of work permit petition Determine prevailing wage applicable to respective US states Initiate Labor Condition Application (LCA) Filing Prepare LCA Input, determine Standard Occupational Classification (SOC) code for filing the LCA with the Department of Labor (US - DoL) as per US Citizenship & Immigration Services (USCIS) rules and regulations. Assist with PERM labor certification process; including posting physical/electronic notices, assisting with applicant review process and answering DOL sponsorship questionnaires for PERM labor certification filings Participate with H-1B Cap submission, petition review, updating internal resources, answering questions via the ticketing system, and other ongoing internal processes/projects as needed As needed, consult with and support employee relocation cases, providing the best possible customer support by managing the end to end process and experience of the relocating employee and stakeholders involved. Required Technical and Professional Expertise  Candidates should possess a degree in MBA HR or BBA HR  Basic US Immigration knowledge (Hands on experience working with any Immigration tool would be an added advantage) Good Communication Skills Command over written & spoken English is a MUST Basic excel knowledge, tech savvy and ability to learn new systems/ technologies right away Ability to handle multiple projects and deadlines. Knowledge HRMS or payroll software is a plus

column2: Greetings for the Day.!!! South India's leading Real estate company is hiring HR professionals. Casagrand Builder Private Limited is a real estate enterprise committed to building aspirations and delivering value. In the last seventeen years, we have developed over 30 million sqft of prime residential real estate across Chennai, Bengaluru, and Coimbatore. Over 22,000 happy families across 125+ landmark properties stand testimony to our commitment.   Job Summary:  The Learning and Development (L&D) Head is responsible for overseeing all aspects of training and professional development within the organization. This role involves designing, implementing, and evaluating learning programs to enhance the skills, knowledge, and performance of employees across various departments. The L&D Head collaborates closely with departmental managers and HR personnel to identify training needs, develop appropriate learning strategies, and ensure alignment with organizational goals and objectives. Key Responsibilities: 1.  Strategic Planning:  Develop a comprehensive L&D strategy aligned with the company's short-term and long-term goals. Identify emerging trends and best practices in learning and development to continuously improve training initiatives. 2.  Training Needs Assessment:  Conduct regular assessments to identify skill gaps and training needs within the organization. Analyze performance metrics, employee feedback, and industry benchmarks to inform training priorities. 3.  Program Design and Implementation:  Design, develop, and implement a variety of learning programs, including workshops, seminars, e-learning modules, mentorship programs, and leadership development initiatives. Ensure that training materials are engaging, relevant, and accessible to all employees. 4.  Training Delivery:  Oversee the delivery of training programs using a variety of methods, such as instructor-led training, online learning platforms, and on-the-job training. Coordinate with internal subject matter experts or external trainers as needed. 5.  Learning Technology Management:  Evaluate and implement learning technologies and platforms to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of training delivery. Stay abreast of advancements in learning technology and recommend innovative solutions to support learning objectives. 6.  Performance Evaluation:  Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of training programs through feedback mechanisms, performance metrics, and assessments. Make data-driven recommendations for program improvements and adjustments. 7.  Budget Management:  Develop and manage the L&D budget, ensuring that resources are allocated effectively to support training initiatives. Identify cost-saving opportunities and negotiate contracts with external vendors or training providers. 8.  Leadership and Team Management:  Lead and mentor a team of L&D professionals, providing guidance, support, and professional development opportunities. Foster a collaborative and inclusive team culture focused on continuous improvement and innovation. 9.  Stakeholder Engagement:  Collaborate with departmental managers, HR business partners, and senior leadership to understand business needs and priorities. Build strong relationships with key stakeholders to ensure buy-in and support for L&D initiatives. 10.  Compliance and Quality Assurance:  Ensure that training programs comply with relevant regulations, industry standards, and internal policies. Maintain high-quality standards for training delivery and content, striving for excellence in all aspects of L&D operations.   Perks and Benefits Incentives Profit Sharing Bonus Abroad trip Interested candidates can forward your updated resumes to jose.j@casagrand.co.in
column11: Training And Development, Learning And Development

column1: LR Academy Learning and Development Coordinator
column2: As a Talent and Learning Coordinator at Lloyds Register, the primary responsibility is to facilitate the coordination, implementation, and evaluation of training programs and initiatives within the organisation. You will work closely with another Coordinator, as well as the Talent and Learning Operations Lead, the Talent and Leadership Lead, the business TLBPs (Talent and Learning Business Partners), and the wider Talent and Learning COE (Centre of Excellence) team leads to ensure seamless execution of training activities that align with organisational goals.                          ?           Key Responsibilities:                       Training Programme Coordination:    Coordinate the planning, scheduling, and logistics of training programs, workshops, and events, ensuring smooth execution and adherence to timelines.               Training Coordination Support:    Provide logistical support for internal and external training events, including venue booking, equipment setup, catering arrangements, and participant communications.               Training Administration:    Manage training records, attendance, and evaluations using learning management systems (LMS) or other tracking tools, maintaining accurate and up-to-date training documentation.               Training Evaluation and Reporting:    Collect and analyse training feedback and evaluation data to assess the effectiveness of training programs and make recommendations for continuous improvement.               Trusted Advisor:    Serve as a trusted advisor to the business, providing guidance and support in implementing effective training solutions that address skill gaps and support business objectives.               Stakeholder Relationships:    Build and nurture relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including internal clients and external partners. Respond to queries in learning programme inboxes in a professional and timely manner.                Financial Tracking:    Manage purchase orders, process invoices and support Operations Lead with tracking spend of training activities to allow effective reporting on talent and Learning Spend.                Collaboration:    Collaborate with Talent and Learning Leads and key business stakeholders around the core operational elements of the Talent and Learning activities               Continuous Learning:    Stay updated on emerging trends, best practices, and innovations in training and development methodologies, incorporating new ideas and technologies to enhance training delivery and effectiveness.               Process Efficiency:    Identify areas for improvement in talent and learning systems, processes, and procedures to ensure they are effective and efficient to meet business requirements.                     Key Health & Safety Responsibilities:                       Risk Management:    Review and regularly update the health and safety risk register to eliminate or minimise employee exposure to risks. Apply appropriate controls, communicate the results of risk assessments, and ensure health and safety considerations in all talent and learning activities.               Compliance:    Ensure compliance with health and safety rules, instructions, systems, and legal requirements for yourself and your team. Provide suitable training and ensure adequate resources are available to work safely.                     Technical / Professional Requirements:                     Experience of managing senior stakeholders and have a proven track record in core HR competencies and exposure to the associated risks.              Comprehensive knowledge of HR processes and Talent and Learning best practise.             Proven experience of training coordination or event managements.             The ability to work collaboratively, consult effectively and independently with senior levels of the organisation.,             The ability to work in a high performing motivating supportive and collaborative team environment.             Excellent verbal and written communication skills to address diverse organisational stakeholders.              Experience or exposure to Project management skills             Detail orientated with ability to work independently on own initiative and prioritise workload.             Proficiency in the English language commensurate with the work.                   In this role, you will play a crucial part in developing and nurturing talent within Lloyds Register, ensuring alignment with the organisations strategic goals and fostering a culture of learning and growth. Your expertise will contribute to the continued success and competitive positioning of Lloyds Register.

column2: Director - People & Culture, Location: Hosakote, Bangalore  Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match. Who we are and what we believe in Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.  Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the groups leading brands and entities. to drive the people agenda tYou will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who work with passion, trust each other and embrace change to stay ahead. We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail. Who we are and what we believe in Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.  Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the groups leading brands and entities. we create the foundation and frameworks for people growth and organizational development, to drive the people agenda that enables the realization of Group aspirations through people strategy and commitment. You will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who work with passion, trust each other and embrace change to stay ahead. Primary Purpose Group Trucks Operations (GTO) International Manufacturing (IM) is an organization with 25 years of existence in India, Bangalore, Hosakote. Reporting to the Vice President, GTO IM Hosakote, the Director of People & Culture is an executive leadership position with overall responsibility for People & Culture and Safety function at Group Trucks Operations, ensuring a focus on "Energy, Passion and Respect for the individual". This role will have a direct impact on developing and building a globally aligned, locally authentic People strategy. Critical to the success of the role, this leader is responsible for the effective leadership, management and mentoring of a high performing team of People & Culture, Organizational Development, Talent Acquisition, Learning & Development, Compensation & Benefits, HR Services, Employee Relations and Safety & Health, functions. With strong people leadership experience, the Director is well versed in managing people through change, maintaining Productive Industrial relations, coaching for performance, and developing a team culture that supports agility and innovation. Health and Safety will always be our number one priority, as well as understanding sustainability and how it is critical for better business results. This role will ensure effective leadership, coordination, and guidance to reflect and promote the company's mission, vision, aspirations, and values at all times. Key Responsibilities  Strengthening, promoting, and embedding a positive values-based culture that encourages inclusivity and diversity, accountability, and respect.  Translating group strategy through a people lens and leading a team of professionals to build the required organizational capability and culture to support successful and tactical execution.  Coach and support executive leaders in fostering performance through continuous dialogue, a growth mindset, and effective feedback.  Proactively build and promote strong employee trust and open communication between all levels of the organization using  Values and leadership principles.  Have cost-effective approaches to cultural and people management activities through improved productivity and optimization of processes, programs, and resources.  Support the business on Employee and Industrial Relations strategy including being able to constructively use industrial relations/workplace legislation to achieve productive outcomes aligned to the company's values.  Lead and implement strategic talent and leadership development frameworks, ensuring a workforce capable of meeting future demands.  Provide the leadership required to ensure consistent and effective operational and after Market performance of the group and through the implementation of regional strategy, drive to secure operational excellence and sustainable profitable growth.  Ensure People & Culture service functions such as Talent Acquisition, Employee Administration, VGU, Payroll, meet the policy objectives of the company and legislative compliance.  Strategically lead the Safety and Health function to realize Group's safety strategy in addition to buidling and embedding a safety culture across the organization.  Strategically direct Employee and Industrial Relations initiatives to ensure effective and consistent outcomes across the group which support business objectives and reflect company values.  Develop and administer effective Compensation & Benefits policies that are consistent with global policy and competitively meet the needs of the group and its country operations.  Secure strong talent development and succession planning, developing executive leadership competency and engagement.  Liaise with regional and global People & Culture colleagues to facilitate globally aligned, locally authentic strategy and initiatives.  Through consultation develop, review, disseminate and adjudicate where necessary, company policy to ensure effective best management practices, global consistency, and legal compliance.  Build relationships at all levels within to effectively maximize employee involvement in change management.  Be an inclusive and inspiring leader, acting as a role model to all employees.  Represent GTO Hosakote in Human resource Country Committee (HRCC) and LER meetings. Management Responsibilities Business/ Financial Management  Plan, allocate and manage relevant budget/s  Allocate capital and manage expenditure.  Report on operations according to company timelines and standards.  Effectively manage and allocate assets and company property.  Manage and report on business performance. People Management  Plan, set and communicate team direction.  Ensure clarity of expectations through accurate job profiles and objectives  Meet company timelines for performance and development planning.  Coach, mentor and counsel staff to enhance performance and mitigate issues / conflicts.  Increase capability and provide learning and development opportunities.  Discuss and formalize career plans.  Enhance engagement and effectively manage attrition.  Recruit new team members and ensure adequate and timely resourcing.  Develop a strong succession plan, including cross-skilling.  Manage salary and incentive payments in conjunction with manager.  Build productive Industrial relations by closely working with Union. Other Responsibilities Health & Safety  Ensure a culture of safe working and a safe work environment for all staff.  Safety Knowledge Building.  Risk elimination & Legal Compliance.  Leading Safety Committee.  Promote wellbeing and health by supporting positive work/life choices, having an awareness of mental health and other health issues, and understanding support networks. Risk Management and Compliance  Ensure necessary documentation and Maintain compliance with all Labour laws / Labour code and social security regulations and statutory provisions pertaining to Plant, Contract Labour Management and related stakeholders.  Monitor and ensure adequate people related risk management and compliance processes are in place.  Contribute to strategic risk management and compliance activities, including ongoing risk identification and mitigation.  Ensure that senior management and your team have a good understanding of the Labour codes. Job Category: People & Culture Business Unit: Group People & Culture Division: Group People & Culture Travel Required: Occasional Travel Male or Female both are applicable

column2: Job Title : Manager/ Sr. Manager / AGM- Human Resource  Location:  Indore, MP Job Summary : We are seeking an experienced and strategic HR Head to lead our Human Resources function and drive business growth through people excellence. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and implementing HR initiatives that align with our company's overall strategy and goals, with a focus on talent management, organizational development, and employee engagement. Key Responsibilities: 1. Talent Management: Develop and implement talent acquisition, development, and retention strategies to support business growth. 2. Employee Engagement: Develop and implement programs to enhance employee satisfaction, retention, and productivity. 3. HR Operations: Oversee HR operations, including recruitment, on boarding, employee data management, and HR analytics.  4. Learning and Development: Develop and implement training programs to enhance employees' insurance knowledge and sales skills.  5.. Compliance: Ensure compliance with labor laws, regulations, and company policies.  6. Business Partnership: Collaborate with business leaders to understand business needs and develop HR solutions to support business objectives.   7. Change Management: Drive cultural transformation and change management initiatives to support business growth and innovation. Requirements: 1. Education: Postgraduate degree in HR, Business Administration, or related field. 2. Experience: Minimum 8-10 years of HR experience, with at least 5 years in a leadership role in the life insurance industry. 3. Certifications: SHRM, PHR, or GPHR certification preferred. 4. Skills: Strategic thinking, leadership, communication, problem-solving, and analytical skills. 5. Knowledge: Life insurance industry knowledge, labor laws, regulations, and HR best practices. What We Offer: 1. Competitive salary and benefits package 2. Opportunities for professional growth and development 3. Collaborative and dynamic work environment 4. Recognition and rewards for outstanding performance 5. Opportunity to work with a leading life insurance company and contribute to the growth and success of the organization If you are a seasoned HR professional with a passion for strategic HR leadership and experience in the life insurance industry, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity!

column2: Position Summary: Position will have accountability for the organization, execution, planning and administration of  audits within the Voya Financial (Voya) India Office, directing the evaluation of controls, reviewing  compliance with policies, procedures and regulations, and coordinating and directing reporting of  results of audits for the India Office to Voya management. Job Description  Role:  . Key Responsibilities  ??Stakeholder Management - Be the trusted advisor for Business leaders and work with  them to drive people agenda in line with HR strategy for the company and specialised  needs of people in the business unit. Providing direction for the business in all matters  associated with employees and will coach business unit management teams to  enhance individual and team capability in areas of HR operations activity, such as the  annual merit and performance cycles  ??People Plan - You provide insights, recommendations, feedback and ideas on the  development of the people plan, and you manage the implementation of the holistic  plan (e.g., talent management, leadership effectiveness, diversity and inclusion,  culture) for your business line and organisation as required   ??Organizational Diagnostics - You partner and consult with peers and HR COEs on  organizational diagnostics. Diagnose talent management processes/programs, talent  needs and risks; provide recommendations on organizational strategies, goals and  actions; and contribute to implementation plans based on results.  ??Change management - You design and implement change, adapting to new or changing  structures, cultural change, or business-specific programs/processes for an assigned  organization. You evaluate internal business drivers, environmental factors, risks and  benefits to foster change adoption, and collaborate to develop change management  strategies and training materials.  ??Performance Management -Own end to end performance management process for  your business line, train managers and employees on the process and ensure process is  followed as required. . ??Employee Engagement  Connect with employees and managers and drive  engagement though various initiatives.  ??Compensation & Benefits  Work with COEs on this topic to give advisory on annual  Merit and promotion cycle   ??Ensuring a consistent approach to HR activities and compliance with regional and  global policies and legal requirements whilst adhering to local statutory requirements  under employment legislation.  ??Process ownership for Employee Relations management, including disciplinary &  performance improvement & exit management  ??Analyse data and observations across the organization, highlighting trends and  recommending/driving solutions to the leaders and Head HR  Qualifications: Knowledge, Skills and Abilities  ??Business Acumen - The ability to understand the parts of the business and their  interrelationships. This includes skill in understanding the industry, competition, and  expected future developments and challenges, the business's competitive strengths  and weaknesses, opportunities to grow the business and reduce operating costs, and  awareness of the environment for opportunities.  ??Data Driven Thinking - The ability to systematically gather information from a variety of  sources, analyse information, identify implications of data, draw conclusions, generate  alternatives and solutions, and evaluate the consequences of choosing each alternative  using quality metrics and data. This includes the ability to convert general data and  findings into applied, specific information and suggestions that add value to business  planning and strategies.  ??Leadership Effectiveness - The ability to coach leaders; drive leadership development  plans that focus on the strategic investment in human capital within the organization  (e.g., talent identification and management, individual development planning,  management development, 360-degree feedback, succession planning, mentoring and  coaching).  ??Organizational Development - Knowledge and application of organizational  development principles. This includes knowledge of organizational behaviour,  organizational capabilities and change management, and workforce planning and  succession planning procedures.  ??Collaboration - Strong collaborative ability to work across various teams in HR and  influence people outcomes.  ??Ability to be a role model for employees  ??Comfortable to navigate through ambiguity , ability to handle difficult situations and  conflicts Required Qualifications  ??12-14 years of work experience in Human Resources  ??Master's degree in Human Resources, Business or related field  ??8+ years of experience partnering with a wide network of clients and across Human  Resources to deliver effective business solutions  ??Prior Experience in IT industry or Insurance /finance operations or Captive set up would an added advantage. Kindly share the updated CV to nithin.d@voyaindia.com Note: We are looking for immediate joiners.

column2: This is an exciting role, and we are looking for someone who has a genuine passion for their work and wants to think creatively about how they hire talent. They will be given the autonomy to lead the full cycle hiring processes and partner closely with hiring managers to provide proactive sourcing, networking and pipelining of all future hires in Bangalore, India.       Key Responsibilities           Identify, engage and attract experienced hires for the business via various sourcing methods     Leverage the use of technology, including applicant tracking systems and other recruiting systems to track applicants right from the sourcing stage     Proactively build and maintain a network of potential candidates through proactive sourcing and ongoing relationship management     Partner with the Talent Acquisition Manager in continuously improving our candidate and hiring manager experience     Partner with hiring managers, HR and other key stakeholders to build a customer centric, high performing culture     Leverage ATS as a strategic tool and ensure there is clean data for tracking and reporting Provide market insight to the business including competitive intelligence, compensation trends and other key talent factors evolving in the industry         Required Experience/Skills:           A proven track record in recruitment for technical positions including leadership roles (3+ years)     A great communicator, with excellent organizational skills     Strategic mindset with proven experience solving complex talent acquisition challenges and has implemented creative hiring strategies     Excellent stakeholder management experience at senior leadership level     You love to roll your sleeves up and own the end to end candidate experience as we continue to scale and grow     you're a brand ambassador for Diligent, and want the world to know about the great work we're doing     A quality, results-driven team player looking for an opportunity to genuinely make a difference               What Diligent Offers You           Creativity is ingrained in our culture.    We are innovative collaborators by nature. We thrive in exploring how things can be differently both in our internal processes and to help our clients       We care about our people.    Diligent offers a flexible work environment, global days of service, comprehensive health benefits, meeting free days, generous time off policy and wellness programs to name a few       We have teams all over the world   . We may be headquartered in New York City, but we have office hubs in Washington D.C., Vancouver, London, Galway, Budapest, Munich, Bengaluru, Singapore, and Sydney.       Diversity is important to us.    Growing, maintaining and promoting a diverse team is a top priority for us. We foster and encourage diversity through our Employee Resource Groups and provide access to resources and education to support the education of our team, facilitate dialogue, and foster understanding

column2: At Illumina, our people are our most important resource. We are looking for a dedicated Staff Talent Acquisition (TA) Specialist to become one of them, and to help us find them. As a Staff TA Specialist, you will be responsible for sourcing, attracting and hiring talents with the goal to fulfill business needs.         To be a successful Staff TA Specialist in Illumina, you need to be innovative and forward thinking in providing solutions for acquiring talents.         ?The ideal candidate should be familiar with social media and its applications in TA, has excellent interpersonal skills, is organized and detail-oriented, remains up-to-date with employment law and legislation, and keeps informed in company hiring plans.         Illumina is a fast-paced company with an open and collaborative culture, we are seeking someone who embodies and embraces these values.               Position Responsibilities:          Manage efficient, creative, fast-paced full-cycle recruiting strategies that support Illumina s rapid growth plan     Have a comprehensive understanding of full lifecycle recruitment in support of short and long-term business objectives     Act as a Team Lead and provide leadership, training and guidance to recruiters to improve their job performance     Work with the TA team and manage optimization of workload balancing across team, and escalate issues as needed     Foster a high performance, inclusive, collaborative, relationship-oriented team environment, creating a high trust culture     Work with recruiting team to help develop innovative talent acquisition strategies and programs for specific business units to attract and retain world class talent     Partner with senior leaders, hiring managers and recruiters to develop, drive, and execute on recruiting/sourcing strategies to ensure the best candidate and hiring manager experiences     Establish and maintain key cross-functional relationships with internal HR stakeholders     Establish and maintain relationships with business unit FP&A partners     Work with APAC TA Leader to manage the recruiting resources against defined headcount goals and outcomes                 Position Requirements:              Experience with applicant tracking system     Experience in managing a RPO     Ability to think strategically and analytically     Excellent communication and presentation skills     Supervisory experience leading teams in recruitment     Experience in developing, aligning, and executing recruitment strategy to meet recruitment initiatives and organizational needs     Ability to meet tight deadlines and work in a fast-paced, rapidly-changing environment     Ability to work in a collaborative global matrix organization     Demonstrated coaching and career counseling skills                     Preferred Experience/Education/Skills:          Possess a Bachelor Degree in any discipline     Minimum 8 years recruiting experience with 5+ years of inhouse corporate recruiting experience preferred     Proven ability to manage multiple projects and candidates simultaneously under minimal supervision.     Proficient computer skills and knowledge of Word, Excel, and Outlook required.     Proficient in sourcing techniques including Linkedin, Google, ATS mining, etc.     Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.     Excellent attention to detail.

column2: At Illumina, our people are our most important resource. We are looking for a dedicated Senior Talent Acquisition (TA) Specialist to become one of them, and to help us find them. As a Senior TA Specialist, you will be responsible for sourcing, attracting and hiring talents with the goal to fulfill business needs.         To be a successful TA Specialist in Illumina, you need to be innovative and forward thinking in providing solutions for acquiring talents. The ideal candidate should be familiar with social media and its applications in TA, has excellent interpersonal skills, is organized and detail-oriented, remains up-to-date with employment law and legislation, and keeps informed in company hiring plans.         Illumina is a fast-paced company with an open and collaborative culture, we are seeking someone who embodies and embraces these values.               Position Responsibilities:              Develop and implement proactive TA strategies and build a talent pipeline of diverse and qualified talents for current and future expansion business needs     Act as trusted advisors to coach and advise on attraction, selection and hiring to ensure a consistent candidate assessment process     Collaborate with Business and HR business partners to build understanding of business requirements and to map the role criteria, define position description and requirements     Manage end-to-end of the hiring process from sourcing, screening, interviewing, salary proposals and approvals to hire.     Organize and host branding events /recruitment drives to build pipeline     Innovates and executes projects to improve the recruitment process     Prepare reports, analytics and presentations for leadership team to provide insights of recruitment status and talent market landscape         Ensure positive experience for all candidates at the different stages of recruitment.         Participate in and contribute to employment branding activities     Ensuring the employer brand is fully leveraged, and embedded in talent acquisition touch process     Work collaboratively, share knowledge and influence the Talent Acquisition team     Accommodating any additional tasks and responsibilities as required by business conditions.                     Position Requirements:              Proven Talent Acquisition / HR experience         Structured and able to think strategically and analytically         Supervisory experience leading teams in recruitment     Experience in developing, aligning, and executing recruitment strategy to meet recruitment initiatives and organizational needs     Ability to meet tight deadlines and work in a fast-paced, rapidly-changing environment     Ability to work in a collaborative global matrix organization                         Preferred Experience/Education/Skills:              Possess a Bachelor Degree in any discipline     Minimum 6 years related experience and a successful track record in a complex recruitment model / environment.     Candidates with either in-house recruitment or agency experience are welcome to apply     Possess strong consulting and presentation skills and experience in conceptualizing and translating business objectives into Talent Acquisition solutions         Possess excellent communication, presentation and influencing skills to network effectively, establishing quick credibility, and building sustainable relationships     Excellent competency in Microsoft Office programs such as Excel, Powerpoint and Word. Experience in using Workday ATS will be an added advantage.     Able to approach problem-solving in a structured manner
