column2: Job Title: Functional Leader (Human Resources) Location:  Gurgaon Experience:  14-18 years Overview:  We are seeking a seasoned and dynamic Functional Leader in Human Resources to join our team. The ideal candidate will bring at least 14 years of comprehensive HR experience, with a proven track record of leading and managing diverse HR functions. Based in Gurgaon, this role requires exceptional leadership skills, strategic thinking, and a collaborative approach to drive HR initiatives that align with organizational goals. Key Responsibilities: Lead and oversee all aspects of the HR function, including HR operations, talent acquisition, HR business partnering, and learning and development. Manage a proficient team of HR professionals, including HR operations managers, talent acquisition managers, HR business partner managers, and learning and development managers. Develop and implement HR strategies, policies, and programs to support business objectives and foster a positive work culture. Collaborate closely with senior leadership to provide strategic HR guidance and support organizational growth and development. Drive initiatives to enhance employee engagement, retention, and satisfaction through effective HR practices and programs. Ensure compliance with all relevant labor laws, regulations, and company policies. Act as a strategic advisor to senior management on HR-related matters, offering insights and recommendations to drive business success. Foster a culture of continuous improvement and innovation within the HR function, exploring new technologies and best practices to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness. Maintain a strong focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives to create an inclusive work environment where all employees feel valued and respected. Drive performance management processes to assess and develop employee capabilities and ensure alignment with organizational goals. Requirements: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field; Master?? degree preferred. Minimum of 14 years of progressive HR experience, with a proven track record of leadership and success in managing diverse HR functions. Strong leadership and people management skills, with the ability to inspire, motivate, and develop high-performing teams. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build effective relationships at all levels of the organization. Strategic thinker with the ability to translate business objectives into HR initiatives and programs. Deep understanding of HR best practices, trends, and regulations. Proven ability to drive change and lead organizational transformation initiatives. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to leverage data to drive decision-making. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and effectively manage multiple priorities. Proficiency in MS Office suite and HRIS platforms. Strong ethics and integrity, with a commitment to fostering a culture of fairness, respect, and accountability. Additional Details: This is a full-time position based in Gurgaon. Working hours are Monday to Friday, with occasional flexibility required based on business needs. This position offers a competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance, retirement savings plan, and performance-based incentives. The successful candidate should be able to join the team within two months of receiving an offer.

Individuals with permanent recruitment experience are not the right candidates for this position.  This is a mid-level position in the company and will be the key to the success of the business. Role & responsibilities     Delivering on Staffing      (Sub-con) mandates for Tier-1 IT Companies and Captive Centres. Manage the Fulfilment team,      which includes allocating and tracking demands, driving teams for targets,      and measuring performance. Good understanding of the      technology landscape and capability to engage with experienced tech      professionals. column2: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Talent Acquisition/ Recruitment Lead to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate willplay a critical role in driving our talent acquisition strategy, attracting toptalent, and ensuring a seamless recruitment process to support the companysgrowth and objectives.                Key Responsibilities:          1. Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies toattract, assess, and hire top-tier talent across various IT roles, includingbut not limited to software developers, engineers, project managers, and ITconsultants.        2. Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffingneeds, job requirements, and desired candidate profiles.        3. Utilize multiple sourcing channels, including job boards,social media, professional networks, and referrals, to identify and engagepassive and active candidates.        4. Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, includingresume screening, conducting interviews, evaluating candidates, and extendingjob offers.        5. Build and maintain a talent pipeline to ensure a steadystream of qualified candidates for current and future hiring needs.        6. Develop and maintain strong relationships with externalrecruitment agencies and vendors, negotiating contracts and managingperformance to ensure optimal results.        7. Implement best practices and innovative recruitmenttechniques to enhance the candidate experience and improve recruitmentefficiency.        8. Stay updated on industry trends, market intelligence, andemerging recruitment technologies to continuously improve recruitment processesand outcomes.        9. Lead, mentor, and train junior members of the recruitmentteam, fostering a culture of learning, collaboration, and excellence. column1: Job Opening For Hr Payroll executive Male candidate For Sakinaka
column2: Dear Candidates, Title: Payroll HR  (Male Only Prefered) Salary -25k to 27k ctc  Experience-2 to 3 Years  Location - Sakinaka Near Metro station Overview:  As a Payroll HR Specialist/Coordinator/Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of payroll processing and administration, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies and legal requirements. You will also play a key role in supporting HR functions related to employee compensation, benefits administration, and record-keeping. Responsibilities: Payroll Processing: Collecting and verifying timekeeping information. Calculating wages, deductions and adjustments. Processing payroll transactions accurately and timely. Distributing paychecks or direct deposits to employees. Resolving payroll discrepancies and answering employee inquiries regarding pay. Compliance and Record-Keeping: Ensuring compliance with federal, state, and local payroll regulations. Maintaining accurate records of employee payroll data. Preparing and filing payroll tax returns and other related documents. Keeping abreast of changes in payroll laws and regulations and implementing necessary updates. Benefits Administration: Assisting with the administration of employee benefits programs, such as health insurance, retirement plans, and other fringe benefits. Processing enrollment and changes in benefits status. Coordinating with benefit providers and resolving employee inquiries related to benefits. HR Support: Assisting with the onboarding and offboarding process, including processing new hire paperwork and conducting exit interviews. Supporting HR initiatives such as performance management, employee relations, and training programs. Maintaining confidentiality of HR and payroll information. Reporting and Analysis: Generating payroll reports for management review. Analyzing payroll data to identify trends and make recommendations for process improvements. Assisting with budgeting and forecasting related to payroll and benefits costs. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree  If anyone interested so please share me your CV to yasmin@aforeserve.co.in or call 8451980441 if you not interested so please refer your Friend

column2: Company Overview: Itrend Solution is a leading e-commerce Company. We are dedicated to providing exceptional online shopping experiences, innovative solutions, and excellent customer service. Our dynamic team is at the heart of our success, and we are seeking a motivated and experienced HR Manager to join us in fostering a positive and productive workplace. Position Summary: The HR Manager will play a pivotal role in managing and enhancing the HR operations of the company. This individual will be responsible for developing and implementing HR strategies, overseeing employee relations, ensuring compliance with labor laws, and contributing to the overall growth and success of the organization. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HR management within the e-commerce or technology sectors and possess excellent leadership and communication skills. Key Responsibilities: HR Strategy and Planning: Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with the company's goals and objectives. Collaborate with senior management to identify HR priorities and drive initiatives that support business growth. Talent Acquisition and Recruitment: Oversee the recruitment process, including job postings, candidate screening, interviewing, and onboarding. Develop strategies to attract and retain top talent in the competitive e-commerce industry. Employee Relations: Foster a positive work environment through effective employee relations practices. Address employee concerns, mediate conflicts, and implement solutions to maintain a harmonious workplace. Performance Management: Implement and manage performance appraisal systems to ensure regular feedback and development for employees. Assist in setting performance goals and conducting performance reviews. Training and Development: Identify training needs and coordinate employee development programs. Facilitate professional growth opportunities and ensure continuous learning for all staff members. Compensation and Benefits: Oversee the administration of compensation and benefits programs. Conduct salary benchmarking and ensure competitive compensation packages. HR Compliance: Ensure compliance with labor laws, regulations, and company policies. Maintain and update HR policies and procedures as needed. HR Analytics and Reporting: Monitor HR metrics and analyze trends to inform decision-making. Organize employee engagement activities and events. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field; Masters degree preferred. Minimum of 7 years of experience in HR management, preferably in the e-commerce or technology sectors. Strong understanding of HR practices, labor laws, and regulations. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Proven ability to lead and manage HR teams. Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills. Proficient in HRIS and other HR technology tools. Ability to handle confidential information with discretion. Key Competencies: Leadership and team management Strategic thinking and planning Excellent organizational skills Adaptability and resilience Conflict resolution Employee-centric approach

column1: HR Business Partner - Digital & IT  Small Finance Bank
column2: Job Title: HR Business Partner - Digital & IT Location:  Navi Mumbai, India About Us:  Client is a rapidly growing small finance bank committed to providing innovative financial solutions to our customers. With a focus on digital transformation and technology-driven banking, we are seeking a seasoned HR Business Partner to join our dynamic team in Mumbai. Position Overview:  As the HR Business Partner for Digital & IT, you will play a crucial role in aligning human resources strategies with the business objectives of our digital and IT departments. You will collaborate closely with senior leadership and department heads to develop and implement HR initiatives that drive employee engagement, talent development, and organizational effectiveness. Key Responsibilities: Strategic HR Planning:  Develop and execute HR strategies that support the goals of the Digital & IT departments and the overall business objectives. Talent Acquisition:  Partner with the recruitment team to attract, select, and onboard top talent for digital and IT roles, ensuring a seamless and positive candidate      experience. Employee Relations:  Act as a trusted advisor to department heads on employee relations matters,      providing guidance and support to resolve issues and maintain a positive      work environment. Performance Management:  Implement performance management processes to drive high performance and development within the Digital & IT teams, including goal setting,      feedback, and coaching. Learning & Development:  Identify  skill gaps and development needs within the teams and work with L&D  specialists to design and deliver training programs that enhance      capabilities and support career growth. Change Management:  Lead  change management initiatives related to digital transformation and IT projects, ensuring effective communication and stakeholder engagement. HR Analytics:  Utilize  HR analytics to track and measure the effectiveness of HR programs and      initiatives, providing insights and recommendations for continuous improvement. Compliance:  Ensure  compliance with relevant employment laws and regulations, as well as      internal policies and procedures. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human  Resources, Business Administration, or a related field; Masters degree preferred. 12-18 years of progressive  HR experience, with at least 5 years in a strategic HRBP role supporting digital or IT functions. Solid understanding of  digital and IT talent markets, trends, and best practices. Proven ability to build strong relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels of the      organization. Excellent communication,  negotiation, and conflict resolution skills. Strong analytical skills with the ability to use data to drive decisions and measure impact. HR certification (e.g., SHRM-SCP, SPHR) is a plus. Location:  Mumbai, India How to Apply:  If you are a strategic HR leader with a passion for digital transformation and IT, and you thrive in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are the ideal candidate for this role.

column1: Opportunity | Lead L&D Aditya Birla Chemicals Worli Mumbai
column2: We are looking to hire a Lead L&D for one of the Aditya Birla Chemical Businesses based out of Worli, Mumbai. Job Responsibilities: The role will be responsible for or driving all aspects of the Learning & Development (L&D) function, from identifying training needs to designing and delivering impactful programs. Additionally, s/he will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing leadershipdevelopment initiatives for identified Talent pool members. Learning & Development plan: a) Conduct thorough needs assessments to identify skill gaps and development opportunities across the organization. b) Support the BCOE to develop a comprehensive L&D strategy aligned with organizational goals and objectives. c) Partner with stakeholders to design & deploy, Learning Needs Assessments to enhance the effectiveness of employee performance in achieving the goals and objectives of the organization. d) Keep abreast of industry best practices, emerging technologies, and line of business/client direction to anticipate and accommodate shifts in business needs and priorities. Learning Delivery: a) Partner with experts / Trainers to design training solutions aligned to needs. Utilize various learning methodologies, including e-learning, workshops, and on-the-job training. b) Oversee the delivery of training programs, ensuring a consistent and high-quality learning experience. c) Create & deploy framework for measuring effectiveness of training focussing on employee accomplishments and performance. d) Design and deliver / facilitate learning interventions basis need identified. e) Identify new needs from business, review, design/refine existing learning solutions including planning and process improvement beyond core learning and development offerings as needed. Talent Development & Engagement: a) Take ownership of talent development initiatives, focused on building a pipeline of high- potential employees. b) Design, implement and review Accelerated Leadership development programs to ensure a robust and sustainable talent pool for future leadership roles. c) Engage with Talent on their development needs and closely monitor progress. d) Design & implement initiatives to engage Talent and Talent visibility within the organization. e) Evaluate the impact of Talent development initiatives and adjust plans accordingly. f) Lead the development and delivery of coaching and mentoring capability. g) Enable the talent in creating their MDPs (My Development Plans). Partner with Line Managers & HR partners in actualizing the learning plan. Learning Technology: a) Stay current with trends and advancements in learning technology. b) Integrate innovative learning technologies to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of training programs. Learning Analytics: a) Manage and evaluate the effectiveness of development programs, measuring the impact on employee performance and the organization's overall success. b) Identify, design and share dashboards on progress and impact of learning and leadership development initiatives at defined frequency. Quantifiable Dimensions of Responsibilities: 1. Participants Satisfaction Score 2. Employee Engagement Score 3. Stakeholders Satisfaction Score 4. Training Effectiveness Score ??L3/L4 5. Training penetration 6. Time to proficiency/perform. 7. Digital Adoption 8. Readiness of identified Talent / Successors for next roles Complexities of the position: a) Designing solutions customized to unique stakeholders needs. b) Support in buy-in of these solutions by stakeholders. c) Influencing to enhance reach and impact of solutions. d) Relate to business impact through these initiatives. e) Partnering with stakeholders to ensure effective design and implementation of learning. column2: Learning and Development Deputy Manager, HR  India The ESS Learning and Development team is responsible for managing the learning needs of the workforce, providing soft skills training opportunities across Gurgaon, Bangalore and Poland. The learning opportunities are ultimately geared towards employee growth or career development, as well as catering to an enhanced employee experience with business offsite events. DISCOVER   your opportunity   The candidate must have a sound understanding of instructional design models that produce impactful, measurable results, such as increased employee engagement and improved retention. They must also be able to foster a collaborative, productive learning environment that captures the audiences attention and helps them meet their development end goals. What will your essential responsibilities include? Developing an awareness of the individual functional/business needs to create bespoke learning interventions Creating engaging learning activities and compelling course content, particularly for offsite events Visualizing instructional graphics, the user experience and the finished product to enhance participant engagement Creating exercises and activities that enhance the learning process Creating supporting material/media (audio, video, simulations, role-plays, games, etc.) Conducting any content research, as required Maintaining project documentation and course folders Facilitating learning sessions in a face-to-face format Creating communications to support the learning interventions, particularly outlining the program USPs to drive nominations, and communicating the impact of the program back to the business SHARE your talent  Were looking for someone who has these abilities and skills: An ideas-driven individual who comes from a teaching, training, or instructional design background, and is passionate about making learning an invigorating and empowering experience Should have a firm grasp of how people learn, and excellent writing, communication and collaboration skills Should have in-depth knowledge of learning theories and instructional design models Reporting and metrics: expertise in building KPIs and metrics, develop reports and assemble repeatable dashboards Ability to work self-directly and within small and large project teams; ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment Extremely well organized with unfailing attention to detail. Possess natural curiosity. Seek to understand the world around you, question when appropriate People skills ??should be able to facilitate in front of a large audience and hold attention Skills proficiencies Proficient in MS Office      Suite: Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, and Teams ADDIE, Gagne, and Bloom??      Taxonomy Project Management Tools Familiarity with Learning      Management Systems and learning data management Should be able to      curate/create/update content and activities independently FIND your future AXA XL, the P&C and specialty risk division of AXA, is known for solving complex risks. For mid-sized companies, multinationals and even some inspirational individuals we don?? just provide re/insurance, we reinvent it. How? By combining a comprehensive and efficient capital platform, data-driven insights, leading technology, and the best talent in an agile and inclusive workspace, empowered to deliver top client service across all our lines of business  property, casualty, professional, financial lines and specialty. With an innovative and flexible approach to risk solutions, we partner with those who move the world forward. Learn more at axaxl.com Inclusion & Diversity AXA XL is committed to equal employment opportunity and will consider applicants regardless of gender, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity and origins, marital status, religion, disability, or any other protected characteristic.  At AXA XL, we know that an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce enable business growth and are critical to our success. That?? why we have made a strategic commitment to attract, develop, advance, and retain the most diverse workforce possible, and create an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential.  It?? about helping one another ??and our business ??to move forward and succeed. Five Business Resource      Groups focused on gender, LGBTQ+, ethnicity and origins, disability, and      inclusion with 20 Chapters around the globe  Robust support for      Flexible Working Arrangements  Enhanced family-friendly      leave benefits  Named to the Diversity      Best Practices Index  Signatory to the UK Women      in Finance Charter Learn more at axaxl.com/about-us/inclusion-and-diversity.  AXA XL is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Sustainability  At AXA XL, Sustainability is integral to our business strategy. In an ever-changing world, AXA XL protects what matters most for our clients and communities. We know that sustainability is at the root of a more resilient future. Our 2023-26 Sustainability strategy, called ??oots of resilience?? focuses on protecting natural ecosystems, addressing climate change, and embedding sustainable practices across our operations.  Our Pillars: Valuing nature:  How we impact nature      affects how nature impacts us. Resilient ecosystems - the foundation of a      sustainable planet and society ??are essential to our future. We??e      committed to protecting and restoring nature ??from mangrove forests to      the bees in our backyard ??by increasing biodiversity awareness and inspiring      clients and colleagues to put nature at the heart of their plans. Addressing climate change:       The      effects of a changing climate are far reaching and significant.      Unpredictable weather, increasing temperatures, and rising sea levels      cause both social inequalities and environmental disruption. We're      building a net zero strategy, developing insurance products and services,      and mobilizing to advance thought leadership and investment in      societal-led solutions. Integrating      ESG:  All companies have a role to play in building a      more resilient future. Incorporating ESG considerations into our internal      processes and practices builds resilience from the roots of our business.      We??e training our colleagues, engaging our external partners, and      evolving our sustainability governance and reporting. AXA Hearts in Action :  We have      established volunteering and charitable giving programs to help colleagues      support causes that matter most to them, known as AXA XL?? ??earts in      Action??programs. These include our Matching Gifts program, Volunteering      Leave, and our annual volunteering day ??the Global Day of Giving.  For more information, please see axaxl.com/sustainability

column2: Job Description Summary: We are seeking a Workday Integration Coordinator to join our Global Workday Team. This role will be deployed on the ongoing WD-ADP Payroll Integration project. After a shadowing period with the current PM, the individual who will take up the role will autonomously supervise all operational activities linked with the ADP-WD Project (project deployment, maintenance, support and improvements). Job Description Key Competencies  Strong knowledge of PECI connector, Workday Compensation, Workday Advanced Compensation, and Workday HCM.  Previous Experience with ADP Celergo  Strong Project Management Skills.  Strong Data Analysis skills.  Ability to navigate complexity and ambiguity.  Strong team player with clear communication and coordination skills. Key Responsibilities  Project Management Coordination: Take over all key PM activities to ensure WDADP Integration Project completion.  End User Coordination: Liaise (and coordinate) end users throughout the project cycle, by answering their questions, providing follow-up, and transferring knowledge. Provide direct online support to end users.  Testing Coordination: Coordinate testing activities to ensure the correct functioning of the integration(s).  Support Activities Coordination: monitor integration failures and coordinate resolutions & provide support for end users during payroll cycle.  Monthly Data Monitoring: Monitor payroll data reliability on a monthly basis to ensure accuracy and integrity.  Integration Continuous Improvement: Ensure continuous improvement of the current WD-ADP Integration by consistently expanding the reach of the Integration, refining its precision, and always ensuring reliability.  Creation of Integration Global Reporting: Develop global reporting for integration activities.  Monitoring and Deploying Payroll Provider Technical Enhancements: Monitor and deploy technical enhancements provided by the payroll provider.  Follow Up on Long Standing Integration Issues: Track and resolve long-standing integration issues. This role requires a solid understanding of Workday and APD Celergo, strong project management skills, and the ability to coordinate with various stakeholders. It also involves monitoring and improving the integration process, supporting end users, and ensuring data accuracy. The ideal candidate will be a strong team player, able to navigate complexity and ambiguity, and have clear communication and coordination skills. The role is not remote.  The role will be based in our Mumbai Office.  Role will directly report to the HRIS Project Manager in Belgium.

column2: Position Title:  Head of Human Resources (HR Head) Location:  Vadodara, Gujarat Reports To:  Chief Executive Officer (CEO) / Chief Operating Officer (COO) / Directors Experience Required:  10+ years in Human Resources with managing more than 250 people in Manufacturing Plant. Job Summary:  The Head of Human Resources is responsible for overseeing all aspects of the human resources function within the organization. This includes developing and implementing HR strategies, policies, and programs to support the company's goals. The HR Head will lead the HR team and work closely with senior management to create a productive and engaging work environment, ensuring compliance with all employment laws and regulations. Key Responsibilities: 1. Strategic HR Leadership:  Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with the company's goals and objectives.  Act as a strategic partner to senior management, providing guidance on HR matters. 2. HR Policies and Procedures:  Design, implement, and maintain HR policies and procedures.  Ensure all HR policies and procedures are compliant with legal requirements and industry standards. 3. Talent Acquisition and Management:  Oversee the recruitment and selection process to attract and retain top talent.  Develop and implement onboarding programs to integrate new hires effectively.  Manage performance appraisal processes and succession planning. 4. Employee Relations:  Foster a positive work environment through effective employee relations programs.  Handle employee grievances and disciplinary actions in a fair and consistent manner. 5. Learning and Development:  Identify training needs and develop programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge.  Promote continuous learning and development opportunities for all employees. 6. Compensation and Benefits: Payroll Management  Design and manage competitive compensation and benefits programs.  Conduct regular market analyses to ensure compensation packages are attractive and equitable. 7. Compliance and Reporting:  Ensure compliance with all labor laws and regulations.  Prepare and present regular reports on HR metrics and KPIs to senior management. 8. HR Technology and Systems:  Implement and manage HR information/management systems (HRIS/HRMS) to streamline HR processes.  Utilize data and analytics to drive HR decisions and improvements. 9. Culture and Employee Engagement:  Promote and sustain a positive organizational culture.  Develop and implement employee engagement initiatives to enhance job satisfaction and retention. 10. Health and Safety:  Oversee workplace health and safety programs.  Ensure a safe and healthy work environment for all employees. Key Result Areas (KRA): 1. HR Strategy Development and Implementation:  Development and execution of a comprehensive HR strategy aligned with organizational goals.  Achievement of strategic HR objectives within the stipulated timeframe. 2. Talent Management:  Successful recruitment and retention of high-performing employees.  Implementation of effective performance management and succession planning processes. 3. Employee Relations and Engagement:  Maintenance of a positive employee relations climate.  High levels of employee engagement and satisfaction as measured by regular surveys. 4. Training and Development:  Development and delivery of training programs that meet organizational needs.  Improved employee skills and competencies through continuous learning initiatives. 5. Compliance and Legal Adherence:  Full compliance with all employment laws and regulations.  Zero legal infractions related to HR practices. 6. Compensation and Benefits Management:  Competitive and equitable compensation and benefits packages.  Regular updates and benchmarking of compensation structures. 7. HR Process Optimization:  Implementation of efficient HR processes and systems (SOPs).  Measurable improvements in HR operational efficiency. 8. Reporting and Analytics:  Timely and accurate reporting of HR metrics and KPIs.  Data-driven decision-making to enhance HR functions. 9. Health and Safety:  Effective health and safety programs in place.  Reduction in workplace incidents and accidents. Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).  Professional HR certification (e.g., SHRM-SCP, SPHR) is an advantage.  Proven experience in HR leadership roles with a track record of developing and implementing successful HR strategies.  Strong knowledge of employment laws and regulations.  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.  Ability to lead and inspire a team.  Proficient in HRIS/HRMS and other HR software. Skills:  Strategic thinking and problem-solving  Leadership and team management  Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities  Strong organizational skills  Analytical and data-driven approach  Negotiation and conflict resolution  Change management Application Process:  Interested candidates should submit their resume and cover letter detailing their relevant experience and explaining why they are the ideal candidate for this position. You can email your resume at careers@futuresolar.net
column11: Compensation Management, Payroll Management, HR Policy Formulation, Compliance, HR Generalist Activities, Succession Planning, HR Operations, Legal Compliance, HR Budgeting, Talent Acquisition, HRMS, HR Strategy, Performance Management, HR Analytics, HR Planning

column2: We are seeking a seasoned Talent Acquisition with profound expertise in recruiting for technology / Non technology role for Shared Services or Global contact centres. As the Talent Acquisition Leader, you will play a pivotal role in driving our growth by strategically identifying, attracting, and onboarding top-tier talent. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successful strategic hiring initiatives, exceptional leadership skills, and a deep understanding of the nuances of talent acquisition in the shared services set up.             Key responsibilities      Act as a talent advisor to business leaders, providing insights on market demographics and internal recruiting processes.     Lead and execute difficult and senior-level searches, owning relationships with senior executives.     Develop sourcing initiatives, manage client relationships, and negotiate offers effectively.     Serve as a subject matter expert for recruiting, continuously mapping company, and talent landscapes in key areas.     Engage prospects, assess / screen candidates, and contribute to the knowledge base of the organization.     Build talent networks and leverage industry sources to maintain a pool of qualified candidates.     Lead client update meetings, conduct on-site interviews, and participate in offer negotiations.     Coach leaders to enhance their talent acquisition capabilities, particularly at the senior level.             Role requirements      7+ years of progressive corporate and/or search firm recruiting experience, focusing on passive candidate generation.     5+ years of experience advising and influencing executive leadership.     Proficiency in recruiting/sourcing tools, including applicant tracking systems and CRMs.     Bachelor s Degree or equivalent work experience.     Strategic thinker with strong tactical execution skills.     Ability to leverage data for decision-making purposes.     Results-oriented with a commitment to superior client service.

column2: Role & responsibilities  : Calendar Management: Coordinate and manage executives' schedules, including appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements, ensuring efficient time utilization. Communication Handling: Serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external stakeholders, screening and prioritizing correspondence, emails, and phone calls. Administrative Support: Provide comprehensive administrative support, including drafting and editing correspondence, preparing reports, and maintaining accurate records. Meeting Coordination: Arrange and organize meetings, conferences, and events, including logistical arrangements, agenda preparation, and documentation. Confidentiality Management: Maintain strict confidentiality of sensitive information, exercising discretion in handling confidential documents and communications. Task Prioritization: Anticipate and prioritize tasks, deadlines, and deliverables, ensuring timely completion and proactive follow-up on pending issues. Travel Arrangements: Facilitate travel arrangements, including booking flights, accommodations, transportation, and itinerary planning, to ensure smooth and hassle-free travel experiences. Documentation Management: Manage and maintain filing systems, databases, and other organizational tools, ensuring easy retrieval and access to relevant information. Project Support: Provide administrative support for special projects and initiatives, coordinating resources, tracking progress, and facilitating communication among team members. Ad Hoc Support: Assist executives with ad hoc tasks and projects as required, demonstrating flexibility and willingness to contribute to the overall success of the team. Proven 5-8 years of experience as an executive assistant, personal secretary, or similar role, preferably supporting C-suite executives. Proficiency in office productivity software (e.g., Microsoft Office suite, Google Workspace) and familiarity with administrative tools and systems. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with a professional and courteous demeanour. Strong organizational and multitasking abilities, with keen attention to detail and accuracy. Discretion and integrity in handling confidential information and sensitive situations. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a collaborative team. Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Strong problem-solving skills and proactive approach to addressing challenges effectively. column2: As an Inspection Coordinator within SBM, you have the responsibility to oversee and manage supplier s quality assurance of the equipment and commodities purchased by SBM       Additionally, you may be required to perform surveillance of the supplier s operations, evaluation of the effectiveness of the suppliers quality system implementation, and inspection at the supplier shop                                Your specific tasks will include:                              Arranging for Supplier Plant Surveys when requested by the Project Procurement Manager.                              Arranging for evaluation of a suppliers Quality System.                              Coordinating quality-related supplier matters with clients and others.                              Participating in bid clarification and supplier pre-inspection meetings as required.                                  Review and approval of vendor s QAP and ITP in conjunction with engineering.                              Preparing and issuing Inspection Assignment Instructions to TPI agencies                              Review and distribution of the inspection reports received from TPI agencies                              Communicating nonconformities (NCRs) to the project team members, and verifying corrective action and NCR resolution.                              Issuing releases for shipment of acceptable products.                                  Coordinate with construction for resolution of supplier-related site issued quality observations                                  In the case of this includes performing the inspection at supplier shop, then the inspection coordinator will also be:                              Performing Evaluations of a Supplier Quality System as requested.                              Performing Supplier Plant Surveys.                              Monitoring and reporting on the effectiveness of the Suppliers quality system.                              Verifying materials (MTRs, Material Identification, etc).                              Performing surveillance of manufacturing operations (forming, welding, finishes, etc).                              Witnessing nondestructive examinations/testing and reviewing results.                                          REQUIREMENTS                                     Bachelor s or Master s degree in the relevant field of Engineering and minimum of 8 to 10 years of experience in the Oil Gas, Petrochemical, or similar business in quality-related position.                              Knowledge of applicable specifications, codes, and standards typical in the Oil and Gas industry                                  Proven experience in managing inspection activities in local and global supplier shops                              Leadership skills and proactive behavior;                              Problem solver and ability to foresee quality issues in advance                              Willingness to travel and flexible/adaptable                              Good communication skills (both written and verbal).

column2: Greetings from  Novac..!!   Novac is currently hiring for Soft Skills Trainer - Chennai. Join one of India's Top 100 Best Companies to Work for, Novac Technology Solutions Private Limited. As a digital transformation and cloud solutions company with expertise in various industry segments, we innovate and create a niche for organizations in an ever-evolving landscape.    Job Title: Soft Skills Trainer Job Summary:  We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Soft Skills Trainer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and delivering training programs aimed at enhancing the soft skills of our employees. The Soft Skills Trainer will work closely with various departments to identify training needs and create customized solutions to address them. Additionally, the candidate will evaluate the effectiveness of training programs and make necessary adjustments to ensure maximum impact. Responsibilities: Design      and develop comprehensive soft skills training programs tailored to the needs of different departments and levels within the organization. Deliver      engaging and interactive training sessions both in-person and virtually, using a variety of instructional techniques and formats. Collaborate  with department heads and HR to identify specific skill gaps and training      needs within the organization. Create and maintain training materials, including presentations, handouts, and multimedia resources. Utilize assessment tools and techniques to measure the effectiveness of training      programs and identify areas for improvement.  Utilize learning management      systems (LMS) and other online learning platforms to deploy and manage      training courses, track learner progress, and evaluate learning outcomes. Provide one-on-one coaching and feedback to employees to help them develop and      enhance their soft skills.  Evaluate the effectiveness of      online training programs through data analysis, learner feedback, and      performance assessments, and make continuous improvements to enhance      learning outcomes. Stay updated on the latest trends and best practices in soft skills training and incorporate relevant advancements into training programs. Work  closely with external training providers and consultants as needed to supplement internal training efforts.   Strong understanding of      instructional design principles, adult learning theory, and online      pedagogical best practices. Excellent communication and      facilitation skills, with the ability to engage remote learners and create      interactive online learning experiences. Demonstrated expertise in areas      such as communication, leadership, teamwork, emotional intelligence, and      interpersonal skills.  Proficiency in using learning      management systems (LMS), authoring tools, multimedia editing software,      and other online learning technologies. Act as a mentor and resource for other trainers or facilitators within the organization. Collaborate with other departments to integrate soft skills training into broader  talent development initiatives.   Qualifications:  Bachelors/Master's degree in Education, Human Resources, Psychology, Business Administration, or a related field. Masters degree preferred. Experience:   [8-12] years of relevant experience. Preferred Female candidate Interested candidates can share your updated CV to lekha.sk@novactech.in

column2: Duties & responsibilities     Strategic HR Leadership: Develop and implement HR strategies that support the plant's overall objectives and drive employee engagement, productivity, and retention. Collaborate with plant leadership to align HR initiatives with business goals and identify opportunities for continuous improvement. Provide strategic guidance on talent management, succession planning, organizational development, and workforce planning. Industrial Relations: Cultivate and sustain positive relationships with labour unions, fostering open communication channels and collaborative partnerships. Lead negotiations during collective bargaining agreements, advocating for the organization's interests while ensuring fair treatment of employees. Develop and implement strategies to resolve labour disputes and conflicts effectively, promoting a harmonious work environment. Employee Relations: Foster a positive work environment by promoting open communication, conflict resolution, and a culture of respect and inclusion. Address employee relations issues promptly and effectively, ensuring compliance with company policies, labour laws, and regulations. Conduct investigations into employee complaints, grievances, and disciplinary matters as needed. Talent Acquisition and Onboarding: Develop recruitment strategies to attract and retain top talent, including sourcing, interviewing, and selecting candidates for various roles within the plant. Oversee the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring a smooth transition into the organization and alignment with job expectations. Performance Management: Implement performance management processes, including goal setting, performance evaluations, and feedback mechanisms to drive employee development and accountability. Provide coaching and support to managers in conducting performance reviews and addressing performance issues proactively. Training and Development: Identify training needs within the plant and coordinate the delivery of relevant training programs to enhance employee skills and competencies. Support career development initiatives, including mentorship programs, leadership development, and succession planning efforts. column2: Hiring for HRBP- Deputy Manager   Job Description  Role: This HRBP role supports technology line of business at Voya India and works closely with the business leadership teams to drive business outcomes through people.   Key Responsibilities Stakeholder Management - Be the trusted advisor for Business leaders and work with them to drive people agenda in line with HR strategy for the company and specialised needs of people in the business unit. Providing direction for the business in all matters associated with employees and will coach business unit management teams to enhance individual and team capability in areas of HR operations activity, such as the annual merit and performance cycles People Plan - You provide insights, recommendations, feedback and ideas on the development of the people plan, and you manage the implementation of the holistic plan (e.g., talent management, leadership effectiveness, diversity and inclusion, culture) for your business line and organisation as required  Organizational Diagnostics - You partner and consult with peers and  HR COEs on organizational diagnostics. Diagnose talent management processes/programs, talent needs and risks; provide recommendations on organizational strategies, goals and actions; and contribute to implementation plans based on results. Change management - You design and implement change, adapting to new or changing structures, cultural change, or business-specific programs/processes for an assigned organization. You evaluate internal business drivers, environmental factors, risks and benefits to foster change adoption, and collaborate to develop change management strategies and training materials. Performance Management -Own end to end performance management process for your business line, train managers and employees on the process and ensure process is followed as required. Employee Engagement  Connect with employees and managers and drive engagement though various initiatives. Compensation & Benefits  Work with COEs on this topic to give advisory on annual Merit and promotion cycle  Ensuring a consistent approach to HR activities and compliance with regional and global policies and legal requirements whilst adhering to local statutory requirements under employment legislation.  Process ownership for Employee Relations management, including disciplinary & performance improvement & exit management COVID/Workplace support for managers/employees such as tracking COVID cases, employees and report back to respective parties. Analyse data and observations across the organization, highlighting trends and recommending/driving solutions to the leaders and Head HR  Qualifications: Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Business Acumen - The ability to understand the parts of the business and their interrelationships. This includes skill in understanding the industry, competition, and expected future developments and challenges, the business's competitive strengths and weaknesses, opportunities to grow the business and reduce operating costs, and awareness of the environment for opportunities. Data Driven Thinking - The ability to systematically gather information from a variety of sources, analyse information, identify implications of data, draw conclusions, generate alternatives and solutions, and evaluate the consequences of choosing each alternative using quality metrics and data. This includes the ability to convert general data and findings into applied, specific information and suggestions that add value to business planning and strategies. Leadership Effectiveness - The ability to coach leaders; drive leadership development plans that focus on the strategic investment in human capital within the organization (e.g., talent identification and management, individual development planning, management development, 360-degree feedback, succession planning, mentoring and coaching). Organizational Development - Knowledge and application of organizational development principles. This includes knowledge of organizational behaviour, organizational capabilities and change management, and workforce planning and succession planning procedures. Collaboration - Strong collaborative ability to work across various teams in HR and influence people outcomes. Ability to be a role model for employees  Comfortable to navigate through ambiguity, ability to handle difficult situations and conflicts Required Qualifications 10-12 years of work experience in Human Resources Master's degree in Human Resources, Business or related field 7+ years of experience in business partnering with a wide network of clients and across Human Resources to deliver effective business solutions Prior Experience in IT industry or Insurance /finance operations or Captive set up would be an added advantage. Interested candidates can share their updated CV to nithin.d@voyaindia.com

column2: Our Vision.           SBM Offshore believes the oceans will provide the world with safe, sustainable and affordable energy for generations to come. We share our experience to make it happen.               Our Profile.           We design, build, install and operate offshore floating facilities for the offshore energy industry. As a leading technology provider, we put our marine expertise at the service of a responsible energy transition by reducing emissions from fossil fuel production, while developing cleaner solutions for renewable energy sources. More than 7,000 SBMers worldwide are committed to sharing their experience to deliver safe, sustainable and affordable energy from the oceans for generations to come. Together, we are driving progress forward in a TRUE. BLUE. TRANSITION.              #OGJS                               CONTRACT MANAGER                                     BROWN FIELD PROJECTS                                       RESPONSIBILITIES & MAIN TASKS                                       Provide the Project Manager and his/her leads as part of the PMT with Contract Management Support.                                 Lead the formation, negotiation and execution of Enabling Agreement and Work Order terms for Project Work.                                 Lead, coordinate and present in conjunction with the Project Manager, Enabling Agreement proposals and then upon gate review approval, oversee Work Order execution.                                 Provide PMT with breakdown of the Enabling Agreement & Work Order contracting terms.                                 Assess changes, claims and delays under the Enabling Agreement and Work Order terms.                                 Assist the Project Manager and PMT if work executed through intercompany agreements.                                 Prepare strategies and plans to overcome commercial / contractual exposures.                                 Liaise with Insurance for event coverage, under CAR, P&I, H&M, WC, PL and IP policies.                                 Assist supply chain professionals with the preparation of standard forms of contracting for subcontracting for services and supply of goods and materials; and                                 Assist with any supply chain, exposures, claims and delays; and when to manage issues up (in conjunction with PMT) to the Client.                                 Maintain accurate records for all correspondence, Change Orders, Commercial Exposures and Claims, Amendments and Invoicing and keep PMT regularly updated.                                 Coordinate PMT and Subject Matter Expert input for Change Order Proposals / Change Orders, Letters and Amendments.                                 Chair all internal/external commercial meetings and keep accurate records of discussions and decisions.                                 Provide any and all input into weekly and monthly reporting, both internal and external.                                 Identify Risk and Opportunities in conjunction with PMT, register, monitor and report using Risk Platform DANTE.                                       JOB REQUIREMENTS                                   Specific skills / expertise / product:                                        Degree or MBA in one of the following disciplines Business Management, Law, Construction Law, Contract Management, Engineering or Quantity Surveying.                                      10+ years experience, preferably in Oil and Gas Offshore industry, in Contract, Commercial or Project Management.                                     Strong demonstration of written advocacy.                                     Will understand the complexities and have experience in managing a network of contracting requirements and relationships with intricate knowledge of drafting compensation elements.                                     Have knowledge and experience of contract drafting and understanding of contract liabilities and indemnities, including for example, extensions of time, change orders, insurance regimes, consequential loss, liquidated damages and capped liabilities.                                     Familiarity with corporate structures (including joint ventures).                                     Awareness of contractual relationships, for example, concepts such as contract amendments, novations and assignment of contracts.                                     Experience in negotiating outcomes and involvement in claims resolution.                                     Will have post-Award contract management experience, typically in Lump Sum, Reimbursable and Remeasurable pricing structures.                                     Capable of preparing delay and extension of time claims.                                     Awareness / Knowledge of HSSE&Q Management Systems / Procedures.                                      Experienced user of P6, SharePoint and MS Visio, word, excel and PowerPoint.                                       Behaviours & inter-personal skills - Key points                                      HSSEQ aware and to be HSSEQ KPI and performance targets conscious.                                 Must be a self-leader and work well in a team, but with capability to work alone when required.                                 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.                                 Be strategic, forward thinking and an all-inclusive operator when planning and providing solutions.                                 Establish and maintain relationship building abilities at all levels.                                 Exemplary communication skills and housekeeping mentality (record keeping).                                 Sharp stakeholder engagement, capable of summarizing and presenting detailed contractual issues for senior management consultation.                                 Fluent in English - written and verbal.                               GENERAL INFORMATION                 SBM Offshore N.V. is a listed holding company that is headquartered in Amsterdam. It holds direct and indirect interests in other companies that collectively with SBM Offshore N.V. form the SBM Offshore Group ( the Company ). For further information, please visit our website at www.sbmoffshore.com . The companies in which SBM Offshore N.V., directly and indirectly, owns investments are separate entities.             SBM Offshore is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. SBM Offshore does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. column2: Role & responsibilities     We are seeking a dedicated and experienced HR Executive with a strong background in the manufacturing industry. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing HR functions, including recruitment, employee relations, compliance, training and development, and performance management. The HR Executive will play a crucial role in fostering a positive work environment and ensuring the efficient and effective operation of HR practices in our manufacturing facilities.    1. Recruitment and Onboarding: Manage end-to-end recruitment processes, including job postings, candidate screening, interviewing, and hiring. Develop and maintain relationships with recruitment agencies and other sources of talent. Conduct new employee orientations and ensure a smooth onboarding process. 2. Employee Relations: Act as a point of contact for employee inquiries and concerns. Facilitate effective communication between employees and management. Address and resolve workplace conflicts and issues in a timely and professional manner. 3. Compliance and Legal: Ensure compliance with Factories Act and other Labor Statutory Act's. Maintain and update employee records and HR databases. Prepare and submit required HR reports and documentation. 4. Training and Development: Identify training needs and coordinate training programs for employees. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of training programs. 5. HR Policies and Procedures: Develop, implement, and update HR policies and procedures. Ensure employees understand and adhere to company policies. Conduct regular reviews of HR policies to ensure they are up-to-date and effective. 6. Benefits: Administer employee  benefits programs. Assist employees with benefits-related inquiries and issues. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Minimum of 2 years of HR experience in the manufacturing industry. Strong knowledge of HR principles, practices, and employment laws. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to handle confidential information with discretion. Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite. Strong organizational and time management skills. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Female candidates are preferred. Perks and benefits   Group Mediclaim Benefits.

column2: We have an opportunity for  Relationship Manager - Corporate Business  at PAN India location with INVOICEMART - A.Treds. A.TREDS Limited (a group company of Axis Bank)  is a national level online platform which  facilitates financing of Receivables of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) from buyers through financiers.  TREDS is in the business of opening accounts, uploading, accepting, discounting and settlement of Invoices and Bills of Exchange by way of Factoring and Reverse Factoring and provide such other services as permitted by the RBI from time-to-time. Invoicemart is an online receivable discounting platform for facilitating the short-term financial transactions in a smooth and efficient manner among the financers, buyers and sellers. To know more about the organization please visit our website www.invoicemart.com Role & responsibilities   Conceptualize & lead the L&D programs, including the on-boarding, self-directed learning, leadership development, succession planning, career progression and coaching, e-learning content etc. Work with functional stakeholders to develop and execute a learning culture through an aligned L&D vision. Assess new training development needs across the organization. In addition, support the development, re-design and implementation of existing and new training materials. Drive excellence in onboarding, continually looking to support regional/central new hires and managers and ensure the onboarding experience is enhanced. Design and promote e-learning strategy/LMS in the system along with collaboration with the Group Promote and drive the culture of Learning on the Go  Responsible for updating training roadmap and ensuring execution against training priorities Continuously evaluate current training curriculums (through surveys, observation and internal/external feedback) and recommend necessary changes/adjustments Advocacy of wider learning across content, promoting the sharing of knowledge and learning across the organization (e.g. through brown bag sessions) Measures, monitors and analyzes L&D progress through metrics dashboard & framework and regularly reports to management teams Help to drive and execute organization-wide change management & OD initiatives. Represent L&D function in various internal forums. Evaluate individual and organizational development needs through people interventions Facilitate training program and knowledge sharing sessions within the organization Manage the training calendar and track training budget for the organization Manage formal and information communications for L&D team interventions to drive awareness, adoption and attendance Preferred candidate profile     Experience: 5+ years  Great at communication, Active listener, presentation, and public speaking skills. Proven work experience as a training specialist Extensive knowledge of learning principles and modern training techniques An ability to manage the full training cycle Understanding of sales process and proficiency in MS Power Point and Word Any Graduate / Postgraduate Ready to travel PAN India, when required Interested candidates can share resumes on atreds.hr@invoicemart.com

column2: The Talent & Culture team is not being set up to bring in policies & processes. Rather, the idea is to build on this social experiment. How do we scale as an organisation & strengthen this unique culture while not resorting to life sapping policy documents and a culture of corporate drudgery. The team is working on organizational problems and trying to solve for them. Each member in the team will be an owner of specific business problems and will be expected to diagnose, solve and execute for the solution. The solutions of these problems could cut across HR functions enabling a multi-functional exposure to each team member. If you are someone who thrives on the grey, loves thinking on first principles, believes HR can make a significant impact to an organisation and want to be part of this experiment, then we would love to interact with you. People from Management consulting firm only apply. People from SCMHRD, TISS, MDI Gurgaon or XLRI only apply
column11: Process Implementation, HR Policies

column2: As an HR Generalist in our new location, you will be a part of the Global People Ops team.         This team focuses on establishing and supporting processes, being accountable, and having strong ownership with a focus on delivering results.     Our focus is to support our employees in all HR-related matters (and often beyond), to help build a best-in-class environment and culture, to onboard new Wrikers, to keep all data and documents in order and up to date, and to support managers and HR business partners along the way.     You can expect a wide variety of tasks, a great team, the opportunity to learn new things every day, and a focus on cutting red tape and getting things done.         ?       How You ll make an impact         Collaborate with regional leaders and HR business partners to build a positive and thriving team environment.     Resolve employee issues and act on complaints in a professional and timely manner.     Assist global department HR Business Partners (HRBPs) with any on-site performance cases, create, track, and execute on Performance Improvement Plans (PIPs).     Coach managers on individual & team performance.     Set up local benefits.     Consult on local labor legislation.     Support of the recruitment cycle including background checks, pre-onboarding, and onboarding activities.     Conduct new hire orientation and onboarding activities to ensure newcomers have a smooth transition into the organization.     Drive employer branding activities and promote Wrike as the employer of choice in India     Plan and organize company events, including negotiating and communicating with vendors for venues, transportation, workshops, and catering.     Office space projects planning, implementation, and optimization of how we run our workplace and processes.     Manage local purchases and adhere to the budget. including identifying vendors as needed, managing contracts, creating purchase orders, and buying necessary items such as stationery, snacks, and office supplies.     Swag Management: Manage the inventory of company swag. This entails ordering, maintaining an organized stock, and distributing items as need             You will achieve your best if you have:         5+ years experience in HR roles in international companies.     Experience handling office operations and organizing company events.     Strong communication skills and proven experience in employee-related problem-solving cases.     Good understanding of the Indian Labor Law system.     A collaborative, solution-focused approach with strong relationship-building skills.     Self-motivated to deliver best-in-class customer experience, fast learner.     High level of responsibility, accuracy, and ownership.     Understanding of the best market practices     Computer literate, Mac user preferred.     Excellent English skills, both written and verbal.           You will stand out with:         Experience working as an independent HR representative.     Experience in the IT industry.

column2: As the Business Operations Manager, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of various business units. You will support a broad range of operational activities and initiatives, working closely with different teams to drive success and improve processes. The ideal candidate is proactive, with a can-do attitude, ready to take on diverse tasks and challenges with enthusiasm.  Key Responsibilities:   Operational Efficiency Enhancements: Identify and implement process improvements to enhance operational efficiency across business units, monitor and optimize workflows to ensure seamless operations.  Human Resources: Oversee talent acquisition efforts, including recruiting, interviewing, and onboarding new employees, enhance employee experience by addressing concerns, facilitating training, and promoting a positive workplace culture.  Finance: Manage contract negotiations and ensure compliance with financial policies,  support budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning activities.  Logistics and Office Maintenance: Coordinate logistics, including supply chain management and inventory control, oversee office maintenance to ensure a safe and productive work environment.  Client Project Support: Assist the team in executing client projects, ensuring timely and quality delivery, acting as a point of contact for clients, providing updates and addressing any issues.  Stakeholder Communication: Communicate clearly and effectively with stakeholders, including team members, clients, and vendors, provide regular updates, insights, and feedback to the central team to inform decision-making.  Key Requirements :  Strong leadership abilities with a talent for motivating and guiding teams, excellent interpersonal skills to build and maintain positive relationships with stakeholders.  Clear and effective communicator, capable of conveying information to various audiences, can present updates and insights professionally.  A proactive person with a can-do attitude and eager to take on new tasks and challenges with enthusiasm.  Proven experience in a business operations role or similar capacity, familiarity with HR processes, financial management, logistics, and office administration.  Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to address operational challenges with ability to implement effective solutions to improve business processes.

column2: Position Title: Manager - Human Resources Location : Bangalore Number of positions : 1 Fluency in spoken Kannada is a must  Travel Requirements:  Occasional travel may be required  Roles & Responsibilities: 1) Recruitment & Exits: - Work closely with senior management & Department Heads to ensure recruitment processes, policies and compensation & benefits strategies are developed that are in line with the vision of the organization. - Develop position specific Job Descriptions for all recruitment needs. - Develop a high quality and consistent process for hiring new staff. - Develop and administer both inbound and outbound recruitment strategy including shortlisting, interviewing, salary negotiations etc. - Work closely with recruitment agencies, wherever applicable, to ensure smooth and timely recruitment. - Preparation of employee, freelance & consultant contracts for sign off. - Provide induction to new employees on HR policies and coordinate the on-boarding training process for all new recruits. 2) Employee HR management functions & compliances - Own the HRMIS systems of the organization and effectively administer various functions like the attendance, leave, payroll, benefits,  - Ensure 100% compliance with al statutory requirements and labour laws, PF/ESIC etc. - Manage the employees working in Accounting and administrative functions in the organization. - Oversee all HR generalist requirements and pitch in wherever required. - Develop and administer an effective performance appraisal management system including developing and updating salary management structures, salary bands as per prevailing industry norms. - Work closely with department heads to develop comprehensive KPIs / KRAs for all positions in the organization - Help the Department Heads monitor and supervise team's performance against set KPIs. - Management and support of any issues that arise both for employee and manager, ensuring that any performance issues are dealt with effectively. 3) Training & Development - Get detailed understanding of training requirements from stakeholders and develop/modify content accordingly. - Design and deliver training programs that address training needs on an ongoing basis. - Assess training effectiveness based on identified parameters for training programs got conducted.  - Ensure all training and developmental activities are strategically linked to organization's mission and vision  4) Ethics & Standards - Work proactively to develop a culture of highest standards of ethics and morals in the organization - The candidate should have the ability to deal with difficult HR problems with both internal and external stakeholders without compromising on the ethical values of the organization. 5) Other items: - Develop and maintain a comprehensive employee handbook that covers all the HR policies of the organization. - Maintain vacation and leave records for both office and field staff. - Assist various departments in developing a strong network of partner organizations to further the vision of the organization - Create collaboration opportunities within the government and NGO space that will support both the program implementation and fundraising. - Work with the accounting to ensure effective administration of payroll process. - Develop effective employee engagement initiatives. Skills Required: - Fluency in spoken Kannada is a must as the candidate will have to recruit and manage employees in remote rural areas in Karnataka. - Candidate must be willing to travel as required to all the program areas. Candidates can expect up to 25% travel requirement in the job. - The candidate should have proven experience of handling various HR functions in a growing and dynamic work environment. - Exemplary communication skills both verbally and in writing. - Strong ethics and problem-solving attitude.  - Work experience in non-profit sector with knowledge of the HR Laws and best practices in the non-profit sector in India will be a huge plus.   If you are interested, pls share your resume at  thanuja@delighthr.com  with below details: Current CTC Expected CTC Location Notice Period

column2: Job Summary: The Senior Executive HR at Jesus Calls is responsible for designing, implementing, and managing comprehensive training programs and performance appraisal systems. This role ensures that all employees are equipped with the necessary skills and knowledge to perform their roles effectively and that their performance is evaluated fairly and constructively, contributing to their professional growth and the organizations mission. Key Responsibilities: Training and Development: Develop and implement training programs that address the skill and knowledge needs of employees at all levels. Conduct training needs assessments to identify gaps and areas for development. Design and deliver training sessions, workshops, and seminars on various topics, including job-specific skills, soft skills, leadership, and compliance. Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs through feedback, assessments, and performance metrics, making adjustments as necessary. Maintain updated records of training activities and employee progress. Collaborate with department heads to ensure training programs align with organizational goals and department-specific needs. Source and manage external training providers when necessary. Performance Appraisal: Design and manage the performance appraisal system to ensure fair and consistent evaluation of employee performance. Develop performance metrics and evaluation criteria in collaboration with department heads. Train managers and supervisors on conducting effective performance reviews and providing constructive feedback. Oversee the appraisal process, ensuring timelines are met and documentation is accurate. Analyze appraisal data to identify trends and areas for improvement, providing reports to senior management. Address employee concerns and questions regarding performance evaluations and appraisals. Employee Development: Create individual development plans (IDPs) for employees based on appraisal outcomes and career aspirations. Monitor progress of IDPs and provide ongoing support and resources to employees. Facilitate career development and succession planning initiatives. HR Administration: Maintain comprehensive and accurate records of training and appraisal activities. Ensure compliance with all relevant laws and regulations related to training and performance management. Assist in other HR functions as needed, including recruitment, onboarding, and employee relations. Organizational Development: Work with senior management to identify and address organizational development needs. Support change management initiatives and foster a culture of continuous improvement.
column11: Performance Management System, Induction Training, Training And Development, Performance Appraisal, Training Coordination, Succession Planning, PMS, Skill Gap Analysis, Training Management, Organizational Development
