column2: THE BLIND RELIEF ASSOCIATION, DELHI (Non-Governmental Organization)     Job Role : HR Executive    Position Overview : We are seeking a competent and motived HR Executive to join our team at The Blind Relief Association, Delhi. As an HR Executive, you will play a crucial role in supporting our mission to make a positive impact on the lives of those we serve. You will be responsible for various aspects of human resources management, ensuring that the Association attracts, retains, and develops a talented and committed workforce.   Key Responsibilities :   Recruitment and Talent Acquisition :  Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including job postings, screening, interviewing, and candidate selection. Collaborate with department heads to understand their hiring needs and develop effective recruitment strategies. Conduct orientation and onboarding sessions for new employees, ensuring a smooth assimilation into the organization.   Employee Engagement and Relations: Promote a positive work culture and employee satisfaction by organizing engagement activities and events. Address employee queries, concerns, and conflicts in a timely and empathetic manner. Implement and administer policies, ensuring compliance with labor laws and NGO regulations.   Performance Management: Support the implementation of performance appraisal processes, providing guidance to managers and employees. Assist in identifying training and development needs for individuals and teams. Monitor and track performance reviews, promotions, and career growth opportunities.   HR Operations : Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, ensuring confidentiality and security. Handle HR-related documentation, including contracts, letters, and employee databases. Collaborate with finance and administration teams to ensure timely and accurate payroll processing.   Training and Development : Identify training needs and coordinate the design and delivery of training programs for staff development. Organize workshops, seminars, and learning sessions to enhance employee skills and knowledge.   Compliance and Policy Adherence : Ensure compliance with local labor laws, regulations, and NGO-specific guidelines. Develop and update HR policies and procedures, communicating changes to the organization.   Age, Qualification and other Requirements : (Age and qualification to be taken with reference to 31 January 2024) The maximum age limit is 35 years;  Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Additional HR certifications are a plus. At least 3 years experience as an HR Executive or in a similar HR role, preferably in the NGO or non-profit sector. Knowledge of HR best practices, labor laws, and regulations. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams. Strong organizational and problem-solving abilities. Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information. Proficiency in HR software, databases, and Microsoft Office Suite. Passion for the NGO's mission and commitment to social impact.   Work Environment : You will be part of a dedicated and mission-driven team working together to make a positive difference in society. The Blind Relief Association offers a supportive and inclusive work environment, with opportunities for professional growth and development.   Remuneration : Annual CTC will be Rs. 5.00 lakh approximately however this will not be a limiting factor for outstanding candidates.   How to Apply : To apply for this position, please submit your updated resume, a cover letter detailing your relevant experience, and a brief statement explaining your interest in working with the Blind Relief Association, Delhi. Applications can be sent via email to  careers@blindrelief.org.

column2: The Training Manager's role is to support the overall Training strategy in line with company's business strategy and help the business grow through it employees and learning & development initiatives. Furthermore, the role is to develop and enhance the skill of the operation team. Complete ownership of the learning cycle from identifying needs to measuring impact of learning. Partner with the business managers to enhance the technical, professional & leadership skills of the respective team. Collaborate with operation team to design and develop program content as required.   Developing Training    Strategy (30%) 1. Produce organization's training strategy and plans to meet training and development needs and manage training delivery, measurement and follow-up as necessary.   2. Responsible for the conducting the need analysis for skills gaps at all levels of the operation team and development and delivery of suitable training interventions.   3. Establishing training roadmap and identifying programmes for people development for meeting business need for diverse work groups (leadership and operational team).     Training Operations (50%)   1. Assess relevant training needs for operation team including assessment methods and measurement systems at required frequency.   2. Design training courses and programs necessary to meet training needs.   3. Plan, roll out nominations, deliver training courses and assess effectiveness. Manage these activities internally or via external providers.   4. Identify, select and manage external training partners and accreditation bodies & agencies for TNI, content development, delivery and other specific requirement (certification/ HIPO development).   5. Introduce cutting edge and ragogy practices and use of multimedia applications in training.   6. Stay informed as to relevant skill and qualifications levels required by staff for effective performance and circulate requirements and relevant information to the organization as appropriate.   7. Liaise with product team, HR and other functions within organization.   8. Manage the trainer certification program and assessment of trainers through (TQS).   9. Custodian of training policy and ensure its proper implementation.   10. Create and manage a repository of all the training content include inductions (PROP/IND), refreshers (RTPs), capacity building (CBT) and other communication capsules send to the field via WCH, MORM etc MIS and reporting (20%) 1. Monitor and report on activities, costs, performance, etc, as required.   2. Review program feedback and determine opportunities for improvements.   3. Create learning reports & publish reports at the end of program delivery.   4. Capturing training mandates.

column2: Job Description:?   The role of the Senior Recruiter is to develop and enhance MAQ Software's visibility in the IT Services industry space; and position it as the preferred company for top performers to join. Maintain intense connections with top tier MBA and Engineering colleges to hire great talent from these institutes. The recruiter is the ambassador/owner for the group of target universities for MAQ Software. S/he will maintain our presence at these institutions and will be in constant contact with internal teams to determine recruiting programs based on the company's hiring needs. The Senior Recruiter will manage all stakeholders (i.e., staffing partners, university and campus representatives, training and placement officers of top tier institutes, business leaders, alumni teams and other internal groups). S/he will ensure successful implementation of all recruitment programs to maximize hiring outcomes. Your key result areas as percentage of your overall work items will be:?  Talent Acquisition (~70%)   Partner with senior leadership and recruiting to develop workforce plans and staffing models that support business objectives and advance the business and functions (talent acquisition, onboarding, development, talent movement)?  Create detailed plans with clearly defined objectives, desired outcomes, and calendar of events.  Lateral Recruitment   Build a pipeline of quality talent for a diverse group of functions like technology, managerial roles and other support function roles for current and future openings?  Improve sourcing and shortlisting by collaborating with the hiring managers and specific engineering teams to update the technical requirements and functional requirements of the various open positions.  Innovate sourcing and create multiple channels to create consistence inflow of quality applicants.  Raise the quality bar and inculcate the practice of hiring Great People rather than Good People. One great person is better than three good people.  Reduce the cost of hiring by using the internal resources for all aspects of recruitment.   Define TAT on each position, take ownership and aggressively follow up to the closure of the position?  Deliver regular reporting on pipeline, forecast and other metrics.  Campus Recruitment   For campus recruitment, manage university specific campus teams to ensure appropriate selection of team members; clear role definitions/responsibilities; Coach and prepare the campus team members for campus visits; coordinate closely to ensure unified recruiting approach.?  Collaborate with the Campus sponsors and cross-functional campus managers to develop university recruiting strategies at targeted universities  Develop operational plans and branding activities at assigned schools along with the campus leads, to attract top early career talent.?  Develop relationships with placement officers, department heads, faculty/staff, alumni, and student organizations.  Develop, implement and execute on-campus events that include: Info Session, tech talks, executive visits, and faculty visits, on-campus interviews, events with student organizations.  Develop, communicate, and implement university relations workshops, training, recruiter toolkits, and interview guides to ensure that campus recruiters, presenters, target school teams have the necessary information and skills needed to be effective.  HR Operations (~20%)   Build a high-performance work culture& rewarding work environment leveraging a diverse talent pool.?  Provide input on the HR implications of strategic and operational decisions/plans  Partner with the business on organizational design, workforce planning, succession planning, and skills assessment?  Conceptualize & deploy industry best practices (process excellence, technology, products/services) that have tangible long-term benefit to the organization.?  Provide local support for key employee life cycle processes such as onboarding, transfer, benefits enrollment/withdraw and exit procedures.  Employee Welfare/ Engagement (~5%)?   Partners with leadership to identify measures necessary to foster productive and positive work environments that retain and engage employees.?  Creates strategic plans to address workplace environment and retention issues within business.?  Drives consistency in performance management and compensation alignment with market competitiveness.  Data Analysis and Reporting (~5%)   Drive informed decision making by using data to identify trends; work with management to determine root cause of issues; develop organizational effectiveness solutions.   Identify trends, build strategies and practices that ensure adoption of core values across business.   Candidate Profile:    Bachelors and/or Masters degree in Computer Science/Engineering from a leading university  MBA from one of the leading management institutes (IIMs or equivalent)?  An ability to continuously see around the corners to anticipate the talent needs and have strategies in place to meet the needs of a fast-growing, dynamic business.   Experience and passion for working with innovative and fast-paced teams in a dynamic, high velocity environment.   Shows bias for action, and demonstrated ability to deliver results  Hands-on leader with the ability to identify issues and root cause; willingness to dive deep into details.  Strong business acumen and ability to work well across different functions in order to integrate recruitment and business strategies?  Excellent written and verbal communication; high-quality document preparation and presentation skills.  Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and to navigate leaders through a variety of organizational changes.   Ability to work independently, as well as an active member of both business and HR teams.  Proficient in Microsoft Office Experience: 4-5 years of experience in Talent Acquisition role including performance management, change management and employee relations

column2: Job Synapsis:-  Are you a passionate newbie who is willing to thrive in the field of Human Resources? Are you an avid learner who just wants to excel in the role as an HR? We believe you are the right choice of talent we are looking for. SmartDocs is seeking for an HR Executive with full time job opportunity to join the SmartDocs innovative team.  We are a global innovator in artificial intelligence (AI) - based Enterprise Chat Bots, Business Process Management (BPM), and Enterprise Content Management (ECM) software solutions. In order to be successful in this role, you must be willing to perform the end-to-end HR Core activities of the Organization as stated below.  Core Competency:    Any degree or relevant degree, but one must have the passion to become an HR.   Fresher - 1 year of experience as an HR Executive.   One who is willing to successfully perform end-end HR Core activities are only eligible to apply.   Good at research and development skills as well as outstanding presentation skills are Mandatory.   Must come up with new innovative ideas which enhances the HR process & functionality in the firm.  Personality Traits   Positive, go-getter attitude.   Ethical and independent contributor as well as a team player.   Quick & self-learner.   Good Analytical & Problem-solving skills  Duties & Responsibilities:  CORE Activities:    Responsible for end to end On-boarding & Exit-interview process.   Conducting employee orientation and facilitating new buddies joining formalities including induction, documentation, orientation & other HR activities.   Must be able to draft and revise the company policies that are required from time to time.   Communicating and keeping every employee updated with the HR policies.   Organize and preserve the employee documents both physical as well as digital records.   Must ensure recording, maintaining and monitoring of attendance & leave management to ensure employee punctuality.  Grievance Handling:    Address the queries and issues raised by employees.   Resolving employee grievances and escalating to the right level depending on the nature of grievance.  Employee Relations:   Well-versed with employee engagement activities.   Must build good rapport with all the employees fostering cross-functional relationships ensuring their well-being.   Engaging with employees consistently to understand the motivation levels of people across the organization.

column2: Role & responsibilities   Experience in HR Management : Candidates should have several years of experience in HR management, preferably in the construction industry or a related field. They should be well-versed in HR best practices, policies, and procedures. Construction Industry Knowledge : Familiarity with the construction industry is essential. Understanding the unique challenges, regulations, and labor requirements of construction projects will enable the HR Manager to effectively support the workforce and navigate industry-specific issues. Labor Relations and Compliance : Knowledge of labor laws, regulations, and compliance requirements is vital. The HR Manager should be adept at managing labor relations, handling grievances, and ensuring that the construction site operates in accordance with all relevant laws and regulations. Safety and Risk Management : Given the inherent risks associated with construction work, the HR Manager should prioritize safety and risk management. They should be familiar with safety protocols, accident prevention strategies, and workers' compensation procedures to promote a safe working environment. Conflict Resolution and Mediation : Strong interpersonal skills are essential for resolving conflicts and mediating disputes among employees. The HR Manager should be able to address issues proactively, foster positive relationships, and promote a collaborative work culture.   Employment Law:  Working experience in statutory compliance i.e. PF/PT/LBF/ESI/WC Policy/Labor license/excel etc. Compliance, handling Overall Site and updating the same with HO. Periodic / Annual return filling this includes but not limited to Bonus, minimum wages, medical management, policy renewable, claim settlement, ESI claim, display notice etc. Communication and Negotiation Skills : Effective communication skills are critical for interacting with employees, management, and external stakeholders. The HR Manager should be able to communicate policies, procedures, and expectations clearly and negotiate effectively on behalf of the workforce. Problem-Solving Abilities : Construction projects often encounter unexpected challenges and issues. The HR Manager should be a proactive problem-solver, capable of identifying issues early, developing solutions, and implementing corrective actions to keep the project on track. Organizational and Administrative Skills : Strong organizational and administrative skills are necessary for managing HR functions such as payroll, benefits administration, record-keeping, and employee documentation. Adaptability and Resilience : The construction industry can be fast-paced and dynamic, with changing priorities and deadlines. The HR Manager should be adaptable and resilient, able to thrive in a demanding environment and effectively manage competing priorities. Preferred candidate profile   Candidate must have 10 to 15 years of experience in handling site HR activities at site level. He should have handled a team and should be excellent with communication skills and leadership skills. The job location will be Goa.
column11: Labour Laws, Industrial Relations, Statutory Compliance, Attendance Management, Salary Processing, HR Generalist Activities, Administration, PF, Employee Relations, Exit Formalities, Employee Grievances

column2: Job Title : Senior HR Manager (India) Location:  Silvassa Plant and Mumbai Corporate Office Overview:  As the Senior HR Manager for our Silvassa plant and Mumbai corporate office, you will play a key role in driving HR initiatives that support our organizational objectives. Reporting directly to the Managing Director and collaborating closely with the Chief Talent & Culture Officer, you will lead strategic HR planning and implementation to ensure alignment with business goals while maintaining a compliant and supportive workplace environment. Key Responsibilities: Strategic HR Leadership:  Partner with senior management to develop and execute      HR strategies that enhance organizational effectiveness. Drive initiatives      in recruitment, training, employee relations, and compliance, focusing on      continuous improvement and employee engagement. Policy Development and Compliance:  Lead the development and implementation of HR policies      and procedures, ensuring alignment with local regulations and corporate      standards. Maintain relationships with government agencies and ensure      adherence to labor laws and regulatory requirements. Talent Management:       Oversee the full talent lifecycle including acquisition, onboarding,      development, performance management, and retention strategies. Utilize HR      metrics and analytics to assess effectiveness and drive improvements in      talent management practices. Employee Relations and Engagement:  Promote positive employee relations through effective      communication, conflict resolution, and fostering a respectful work      culture. Implement initiatives to enhance employee engagement,      satisfaction, and well-being. Training and Development:  Identify training needs, develop training programs,      and facilitate learning opportunities to enhance employee skills and      capabilities. Support career development and succession planning efforts. Administration and Reporting:  Manage HR administration processes including payroll,      benefits administration, records management, and HRIS systems. Prepare      reports and presentations on HR metrics, initiatives, and compliance      matters for senior management review. Required Skills and Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business      Administration, or related field required; Masters degree preferred. 10-12 years of progressive HR experience in a      manufacturing environment, demonstrating strong knowledge of HR processes      and regulations. Excellent interpersonal, communication, and      presentation skills. Proficiency in HRIS tools, Microsoft Office Suite, and      strong analytical skills. Experience in change management, talent management, and      employee relations. Ability to collaborate effectively with      cross-functional teams and influence at all levels of the organization.

column2: CanKidsKidsCan is looking for Social Worker to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     As a Social Worker, you will be responsible for providing support, assistance, and advocacy to individuals and communities facing various challenges     Your primary goal will be to improve the well-being and quality of life for your clients by connecting them with resources, providing counseling, and addressing social issues that impact their lives     Social workers may work in various settings, including healthcare facilities, schools, government agencies, non-profit organizations, and community centers     Responsibilities:Client Assessment: Conduct comprehensive assessments of clients' needs, including physical, emotional, social, and environmental factors     Counseling and Support: Provide emotional support, counseling, and guidance to individuals, families, or groups facing challenges such as mental health issues, substance abuse, poverty, domestic violence, or child welfare concerns     Case Management: Develop and implement personalized care plans for clients, coordinating services and resources to meet their specific needs     Advocacy: Advocate for the rights and well-being of clients, ensuring they have access to essential services and resources     Crisis Intervention: Intervene during crises or emergencies to provide immediate assistance and support     Referrals: Identify and refer clients to appropriate community resources, including medical services, housing assistance, job training programs, and support groups     Documentation: Maintain accurate and detailed case notes, reports, and records of client interactions and progress

column2: Role & responsibilities     Ensure regulatory compliance : Monitor and interpret global labor laws and regulations to ensure company compliance. Develop, implement, and update HR procedures to align with international standards. Conduct regular audits to identify and mitigate compliance risks. Participate in policy development : Collaborate with HR and legal teams to create and enforce global HR policies. Ensure all HR practices, including recruitment, onboarding, employee relations, and termination, comply with labor laws, and internal standards. Provide training and guidance to HR staff and management on compliance-related matters. Manage risk:  Identify and assess compliance risks within HR operations and develop strategies to mitigate them. Maintain a compliance risk register and ensure timely resolution of identified issues. Lead investigations into any alleged compliance violations, ensuring documentation and appropriate corrective actions. Oversee employee relations:  Advise on complex employee relations issues to ensure fair and legally compliant resolutions. Support the HR team in managing disciplinary actions, grievances, and disputes following company policies and legal requirements. Report and document:  Prepare and submit compliance reports to senior management and regulatory authorities. Maintain comprehensive records of compliance activities and audit findings. Compliance training:  Develop and deliver compliance training programs for HR staff and management. Keep the organization informed of new or changing regulations through regular updates and training sessions.  To ensure appropriate safeguards are in place to protect employee privacy and prevent data breaches.  Responsible for ensuring compliance with laws related to minimum wage, overtime, record-keeping of hours worked, and the classification of employees as exempt or non-exempt.  Collaborating with the legal department to communicate the associated requirements with every applicable HR-based regulatory and legal and compliance training programs. Getting updates on every employee-based regulatory and legislative changes and/or modifications and ensuring that developments in rules and policies are restructured with HR practices, articles, policies, and systems. Responsible for the preparation and delivery of compliance-based communications and training to employees. Conduct employee-related investigations as directed by the stakeholders. Handling sensitive employee data or reports in a discreet manner.

column1: Manager/Senior Manager (HR & Business Ops) with Seventh Contact, Pune!
column2: Role & Designation   Manager/Senior Manager  HR and Business Operations Nature of Job   Full Time Permanent Work Location  ??Remote with occasional visits to office (once in 3 months for important meetings, get together or trainings) Work Timing  ??9.30 AM to 6.00 PM Work Days  - 5 Days working (Saturday and Sunday Off) Ideal Candidate : Professionals who may have taken a long career break due to personal reasons and are looking for opportunities to re-start their career will be preferred. Prior to taking the career break the person should have had at least 8 years of experience in managing overall HR functions for a small to mid-sized software services company. With this background we are expecting the person to have a good functional understanding of recruitment function, adept in people and performance management also have adequate business acumen.  Job Description ??This role will be accountable for meeting the recruitment business goals and keeping the efforts on track with the larger purpose of the organization. The role will have P&L accountability. Working towards the goal this person with manage the Delivery Team, In house HR team and the Sales and Marketing team. Close engagement with the existing clients while serving their ongoing requirements as well getting repeat business from these clients, onboarding new clients and setting up a long-term work relationship. Supervising the recruitment delivery team with any recruitment related challenges related to clients, candidates, understanding of requirements & sourcing strategies. Planning and managing the requirement servicing process for our clients to ensure high quality and timely fulfilment of the client?? requirements. Managing the performance of the recruitment team. Overall planning and executing towards goal achievement consistently. Hiring talent recruitment team for growth of the organization, training them and developing them in to world class recruiting professionals. Work closely with the sales and marketing lead to acquire new clients and requirements as per the growth plan. Presenting Seventh Contact Hiring Solutions services to new inquires and on-board new clients. Job Specification ?? The candidate must at least 8 years of experience in overall HR function with very strong track record in recruiting function in the fast-paced IT company. Should be very good in stakeholder management and team management. Should have a great business acumen (entrepreneurial capabilities). Should enjoy at the helm of things and feels empowered while working in the line function. Ability to think both strategic and tactical is required to work towards the larger purpose at the same time meet the short-term goals efficiently and effectively. The candidate must have an excellent academic background. The candidate must have excellent written and spoken communication skills in English. The candidate must be purpose driven and service oriented by nature. The candidate must have a good leadership skill, confidence and inner drive to remain progressive, they must have a good appetite to learn and explore new things. This is a remote working (with need based visit to office not more than once or twice in a month).Hence, the applicant must have proper work from home (WFH) infrastructure for seamless working. Selection Process  ??1st Video Round  ??To evaluate analytical skills, general awareness, communication skills. 2nd Video Round  - To evaluate your interest, learnability, and commitment. Final Round (In-Person)  ??Cultural fitment, addressing queries. In case the above requirement aligns with your job preferences and if your background satisfies most of the candidate criteria then please rush in your resume to rajiv@seventh-contact.com We will review your application and in case your profile is found suitable then we will call you to initiate the selection process.

column2: The Training Manager's role is to support the overall Training strategy in line with company's business strategy and help the business grow through it employees and learning & development initiatives. Furthermore, the role is to develop and enhance the skill of the operation team. Complete ownership of the learning cycle from identifying needs to measuring impact of learning. Partner with the business managers to enhance the technical, professional & leadership skills of the respective team. Collaborate with operation team to design and develop program content as required.   Developing Training    Strategy (30%) 1. Produce organization's training strategy and plans to meet training and development needs and manage training delivery, measurement and follow-up as necessary.   2. Responsible for the conducting the need analysis for skills gaps at all levels of the operation team and development and delivery of suitable training interventions.   3. Establishing training roadmap and identifying programmes for people development for meeting business need for diverse work groups (leadership and operational team).   Training Operations (50%) 1. Assess relevant training needs for operation team including assessment methods and measurement systems at required frequency.   2. Design training courses and programs necessary to meet training needs.   3. Plan, roll out nominations, deliver training courses and assess effectiveness. Manage these activities internally or via external providers.   4. Identify, select and manage external training partners and accreditation bodies & agencies for TNI, content development, delivery and other specific requirement (certification/ HIPO development).   5. Introduce cutting edge and ragogy practices and use of multimedia applications in training.   6. Stay informed as to relevant skill and qualifications levels required by staff for effective performance and circulate requirements and relevant information to the organization as appropriate.   7. Liaise with product team, HR and other functions within organization.   8. Manage the trainer certification program and assessment of trainers through (TQS).   9. Custodian of training policy and ensure its proper implementation.   10. Create and manage a repository of all the training content include inductions (PROP/IND), refreshers (RTPs), capacity building (CBT) and other communication capsules send to the field via WCH, MORM etc MIS and reporting (20%) 1. Monitor and report on activities, costs, performance, etc, as required.   2. Review program feedback and determine opportunities for improvements.   3. Create learning reports & publish reports at the end of program delivery.   4. Capturing training mandates.
column11: Trainer, Process Training, Induction Training, Soft Skills Training, Behavioral Training, Corporate Training, Sales Training, Product Training

column2: Role & responsibilities     Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy. Manage the recruitment and selection process, including sourcing candidates, conducting interviews, and facilitating the hiring decision. Oversee employee onboarding and orientation programs to ensure a smooth transition for new hires. Develop and implement performance management systems to drive employee productivity and engagement. Provide guidance and support to managers and employees on HR-related matters, including employee relations, conflict resolution, and disciplinary actions. Manage and resolve complex employee relations issues, including conducting investigations and recommending appropriate action. Ensure compliance with all relevant employment laws and regulations. Develop and implement training and development programs to enhance employee skills and capabilities. Manage the compensation and benefits programs, including salary administration, payroll processing, and benefits administration. Maintain HR records and prepare reports for management as needed. Should have knowledge of payroll & statutory compliance. Admin Activities Managed a team of at least two people.  Qualification   1. Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Masters      degree preferred. 2. At least 6 years of experience in human resources management, with demonstrated      proficiency in all areas of HR. 3. Strong knowledge of employment laws and regulations. 4. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with      employees at all levels of the organization. 5. Proven leadership and management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire a team. 6. Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills, with the ability to handle complex and      sensitive issues with tact and discretion. 7. Highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and      deadlines. 8. Proficiency in HRIS and other HR-related software applications. Additional Information 1. This is a full-time position based at our Noida office 2. Competitive salary and benefits package offered. 3. The successful candidate will report directly to the Head HR.

column2: Job Description   Key   Responsibilities Manpower hiring   In coordination with the business assess the manpower requirement prepare MPP and submit the Head HR to get the approval. work closely with TA team for all new hiring, replacement positions and ensure vacancies are filled within the TAT. Documentations   Ensure the verification of all the documents and DMS filing for all the new joiners, initiate the due diligence checks for all the employees on joining and annually, keep updating the DMS files.  Onboarding & Induction   Coordinate with TA team, assist and administer the smooth onboarding and buddy programmes. Prepare a robust induction plan, share JD, KRA/KPI set clear expectation at the time of joining. Prepare OJT plan, conduct 30/60/90 & 180 days reviews and create employee experience. Employee relations   address the employee grievances within TAT, Assist in handling employee relations issues asper company policies & Guidelines.  L&D activities   in coordination with the business identify the training needs, prepare L&D plan & training calendar, in coordination with corporate L&D team conduct the training, assess the effectiveness and document. Responsible for mandatory trainings - Security Awareness, ISMS, Health & Safety POSH at unit level and ensure minimum PTD is met. Contract labour Management   indenting the contract manpower requirement, hiring,        processing their attendance, invoice verification and compliance. HR MIS   prepare HR MIS regarding manpower cost, L&D activities, attrition,        productivity, employee engagement and retention plans etc and share it by 7th of every month. Compliance Management   responsible for contract labour compliance, renewal of        licences, filing of returns other legal compliances. Audit management   study and understand the major audit standards ??ISO, NPCI-Rupay        VISA & Master card. Align process, procedures, and systems as per audit standards. Employee engagement Activities  ??prepare annual employee engagement plans and        conduct engagement activities like Team out bound, skip level meeting, one on one meeting, town hall meeting etc. Performance appraisal & Capability Enhancement (PACE) - Finalise the KRA/KPI for all the roles, Support the corporate team in robust execution of performance appraisal, ensure 100% completion of performance assessment as per TAT. Take the input from the PACE, arrange for potential assessment, and identify HiPo??. Ensure succession planning and prepare Career Tree. Understand the business objectives, Set objectives for HRD department in line with        business objectives, Review the set objective periodically and and achieve the same. 12.  Team Coordination  ??Build and maintain good relationship with internal as well as external stakeholders.  13.  Safety and security Standards  ??ensure 100% implementation of safety and security        norms in the factory premises Participate customer/Social/Certification audits to gather feedback on HR programs,        processes, and interactions, identifying areas for improvement and opportunities to better meet Business needs. Implement background verification programs and processes tailored to meet the unique needs and expectations of our customer segment, ensuring alignment with legal and regulatory standards.

column2: Position:  HR Strategy & Data Governance Job Summary:  We are in search of an individual with HR strategic and transformational mindset to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for executing strategies for HR Digital Transformation, Data Governance framework and audits, and act as PMO for the Future ready HR initiatives, that align with our organizational goals and contribute to overall business success that foster employee engagement, drive talent development, and optimize organizational effectiveness. Reporting To:  HR Data Analytics & Data Governance Leader Responsibilities: Support Digital Transformation & prepare HR functions for the future ready initiatives by enabling the strategies for Employee Self Service, Manager Self Service, HR Self Service solutions. Collaborate with HR leadership to understand business objectives and translate them into HR strategies that support organizational goals with a solid project plan. Develop, implement, and oversee HR strategic initiatives, ensuring alignment with the company's mission, vision, and values. Prepare and deliver regular project status reports to senior leadership, highlighting key milestones, risks, and achievements. Identify, assess, and mitigate project risks to ensure successful project outcomes. Support the HR Data Governance leader with specific data governance framework, ensuring alignment with organizational data governance policies and practices. Support on establishing data governance principles, standards, and procedures for HR data management. Conduct regular audits to assess compliance with data governance policies and identify areas of improvement. Support on establishing data stewardship practices, define and assign data ownership responsibilities within HR, ensuring accountability for data accuracy and integrity. The ideal candidate to have:  7-10 years of overall experience Bachelors degree in human resources, Business Administration, or a related field; Master's degree preferred. Thorough understanding of Process, Data, Technology and Digitalisation layer. Proven experience in HR or Business strategy, organizational development, or a related role. Exceptional strategic thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels. Demonstrated ability to lead and influence cross-functional teams. Experience with project management and the successful execution of strategic initiatives under Agile methodology  Proven experience in data governance, data management, or a related role, with a focus on HR data. Thorough understanding of data governance principles, data quality management, and data security. Familiarity with relevant data protection regulations and privacy laws.
column11: HR Transformation, HR Strategy, Digital Transformation, Data Governance

column2: The role of the HR Recruiter is to support the chair in ensuring the smooth functioning of Human Resources recruitment   Maintain the smooth running of an office through a variety of HR Recruitment duties     The recruiting, interviewing, and screening responsibilities of HR recruiters can be further broken down by daily job duties, which include:               Duties & Responsibilities              Screening resumes              Performing in-person and phone interviews with candidates              Administering appropriate company assessments              Performing reference and background checks              Making recommendations to company hiring managers              Coordinating interviews with the hiring managers              Following up on the interview process status              Maintaining relationships with both internal and external clients to ensure staffing goals are achieved              Communicating employer information and benefits during screening process              Staying current on the companys organisation structure, personnel policy, and federal and state laws regarding employment practices              Serving as a liaison with area employment agencies, institutes, academies, colleges, and industry associations.              Completing timely reports on employment activity              Conducting exit interviews on terminating employees              Induction, Joining formalities, Replacements              Requirements & Qualifications              Key Skills:              Good knowledge and understanding about staff requirements. column2: Reviews the contractual agreements and the vessels manning plan, performing and monitoring all selection steps, i.e. identification, evaluation and selection of crew, for the effective recruitment of the most suitable and qualified candidates, according to ship flag legislation, technical requirements and available budget.         Reviews and approves the employment contracts of all assigned vessels seafarers issued by the CSCs, to ensure they are according to company s procedures and agreed terms and local/flag legislation.         Proposes and implements the relief/rotation planning and EoC procedures of the ships personnel, focusing on the provision of alternatives for the continuous and effective operation of the vessels.         Timely identifies future and current vacancies in vessels personnel and informs accordingly his/her supervisor, the CSCs, in order to support the accurate and fast coverage of needs. Supports the FP Manager to develop the annual manning plan and budget.         Prepares and implements Crew planning (timeliness reliefs, accuracy of documentation, budget compliance, response to customer requests).         Coordinates with the FP Manager and CSCs regarding the prompt and accurate implementation of changes in ports procedures, such as visas, permissions, etc., concerning the smooth embarkation and disembarkation of crewmembers if management intervention required.         Implements the relief/rotation planning and lay-off procedures according to the contractual agreements and vessels needs for each seafarer, focusing on the provision of alternatives for the continuous and effective operation of the vessels. Liaises with vessels, CSCs/manning agencies, port agents travel agents in order to ensure that crew embarkations/ disembarkations on vessels are carried out in the most efficient and cost effective way.         Communicates with flag state authorities in order to gather information related to the specific regulations each flag state may require. Maintains and regularly updates all required documentation, so as to safeguard the legitimate operation of vessels and employment of seafarers.         Informs the personnel in the assigned vessels of potential changes in the operational procedures, and makes available all the respective documentation to all crew members.         Implements the relief/rotation planning and lay-off procedures according to the contractual agreements and vessels needs, for each seafarer focusing on achieving necessary re-joining rate and the provision of alternatives for the continuous and effective operation of the vessels.         Monitors and evaluates the performance of the assigned vessels seafarers and identifies their training needs, develops and proposes the training plan and cooperates with the company s training centres so as to provide the required training for the improvement of technical skills and competencies of officers and ratings. Follows-up the successful completion of all training courses, in order to enhance the efficiency of the crewmembers for the safe and effective operation of all vessels.         Support the development, submission and implementation of the department s budget, reviews its accurate execution, identifies cost saving opportunities and proposes corrective actions in case of deviations, in order to ensure compliance with set targets.         Support, monitors, follow up, implementation of software, safety management system, employment laws and regulations as assigned and informs FP Manager as needed.         Co-ordinate with CSC / GSC and make sure all manning activities outsourced to CSC / GSC are timely and accurately performed.         Develops effective batching of seafarers allocation to assigned vessels, in order to generate cost effective travelling to all vessel, as well as timely coverage of operational needs. Reviews crew travelling costs to the assigned vessels, and contributes in relative market research, in order to identify the best value-for-money services.         Monitors the accurate execution of crew budget, identifies cost saving opportunities and proposes corrective actions in case of deviations, in order to ensure compliance with set targets.     Skills      Bachelor degree or Certificate in Maritime relevant field       Work Experience       5 years of experience as FPO in maritime recruiting       Job-Specific Skills:       Very good knowledge of the vessels crew requirements and seafarers specifications         Knowledge of the local market dynamics both for demand-supply situation         Exposure in the development of employment contracts         Experience in recruitment, training and development methodologies         Good knowledge of the seafarers rights and the maritime labour law         Knowledge of the maritime legal framework e.g. employers obligations, recruitment prerequisites etc.         Fluency in English         PC literacy

Detail-oriented and organized with excellent time management skills.     Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.     Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).     Enthusiasm for learning and a strong interest in recruitment and HR. column2: The Habitat for Humanity (HFH) India is looking for a talented individual for the role of Human Resources (HR) Senior Manager under the guidance and leadership of the HR Director       The position is responsible for the implementation of Habitat India s HR plan and strategy in making sure that the HR Operations is smoothly functioning as well as its relevance by taking specific steps in the direction of aligning it with the overall HFH India Strategy                Essential Roles and Responsibilities         General HR Support 10%             Partners with the leadership team to understand and execute the organization s human resource and talent strategy particularly as it relates to current and future talent needs, recruiting, retention, and succession planning.         Provides support and guidance as subject matter expert to junior HR staff, management, and other staff when complex, specialized, and sensitive questions and issues arise; may be required to administer and execute routine tasks in delicate circumstances such as providing reasonable accommodations, investigating allegations of wrongdoing, and terminations.         Collaborate and consult with Habitat for Humanity International, Asia-Pacific Area Office s (HFHI APAO) HR Learning and Organizational Development (HRLOD) team, and other technical subject experts (eg legal) on all support needs and processes ensuring alignment, and compliance with legal and/donor requirements.             Recruitment and Hiring 20%             Ensure that position descriptions are created or updated by hiring managers.             Manages the talent acquisition process, which may include recruitment, interviewing, and hiring of qualified job applicants, particularly for managerial, exempt, and professional roles; collaborates with departmental managers to understand skills and competencies required for openings.             Ensuring due diligence is followed and conduct checks on academic qualifications, references, etc on selected candidates.             Talent Management 15%             Ensure that the HFH India job planning and the whole performance management system is established and implemented for all Habitat India staff.             Define a talent management framework to ensure effective nurturing of critical organization skills, and experience staff.             Creates learning and development programs and initiatives that provide internal development opportunities for employees.             Ensure employees have a development plan in place via the annual job plan process. Work closely with the people managers, Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and HFHI Organization Learning teams to determine appropriate training and development interventions, as well as ensure alignment of talent inventory and succession planning.             Compensation and Benefits 25%             Work with hiring managers in ensuring that the position descriptions are developed for new positions and reviewed / revised for ongoing positions as required. Ensure that each role is mapped out accordingly to the job framework and pay structure.             Analyzes trends in compensation and benefits; researches and proposes competitive compensation structure and benefit programs to ensure the organization attracts and retains top talent.             Implement and ensure proper systems of staff payroll for all staff across the country. Provide all payroll documents relevant to staff on an ongoing basis.             Ensure all statutory deductions and payments are made as per the due dates.             Employee Relations 10%             Oversees employee grievance redressal and disciplinary proceedings, and any cessation of employment process.             Maintains compliance with all labor laws and regulations and recommended best practices; reviews policies and practices to maintain compliance.             Handles Prevention of Sexual Harassment (POSH) and compliance to legal requirements.             Employee Engagement 10%             Develop and propose plan of employee engagement.             Conduct exit and stay interviews, focus group discussions, and partner with people managers in ensuring employee engagement of staff             HR Analytics 10%             Develop and maintain HR dashboard. This includes recruitment report, employee turnover, demographics, and other HR analytics.                 Minimum Requirements:               Education:     - Master s degree in HR, MSW, MBA or any other equivalent           Years of related experience:     - At least eight (8) to ten (10) years experience in core HR areas             Qualifications (Knowledge and Competencies):             Working knowledge of HR systems             General knowledge and understanding of India s labor laws             Proficiency in English, both written and spoken             Proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, database, and email software applications             Preferred:             Experience in talent management, and talent acquisition             Experience working in an INGO

column2: Position Summary: Position will have accountability for the organization, execution, planning and administration of  audits within the Voya Financial (Voya) India Office, directing the evaluation of controls, reviewing  compliance with policies, procedures and regulations, and coordinating and directing reporting of  results of audits for the India Office to Voya management. Job Description  Role:  . Key Responsibilities  ??Stakeholder Management - Be the trusted advisor for Business leaders and work with  them to drive people agenda in line with HR strategy for the company and specialised  needs of people in the business unit. Providing direction for the business in all matters  associated with employees and will coach business unit management teams to  enhance individual and team capability in areas of HR operations activity, such as the  annual merit and performance cycles  ??People Plan - You provide insights, recommendations, feedback and ideas on the  development of the people plan, and you manage the implementation of the holistic  plan (e.g., talent management, leadership effectiveness, diversity and inclusion,  culture) for your business line and organisation as required   ??Organizational Diagnostics - You partner and consult with peers and HR COEs on  organizational diagnostics. Diagnose talent management processes/programs, talent  needs and risks; provide recommendations on organizational strategies, goals and  actions; and contribute to implementation plans based on results.  ??Change management - You design and implement change, adapting to new or changing  structures, cultural change, or business-specific programs/processes for an assigned  organization. You evaluate internal business drivers, environmental factors, risks and  benefits to foster change adoption, and collaborate to develop change management  strategies and training materials.  ??Performance Management -Own end to end performance management process for  your business line, train managers and employees on the process and ensure process is  followed as required. . ??Employee Engagement  Connect with employees and managers and drive  engagement though various initiatives.  ??Compensation & Benefits  Work with COEs on this topic to give advisory on annual  Merit and promotion cycle   ??Ensuring a consistent approach to HR activities and compliance with regional and  global policies and legal requirements whilst adhering to local statutory requirements  under employment legislation.  ??Process ownership for Employee Relations management, including disciplinary &  performance improvement & exit management  ??Analyse data and observations across the organization, highlighting trends and  recommending/driving solutions to the leaders and Head HR  Qualifications: Knowledge, Skills and Abilities  ??Business Acumen - The ability to understand the parts of the business and their  interrelationships. This includes skill in understanding the industry, competition, and  expected future developments and challenges, the business's competitive strengths  and weaknesses, opportunities to grow the business and reduce operating costs, and  awareness of the environment for opportunities.  ??Data Driven Thinking - The ability to systematically gather information from a variety of  sources, analyse information, identify implications of data, draw conclusions, generate  alternatives and solutions, and evaluate the consequences of choosing each alternative  using quality metrics and data. This includes the ability to convert general data and  findings into applied, specific information and suggestions that add value to business  planning and strategies.  ??Leadership Effectiveness - The ability to coach leaders; drive leadership development  plans that focus on the strategic investment in human capital within the organization  (e.g., talent identification and management, individual development planning,  management development, 360-degree feedback, succession planning, mentoring and  coaching).  ??Organizational Development - Knowledge and application of organizational  development principles. This includes knowledge of organizational behaviour,  organizational capabilities and change management, and workforce planning and  succession planning procedures.  ??Collaboration - Strong collaborative ability to work across various teams in HR and  influence people outcomes.  ??Ability to be a role model for employees  ??Comfortable to navigate through ambiguity , ability to handle difficult situations and  conflicts Required Qualifications  ??10-12 years of work experience in Human Resources  ??Master's degree in Human Resources, Business or related field  ??8+ years of experience partnering with a wide network of clients and across Human  Resources to deliver effective business solutions  ??Prior Experience in IT industry or Insurance /finance operations or Captive set up would an added advantage. column2: Position Summary: The Global HR Director - India plays a pivotal role in developing and executing the Global HR strategy tailored to support the business unit's growth initiatives. This role partners with business unit leaders to define and build organizational capabilities and effectiveness, and champions organizational health and performance excellence. They collaborate closely with corporate HR to ensure alignment with overall organizational goals and objectives while addressing specific needs of each business unit. The incumbent will be responsible for managing recruitment, training & development, performance management, day-to-day HR operations, and handling employee relations issues. The incumbent will work closely with all levels of management and employees to support and promote the divisions business goals while ensuring compliance with employment laws and regulations.   Role & Responsibilities: Advise and influence business leaders on organizational design, employee engagement & retention, leadership development, performance criteria and measurement, succession planning, and change management in support of achieving ETSs mission and business unit objectives.  Help drive the business units people strategy, organizational design, leadership development and change management to scale for growth.  Provide overall HR support to the business unit, ensuring alignment and consistency where appropriate.  In partnership with Talent Acquisition, develop and implement recruitment strategies to attract top talent; coordinate job postings, review resumes, & conduct interviews; an facilitate the hiring process from job posting to onboarding.  Partner with and provide input to Corporate HR on compensation/benefits and HRIS shared services.  Develop strategies to enhance employer branding and employee value proposition.  Works closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention.  Foster organizational effectiveness through analytics, establishing and tracking metrics, KPIs, and automation that drive business decision support.  Partner with the business unit leadership team and corporate HR to drive cultural shifts and employee engagement needed to achieve key priorities and continuously refine the strategy to improve the employee culture through the right mix of communications and experiences.  Serve as a point of contact for employee inquiries & concerns, mediate conflicts & provide guidance on employee relations issues, and conduct investigations and resolve workplace disputes. Identify and implement opportunities within HR for greater efficiency, effectiveness, agility and standardization that is consistent with the business strategy. Provide training and support to managers on performance management processes and identify areas for improvement and implement performance development plans. Continuously improve the quality of the overall human capital by attracting and promoting the best talent and building strong overall succession pipelines and working collaboratively with leaders to understand staffing requirements and ensure the workforce meets current and future needs. Leverage HR best practices, and when appropriate, adapt to reflect unique business needs and share them with HR colleagues.  Knowledge/Skills Required:  In-depth knowledge of HR practices, labor laws, and regulations in the business units region. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information. Strong organizational and problem-solving skills. A deep understanding of the business to effectively address challenges and facilitate smooth HR processes. Proficiency in HRIS (Human Resources Information Systems) and MS Office suite. Education and Experience:  Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field Master's degree preferred. 6+ years of experience in Human Resources roles, with progressively increasing responsibilities. Previous experience in a global leadership role managing HR functions across multiple geographies. Proven track record and of developing and implementing HR strategies aligned with revenue growth goals in fast-paced and high-performing environments. Professional certifications such as SPHR, SHRM-SCP, or equivalent are a plus.

column1: Hiring HR Business Partner - Antara (Max Group) Gurgaon
column2: About   us: www.antaraseniorcare.com  //  www.ageasybyantara.com Antara Senior Living is the Max Group company focused on providing senior care. The objective of Antara is to create vibrant residential communities that offer Lifestyle with Lifecare. The focus of our communities is on giving residents a healthy, active, and enjoyable life; comprehensive services that enrich our residents' lives and offer easy access to outstanding facilities and exceptional service delivery. Position Overview: Antara  Antara Senior Care is seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Manager, HR Business Partner (HRBP) to join our AGEasy (D2C) division. The Senior Manager HRBP will play a strategic role in partnering with business leaders to drive HR initiatives that support the growth and success of AGEasy by Antara.  Key Responsibilities:   Serve as a strategic HR partner to business leaders within the AGEasy division, providing guidance and support on all HR-related matters. Partner with business leaders to develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives that align with business objectives and drive organizational success. Lead and manage HR programs and processes, including talent acquisition, performance management, employee relations, training and development, and compensation and benefits. Analyze HR data and metrics to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for improvement, and make data-driven recommendations. Drive employee engagement initiatives to create a positive and inclusive work culture that supports employee growth and development. Provide coaching and support to managers and employees on HR policies, procedures, and best practices.  Lead and support organizational change initiatives and drive HR projects that contribute to the overall success of the AGEasy division.  Ensure compliance with labor laws, regulations, and company policies in all HR practices and processes. Qualification & Work experience: Full time MBA in HR from a Premium institute is mandatory  Proven experience as an HR Business Partner or HR Manager, with a strong track record of partnering with business leaders to drive HR strategies and initiatives.  In-depth knowledge of HR best practices, employment laws, and regulations. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret HR data and metrics. ??- Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills. Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels of the organization. ??- Experience in managing and developing HR programs and processes.  HR certifications (e.g., SHRM-SCP, SPHR) are a plus.  To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications for this role at rajkumari@antaraseniorcare.com or WhatsApp on 7053490016. Thank you for considering a career with us.

column2: Were looking for an enthusiastic individual keen to dive into the dynamic world of headhunting for the US market.      Even if youre new to the industry, wed love to hear from you if you possess a go-getter attitude, natural people skills, and a strong drive to succeed.            Responsibilities:        Market Research: Use various tools, databases, and networking platforms to identify potential clients for specialised roles.      Initial Contact: Reach out to potential candidates, understand their current career situations, and gauge their interest in new opportunities.      Relationship Building: Cultivate strong relationships with professionals in the industry to facilitate future engagements and referrals.      Client Collaboration: Work closely with internal teams and external clients to comprehend job specifications and ideal candidate profiles.      Ongoing Learning: Continually update knowledge on industry trends, emerging roles, and recruitment best practices.      Documentation: Maintain meticulous records of interactions, feedback, and details in the database records.              Qualifications:        A bachelors degree is an advantage but not essential.      Exceptional communication and interpersonal abilities.      A proactive mindset, able to anticipate needs and act decisively.      Familiarity with MS Office and knowledge of applicant tracking systems (ATS) is a plus.      Strong organisational skills and a detail-oriented nature.      Ability to adapt to the dynamic nature of the recruitment world.      Must be willing to work according to US time zones              Benefits:        Competitive salary with performance-based bonuses.      Comprehensive training programme.      Health and dental benefits.      Opportunities for professional growth and advancement.      Friendly and collaborative work environment.      Based on performance, you will have the opportunity to work on-site              Desired Attributes:        Were on the hunt for driven individuals with a fervent passion and a readiness to go above and beyond. We value those eager to learn, grow, and contribute significantly to the expansion of ATCs staffing division.      Seeking dynamic go-getters with a proactive mindset.      This isnt your typical 9-to-5 role. We envision you as our future manager and leader within the next five years.

column2: Role & responsibilities     This role is responsible for supporting the Business as an HR Business Partner  by identifying and implementing solutions required to support the business goals and objectives. The role will be based in  Bangalore  and the person will be responsible for ensuring high level of colleague engagement and strong business partnership. In addition, the role will also work with the stakeholders and HR leader/s for the different businesses to implement India wide projects and initiatives. This role will need to provide proactive support to the business in managing the lifecycle of an employee i.e. from onboarding to separation. The role will have significant operating responsibilities in implementing HR policies, processes and initiatives for the aligned business . Preferred candidate profile     Deliver  HR processes for the aligned Business, including but not limited to      policy compliance, staffing/ recruiting, colleague relations, training      & development, performance and pay cycle management. This      will require strong partnering with HR functions.    Advocate,      champion, and communicate HR policies and practices within the framework      of the overall Aon HR philosophy while keeping the India market      practices in mind.   Responsible for employee communication      and change management. Closely      work with HR Leader for location on engagement, performance, and      development needs to deliver HR goals for the business. Partner      with other HR colleagues to leverage resources and programs.  Act      as the point of contact for other HR functions (Talent Acquisition,      HR Connect, HR Shared Services, Total Rewards, and Talent      Development) to ensure timely and quality closure of colleague matters      and escalations pertaining to  Business . Act      as a link between business and colleagues by handling questions,      interpreting and administering solutions and helping resolve work-related      issues Drive      assigned HR projects and initiatives for the aligned business group such      as for enhancing associate retention & engagement, as well as      support the deployment of organization wide programs and policies. Collate      and analyze data to influence business decisions and direction. Publish HR      scorecards and dashboards for the business. Support compensation      cycles, performance cycles by preparing strong analytics. Provide MIS      support for Attrition analysis, includes- analyzing Exit interviews, observe      trends and highlight important aspects, prepare and publish dashboards Ensure      strict adherence to process and timelines for global processes and      projects Build strong relationships in a large organization: Should be      able to build personal credibility and manage the organizational      complexity/matrix structures ) Optimize      systems and processes: The role requires acumen to drive the predictive      maintenance of people issues in conjunction with proactive people      engagement. This refers to sensing issues before they happen and making processes even better. Perks and benefits

column2: Role & responsibilities   Partner with senior leadership to develop and implement effective HR policies and practices that will support the strategic growth of the business. Offer thought leadership regarding organizational and people-related strategy and execution. Provide solutions to all kinds of employees grievances - Salary, reimbursements, mediclaim, darwin box, issues with managers etc. Educate, coach, and partner with managers on performance management and employee development goals. Provide HR expertise in the areas of feedback, employee relations, development and coaching, compensation, and organizational development. Participate in the continual development of HR programs, such as recruiting, retention, compensation, benefits, and Learning & Development. Collaborate with the HR team to champion and accelerate a culture of excellence in which people feel engaged and inspired to deliver top business results. Develop people strategies and design approaches for diagnosing and enhancing organizational effectiveness and employee satisfaction. Educate team members on compensation practices, including compensation, performance feedback, performance calibration, and career transitions. Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough and objective investigations. Identifies training needs for business units and individual executive coaching needs. Visiting all facilities ( all cities/hubs/workshops) & connecting with employees at the ground. Communicate all org level communication with employees. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Post graduate in MBA in HR from a recognized university. Strong verbal & written communication, interpersonal and customer service skills. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to comprehend, interpret, and apply the appropriate sections of applicable laws, guidelines, regulations, ordinances, and policies. Ability to acquire a thorough understanding of the organization's hierarchy, jobs, qualifications, compensation practices, and the administrative practices related to those factors. Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software. Pls Note: The role is 6 days working from office

column2: Job Summary: As an HR Generalist at Neuberg Supratech Science House LLP, you will play a crucial role in managing and overseeing various HR functions to support our growing team. You will work closely with employees and management to ensure a positive work environment, enforce company policies, and drive HR initiatives that align with our organizational goals. The ideal candidate will have more than 3 years of experience in HR, demonstrating expertise in recruitment, employee relations, performance management, and compliance.   Key Responsibilities: Recruitment and Onboarding: Manage the full-cycle recruitment process, including job posting, candidate sourcing, interviewing, and hiring. Coordinate and conduct new employee orientations and onboarding activities. Develop and maintain effective recruitment strategies to attract top talent. Employee Relations: Act as a point of contact for employee concerns and queries, providing guidance and support. Foster a positive work environment through effective conflict resolution and communication. Assist in the development and implementation of employee engagement initiatives. Performance Management: Support the performance review process, including setting performance standards, conducting evaluations, and providing feedback. Work with managers to identify training and development needs and create professional development plans. Policy and Compliance: Ensure compliance with all federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations. Develop, implement, and update HR policies and procedures as needed. Maintain accurate and confidential employee records. Compensation and Benefits: Assist in the administration of compensation and benefits programs. Provide guidance to employees on benefits enrollment and claims. Conduct market research to ensure competitive compensation practices. HR Administration: Manage HR-related documentation and maintain employee databases. Generate HR reports and metrics to support decision-making processes. Participate in HR projects and initiatives aimed at improving HR processes and systems.      Payroll Management: Oversee and manage payroll processing to ensure accurate and timely payment of wages. Handle payroll-related inquiries and resolve any discrepancies. Maintain payroll records and ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations. Collaborate with finance and accounting teams to reconcile payroll accounts. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Minimum of 3 years of experience in an HR Generalist role. Strong knowledge of HR principles, practices, and employment laws. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Proven ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion. Strong organizational and multitasking abilities. Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite.   How to Apply: Interested candidates can share their resume on - - recruiter@shmpl.com - +919303716500 Neuberg Supratech Science House LLP is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Regards,  Rahul Upadhyay.  HR executive - Talent Acquisition.
column11: HR Generalist Activities, Payroll Management, Recruitment Life Cycle, Joining Formalities, HR Operations, Hr Compliance, Performance Appraisal Management, Leave Management, HR Policies, Employee Grievances

column2: Role Description   This is a full-time on-site role for a Human Resource Head at MicroMitti. The Human Resource Head will be responsible for developing and implementing HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the company's overall objectives. They will oversee all aspects of HR operations, including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, and compliance. Key Responsibilities: Strategic HR Planning: Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the company's goals and objectives. Collaborate with senior management to identify HR needs and priorities to support business growth and success. Recruitment and Talent Acquisition: Oversee the recruitment process, including job postings, candidate sourcing, screening, interviewing, and hiring decisions. Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract and retain top talent in the fintech industry. Employee Relations: Serve as a trusted advisor to employees and managers, providing guidance and support on HR-related matters. Handle employee relations issues, conflicts, and grievances, ensuring timely and appropriate resolution. Performance Management: Implement performance management processes, including goal setting, performance reviews, and feedback mechanisms. Provide coaching and support to managers to improve performance and productivity across the organization. Training and Development: Develop and implement training and development programs to enhance employee skills, knowledge, and performance. Identify training needs and opportunities for professional growth and career development. HR Compliance: Ensure compliance with all applicable labor laws, regulations, and internal policies and procedures. Keep abreast of changes in employment laws and regulations and update HR policies and practices as necessary. Qualifications   Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field; Master's degree or HR certification preferred. 10+ years of experience in HR leadership roles, preferably in the fintech or technology industry. Strong understanding of HR best practices, employment laws, and regulations. Excellent leadership and management skills, with the ability to build and motivate high-performing teams. Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to establish rapport and credibility at all levels of the organization. Strategic thinker with the ability to align HR initiatives with business objectives. Join MicroMitti to make a meaningful impact in the real estate investment landscape, revolutionizing how people participate in property investments. We offer a dynamic work environment, competitive compensation package, and opportunities for professional growth and development.
