column2: Job Title:  Human Resource Executive Location:  Graphic Era Institute of Medical Sciences Hospital, Dehradun Job Summary:  We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Human Resource Executive to join our team at Graphic Era Institute of Medical Sciences Hospital. The HR Executive will be responsible for overseeing various HR functions, including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, payroll, compliance with labor laws, and handling employee grievances. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in human resource management, excellent interpersonal skills, and a commitment to fostering a positive work environment. Responsibilities: Recruitment and Onboarding: Oversee the recruitment process, including job postings, candidate screening, interviewing, and selection. Manage the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring a smooth integration into the organization. Develop and maintain relationships with educational institutions and recruitment agencies to attract top talent. Employee Relations: Address employee concerns and grievances promptly and professionally, providing guidance and resolution. Foster a positive work environment by promoting employee engagement, satisfaction, and retention. Organize and facilitate employee engagement activities, including team-building events and recognition programs. Performance Management: Implement and manage performance appraisal systems to evaluate employee performance effectively. Provide coaching and support to managers and employees on performance management and development. Identify training and development needs and coordinate relevant training programs to enhance employee skills. Compliance and Policy Management: Ensure compliance with labor laws, regulations, and hospital policies. Develop, update, and implement HR policies and procedures in line with organizational goals and legal requirements. Conduct regular audits to ensure adherence to HR policies and compliance standards. Payroll and Salary Administration: Oversee the payroll process, ensuring accurate and timely salary disbursements. Manage employee compensation, including salary structures, bonuses, and incentives. Ensure compliance with statutory requirements related to payroll, such as income tax, provident fund, and other deductions. Grievance Handling: Establish and manage a grievance redressal system for employees. Investigate and resolve employee grievances in a fair and timely manner. Ensure that grievance handling processes are transparent, consistent, and in line with organizational policies. Compensation and Benefits: Oversee the administration of compensation and benefits programs, ensuring competitive and equitable remuneration. Conduct salary benchmarking and review compensation structures to attract and retain talent. Manage employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and leave policies. HR Information Systems (HRIS): Maintain and update HR records in the HRIS, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality. Generate reports and analyze HR data to support decision-making and strategic planning. Streamline HR processes through the effective use of HRIS and other technology tools. Employee Development: Identify and implement professional development programs to enhance employee skills and career growth. Coordinate training sessions, workshops, and seminars to address skill gaps and promote continuous learning. Develop succession planning strategies to ensure a pipeline of talent for key positions. HR Strategy and Planning: Contribute to the development and implementation of HR strategies aligned with the hospitals goals and objectives. Participate in strategic planning meetings and provide input on HR-related matters. Monitor HR metrics and KPIs to evaluate the effectiveness of HR initiatives and programs. Qualifications: Masters degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. HR certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is preferred. Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in human resource management, with a focus on recruitment, employee relations, payroll, and compliance with labor laws. Strong knowledge of labor laws, regulations, and HR best practices. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with employees at all levels. Proven experience in conflict resolution, performance management, and employee engagement. Proficiency in HRIS and other HR-related software applications. Strong organizational and multitasking abilities, with attention to detail and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively. Demonstrated ability to develop and implement HR policies and procedures. Commitment to maintaining confidentiality and ethical conduct in all HR activities. Flexibility to adapt to changing organizational needs and priorities. Join our team at Graphic Era Institute of Medical Sciences Hospital and play a pivotal role in shaping our human resources practices. As a Human Resource Executive, you will contribute to creating a positive and productive work environment, supporting our mission to deliver exceptional healthcare services.

column2: Job Title - HR Lead Experience - 8 - 15 years  Location Gurgaon, Udhyog Vihar Job Summary: The HR Lead will oversee all human resource functions, focusing on creating a Centre of Excellence (CoE) for HR processes and acting as a strategic HR Business Partner (HRBP). This role involves driving training and development, talent management, employee engagement, and aligning HR initiatives with business goals. The HR Lead will collaborate closely with business leaders to support and drive organizational effectiveness. Key Responsibilities: Centre of Excellence (CoE) Responsibilities: Develop and implement best practices in HR processes and systems to create a Centre of Excellence. Ensure the standardization and optimization of HR processes across the organization. Drive continuous improvement initiatives within the HR function. Lead special HR projects and initiatives to enhance organizational effectiveness. Training and Learning Development: Design, implement, and manage comprehensive training programs that enhance employee skills and performance. Assess training needs through surveys, interviews, and consultations with managers. Monitor and evaluate training programs to ensure they are effective and align with business objectives. Stay updated with the latest trends in training and development and integrate them into the company's practices. Talent Management: Develop and implement strategies for talent acquisition, development, and retention. Oversee the performance management process, ensuring it is effective and aligned with business goals. Create and maintain career development programs and succession planning processes. Identify high-potential employees and provide them with tailored development opportunities. HR Business Partner (HRBP) Responsibilities: Act as a strategic partner to business leaders, understanding their needs and providing tailored HR solutions. Support business units in organizational design, workforce planning, and change management. Provide expert advice on HR policies, procedures, and best practices. Collaborate with business leaders to align HR initiatives with business strategies and goals. HR Strategy and Operations: Collaborate with senior management to develop HR strategies that support business objectives. Ensure compliance with all relevant labor laws and regulations. Oversee the HR team in managing daily HR operations, including recruitment, onboarding, payroll, and employee relations. Utilize HR metrics and analytics to drive data-informed decisions and improvements. Leadership and Team Management: Lead and mentor the HR team, promoting a culture of high performance and continuous learning. Facilitate effective communication within the HR team and across the organization. Manage the HR budget effectively, ensuring cost-efficient utilization of resources. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field; Master?? degree preferred. Minimum of 8 years of experience in HR, with at least 3 years in a leadership role. Proven experience in training and development, talent management, and employee engagement. Strong knowledge of HR best practices and labor laws. Experience in acting as an HR business partner, supporting business leaders and influencing strategy. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills. Proficient in HR software and tools. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple priorities. column2: THE POSITION The Shiv Nadar School seeks a creative People & Culture Partner at the Core team who is competent, passionate, and dedicated to bringing in change and innovation within the education sector.? The P&C Partner will be responsible for managing the overall People & Culture strategies and practices across all campuses of Shiv Nadar School along with strengthening the existing processes and operations with support to all campus P&C Team.? The P&C partner must have a progressive mindset with the ability to translate vision into reality through a strong execution orientation and proven track record of delivery. This role largely requires the appointed person to collaborate closely with school stakeholders to drive People & Culture Practices. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES RECRUITMENT, TALENT MANAGEMENT AND RETENTION 1. Oversee manpower planning and requisition for school campuses with campus People and Culture team. 2. Oversee manpower deployment as per organogram. 3. Build relationships with placement firms, take lead on leadership hiring and be actively involved in interviews of senior hires with sourcing, hiring, selection as per requirements. 4. Manage attrition and devise measures to promote retention of staff. 5. Maintain a succession plan for all the schools and departments and discuss this on a continuous basis with respective Principals and Department Heads. 6. Will be the custodian of all P&C policies related to recruitment, talent development, management and retention. ON BOARDING & INDUCTION 1. Oversee on-boarding plan and schedule for new employees at campuses with P&C teams. 2. Facilitate induction and on-boarding process for new employees across campuses in collaboration with P&C teams. 3. Facilitate meetings and introduction to stakeholders as per induction plan for Senior Leadership roles. EMPLOYEE ENGAGEMENT, COMMUNICATION, REWARD & RECOGNITION 1. Facilitate employee engagement initiatives at campuses in collaboration with central and school P&C teams. 2. Create and drive R&R initiatives and events for entire Shiv Nadar School community across all campuses. HUMAN RESOURCES POLICY 1. Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law and advise the senior management of the organization on the necessary changes in policy, practice, and resources. 2. From time to time bring about improvements in internal HR systems and processes to build efficiency and robustness in all HR activities. 3. Monitor and ensure all policies and procedures are up to date and the organization is compliant with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations; review and modify policies and practices to maintain compliance and recommend best practices. 4. Have oversight and ensure policies are implemented appropriately across the organization. 5. Conduct research and analysis of organizational trends including review of reports and metrics from the organizations human resource information system (HRIS) or talent management system. PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT 1. Design and deliver initiatives which foster a high-performance culture, including that of reward and recognition of high performers. 2. Coordinate the performance management of employees and ensure all Job Descriptions are kept up to date and create new JDs as and when necessary. 3. Ensure appraisal cycle is completed within the stipulated timeframe across campuses. 4. Chalk out strategies for putting in place a robust performance support plan. TRAINING / LEARNING & DEVELOPMENT 1. Oversee and support training needs analysis for all staff and design and implement a training plan with input from department heads and school teams. 2. Design models / opportunities to develop latent interest, talents and qualities of staff that will be beneficial to organizational growth. 3. Facilitate professional development, training, and certification activities for People and Culture employees. EXPERIENCE AND COMPETENCIES EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION A Post Graduate degree from a recognized B school in HR with 7-10 years of relevant work experience in roles with similar responsibilities as outlined in this job description. MUST HAVES 1. Minimum 7-10 years of full time HR experience. Experience in educational ecosystem is an added advantage. 2. Awareness of Indian and state employment laws and compliances. 3. Excellent communication skills (must) with ability to communicate fluently and effectively in English, Hindi. 4. Proven ability to work effectively with people from all cultures and backgrounds 5. Experience with ERP software such as SAP, PeopleSoft, Oracle, RAMCO etc. will be an added advantage. 6. Proficiency in Microsoft Office or similar products. COMPETENCIES 1. Creative thinker & strategist and a problem solver 2. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships. 3. Flexibility and openness in operating style to adapt to change and seize opportunities that come with shifts in priorities. 4. Proficiency in Microsoft Office or similar products

column2: Role & responsibilities  We are looking for a skilled and detail-oriented Workday Reporting Analyst to join our Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Workday reporting tools and a passion for transforming data into actionable insights. As a Workday Reporting Analyst, you will play a critical role in supporting our HR and business objectives by developing, maintaining, and optimizing Workday reports and analytics. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with HR and business stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and translate them into effective Workday reports and dashboards. Develop and maintain standard and ad-hoc reports using Workday Report Writer, Workday Prism Analytics, and other reporting tools within the Workday platform. Design and configure complex Workday calculated fields, custom objects, and data sources to support reporting needs Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency within Workday reports by performing data validation and quality checks. Analyze HR data trends, metrics, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify insights and actionable recommendations for HR and business leaders. Collaborate with HRIS team members to optimize Workday data structures, security, and integrations to support reporting requirements. Provide training and support to HR and end-users on Workday reporting tools, best practices, and data visualization techniques. Stay current with Workday releases, updates, and new reporting features to enhance reporting capabilities and efficiency. Participate in cross-functional projects and initiatives to improve HRIS processes, data governance, and reporting infrastructure. Document reporting requirements, processes, and solutions for knowledge sharing and future reference. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Business Administration, Human Resources, or related field. Minimum of 2 years of experience working with Workday reporting tools, including Report Writer, Workday Prism Analytics, and calculated fields. Strong proficiency in data analysis, visualization, and reporting techniques, with the ability to translate complex data into meaningful insights. Experience in HRIS administration and understanding of HR processes, data structures, and best practices. Advanced Excel skills and familiarity with SQL or other data querying languages preferred. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Join our team and be part of a collaborative environment where you can make a meaningful impact by leveraging Workday reporting capabilities to drive HR and business decisions. If you are passionate about data analytics and thrive in a dynamic setting, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
column11: Workday, HR Analytics, Power Bi, HRIS, Advanced Excel
